Can't wait to get back to Sydney and get stoned by the Sydney Stone again, now that's a stone.
It's just a stone behind some glass. There is a helpful sign on the wall nearby explaining what it's about.
This is a fabulous stone, although it is not as good as the fifth stone from the left corner (two up) in the west wall of St. James Church in Thornham.
Great company!
Brilliant and iconic building, truly the original skyscraper of the City of London
A misty morning walk to the Gherkin
子彈型建築，是西堤區金融中心的蘇黎世保險總部（Swiss Re Headquaters），180公尺高，外觀完全採用玻璃，內部以斜對支撐結構，製造沒柱子的樓板空間，非常環保。
Muy criticado en sus únicos por su forma tan peculiar,  pero te acostumbras a la larga. Sobre todo si pasas por ahí seguido.

This building is so posh! Quick escalators and security on site at the escalator points. Good mix of restaurants on the ground floor for a quick bite or lunch. Reception staff are courteous and welcoming. Security check points as well before speaking to reception.
This building makes you feel like if you are in a futuristic movie... amazing place and amazing views.
Stunning building inside and out! Had the privilege of working there for two days before spring. Awesome vibe amongst the workers.
Nice place impressive lifts and the view is a wonderful.
Beautiful and standing tall building, easy 5 stars to caracterize it. Even famous producers/and filmes making companies choose it to shoot some movies scenes around.

Some hilarious baysic B8 reviews on here.

It’s a phenomenal place, it is inclusive, beautiful, has our door and indoor spots, water works, theatre, music, cinema, art, shops and places to eat.

Even coming here on a sunny day and just to relax is lovely.

The conservatory is only open Sundays but totally worth a visit.

Some staff may have an airiness issue as they think they work in the best place in the world but that’s rare, everyone I’ve spoken to here has been friendly and polite.

The overall structure is beautiful and interesting but look further at the little details as they are amazing.

Took away points as I am a member of corporate membership with the Barbican and incompetent staff failed to honour all the terms and whilst ignorance is understandable for the staff member to lie is certainly is not, or to ignore the Barbican issued corporate membership card and the details written on it.
Good place to hang out by the lakes especially when sunny and both the hall and theatre put on some good shows. 
Some of the exhibits outside that can be quite good, although some may have quite a queue like "Rain" or can be a trifle expensive.
Conservatory, which is free is open Sundays and some bank holidays and certainly worth a visit. Nice to see the water birds there including a heron which is a regular visitor, maybe from Regents Park

When you book a concert make sure you get in early, get a quick buffet dinner in the canteen an then just sit in the lobby and wait for the show or go and browse the arts shop.

After the bridge, continue along your right until you reach the stairs of the Defoe Building (see picture). Take the left stairs, then turn right and continue walking along the Defoe building for 200 meters. Take the stairs down and you're at the Lakeside Entrance.

I loved this place, many different spaces for different purposes. Only sometimes when busy some areas are left dirty.  Did you know sometimes there are stage plays available  at affordable prices. The staff were efficient.

Beautiful location but service makes Parisien waiter look good.....
When the serving staff at the central bar deem to acknowledge your existence (10 minutes in my case with a half full bar) the presentation is spot on.
Perhaps if the service wasn't included the staff would try harder and probably get bigger tips too!!
Lovely Grand Cafe setting. Very upmarket shops too. An overall fantastic experience!

Nice place with some high-end, though not exclusive shopping and dining. Especially good if you have more money than sense or just want to show off a little. Bit of a tourist trap in some sense, but food and drinks are decent.
Historic building next to the Bank of England. High End shopping with excellent dining.
This is a great venue in the City.  A Fortnum and Masons Art Deco bar, was not was I was expecting! I only stopped for a post work tipple , but will be sure to sample the menu on my next visit.

I have used the Buttery almost every Friday since changing jobs last year, to get the weekly bacon butty which were incredibly good value (£1.50)! The staff were always warm and friendly and even put their faith in me the first time when I had no cash! 

It was therefore very sad to read this morning that they have closed down due to the Crossrail disruption which will have inevitably affected footfall. I truly hope they will turn up again someone round the corner soon, but God help them with the ground rents!

It's friendly, the food is served very quickly and the portions are generous. It's a little on the expensive side but to be honest, no more so than other places in the area. Get there early though as they do tend to run out of things eg. after 2pm there may be no jacket potatoes left!

For the area, this is definitely the best value place to eat.

The food is good and the service really friendly. Great place to have a lunchtime gossip with friends and colleagues!!!

Awesome cafe that serves a wide variety of food from made to order sandwiches, several pasta dishes, other hot food like chicken or scampi and chips and daily specials e.g. homemade shepherds pie. Staff are very friendly and helpful, and the prices are very reasonable for this area!
Great lunch spot - Very friendly staff and reasonable prices. You should try the chicken escalope with cheese in a brown bap - but only if you are really hungry!

My wife and I visited during lunch on a Friday, expecting it to be busy. However, there were very few people here. As a result service was very good and our food came in good time (I’m not sure how it is during busier periods). 

We both got the lunch deal, which is essentially a free drink with your meal. I think it represents pretty good value, as I got a burger/fries and milkshake for £10. 

The milkshake was very tasty and is certainly recommended. The food itself was of a good standard, though not earth shattering in it’s quality. 

You can eat in or get take away. 

One negative: a kitchen porter brought trolleys of produce through the eating area on several occasions. The atmosphere isn’t exactly classic Americana already, but this intrusion was quite noisy (and surely not standard practice for restaurants).

I've been coming to this place on and off for a couple of years...mainly getting take away. Food is good. But the milkshakes are the  BEST...the  strawberry milk shake I LOVE and drive from SE London to get it. It's amazing. 😍 wish they did bigger sizes. 😊 anyway...there is a dude that works there. He is amazing...so friendly and provides excellent customer service. But don't know how name. Slim with an accent. He is awsome hes been there for years. Security team are polite and professional. Try the milk shakes. All different flavours...massive  selection.

We came on a Friday afternoon for lunch and were able to get the weekday lunch deal. For £7.99, you get a main, one side, one dip and a drink (shakes are a separate category and will cost you a bit more). I got the cloudy lemonade and OMG garlic chicken wrap with the burger dipping sauce and homemade coleslaw. The lemonade and chicken wrap were delicious, though I did forget to ask about removing the red onions, as I’m not a fan of raw onions. The coleslaw had tons of red onions, which I didn’t know, and some pieces were not sliced thinly enough, making it very overpowering. The burger dipping sauce was so-so. It seemed to be mayonnaise mixed with other mystery sauces. Not bad, but I preferred the garlic mayo sauce in my wrap, so I didn’t use the dip much. My husband liked dipping his fries in it, though. 

The place was a little dark and quite green—literally, and the music did not evoke the atmosphere of an American diner, but it was unique and funky. Also, I noticed that there were vegan options, so it’s nice to know of a place where I can take my vegan friends.

I love the Oreo milkshake and wings here, I've been coming here on and off for years. As much as I love the food and drinks, it is not very child or disability friendly. You have to go down stairs and has no lift and no staff upstairs to ask for help. Also there's no free parking at all, with people often getting tickets on their cars. It's not somewhere where you can go in and out.

Great place. You go in and down some stairs to an underground gem. Good food. The milkshakes are second to none!  Friendly staff charged my phone and helped me get a taxi because buses weren't running.  So glad I went. A great London memory.

I’ve been there today for an afternoon tea. I was looking for something more casual. All the other afternoon teas were requiring formal dress code.
So, the food was delicious. The teas, amazing! A great variety. 
The price was awesome and the service outstanding!
The Indian guy who works there is amazing. Very friendly. Made us feel very welcomed.
I really appreciate it. I’ve have a great afternoon!
I’ll be back in my next tip to London

I just start to work in this area recently.  To a Tea is a lovely place, offering fresh yummy salads and varieties of tea at the really reasonble price.  I highly reccomend anyone who's near by or works near by to pop in and give a try.

Rather disappointing visit, I'm afraid. Amongst other things, it turns out that the "Poached Eggs" (definitely pictured on the iPad menus as multiple poached eggs with some sides) actually comes as a single egg in the middle of an big plate - I asked whether I had ordered wrong and was told "that's how it comes" or similar, which seems a little... misleading. Whilst there are comfy seats, the location is convenient and the coffee isn't too bad I am not sure I will return.

Poped in for the quick grab and go breakfast as I walk past them on my way to work everyday. Find out they do very simple breakfast these days. Their scrambled egg with bacon is the must have. I am pleased to see them doing very simple breakfast pots and sandwiches. The good thing about this place is its very quick and there is not queue at all, seems quiet all the time as people certainly would not know that they do breakfast and lunches. definitely they have the best tea in london.
Lovely place - stopped off for a quick drink. nice quick service too.

When you first walk into the room it is very small but it's clean, comfy and nice place to be.. Shower was really good and comfy bed.. Bad points, no kettle and only one way of the bed.. I would recommend tho

I love this hotel. I love the concept and it’s style. Such a brilliant brand owned by the same people who run Premier Inn. I love that they have cheaper rooms suitable for 1 or 2 people if you want somewhere to bunk down for a night. But you can book bigger rooms with more space if you are staying longer. The rooms are modern, fresh and most of all clean. Spotless in fact. I stayed here for my 40th and when the staff found out they left a lovely little gift and note in my room which was totally unexpected but very welcomed. Generally they’re a very friendly bunch and I always make a point of having this or another hub hotel in the city my staying point. I wouldn’t go anywhere else.
I loved this concept of the Premier inn hotel. I enjoyed staying there. Rooms were modern and clean. Location is very good, a few steps from the tower bridge metro station.

Speedy check in and out staff are friendly and fast at getting things done. Rooms are as they say on the tin. Small with shower and toilet great for a short city trip for business or site  seeing. Well located for the tower of London tower bridge etc. And close to circle and district line tube station at tower hill. Rooms are well kept clean and modern. Have stayed here twice now will stay against. When next in London

Amazing value for such a good location, near the Tower of London. Exceptionally friendly and helpful staff, exceptionally comfortable bed, beautifully designed room and state-of-the-art technology that makes one's stay much more enjoyable. Delicious breakfast in the attractive café. My room had a great view of H.M.S. Belfast and The Shard.
Enjoyed drinks here with some colleagues after work. You would struggle to find it as it is down an alley but it is quite a find. Really nice chilled atmosphere.

Brilliant place to go to, food is lovely and service is great.
Unfortunately with the biggest respect towards to their staff one of the staff member had a very strong unpleasant smell that we had to put up with for the time we were there.
Also silver service should not allow waiters to chew their nails front of costumers, specially serving food with those hands.
I think they just need to train and observe their staff better otherwise i would consider to return and recommend it to friends!

Nice pub upstairs with a lovely restaurant downstairs, relatively posh. Food is lovely, we had the 3 course Christmas meal. Really nice food, good quantity. Nice wine and service was brilliant. Would definitely return
A great Scottish pub in the heart of London.  It's a little hard to find  if you don't know what you are looking for. Pay attention to the signage. It's down a seemingly inocuous alleyway.
Lovely interior, gorgeous steak, and there was a piano man playing, which was a great touch. I was very impressed by the food and service.
Nice old city bar. Sandra and Vanessa made me feel welcome. Also, it was good to see old city people thinking at the bar-shout out Ashley
The food is actually good. But the service is absolutely abysmal. The waiting staff was entirely disoriented, absent, forgot orders, was unable to advise on anything or make cocktails.

Fabulous gin collection and splendid oysters. My favourite fish restaurant in the city of London. I've been coming back to this restaurant for many years and will continue to do so. Always made to feel welcome. Thanks, Mr Sharpe
We had a good time for Burns night. Bagpipe, nice haggis, whisky aplenty. All the ceremonials included.
Good food, service and excellent selection of wines.  Good value themed night dinners

Very much a meat eater's paradise but then that's how they set out their stall so you can't complain at the lack of vegetarian options. Several excellent specials on the board today but get in early or they soon disappear. Desserts are very much of the school dinners type enjoyed by City gents. Prices are very reasonable for the location and associated clientele though vegetables tend to be extra unless a key part of the dish. Serving staff both friendly and entertaining.
Well it was not all bad If you want a quiet lunch don't go there, but if you don't mind the nose then give to a try! the food was very good! well worth the time!
Best place for meat 🥩 in the city, great breakfast and lunch with  good choice of options

Traditional British fare (with a sausage on the side) including all the favourites: roast beef & Yorkshire pud, steak @ kidney pie to name just a few. Apple crumble! Try the stewed cheese if you are still hungry. Great selection of drinks too. Very friendly and efficient service with a smile. Looking forward to my return.

Great City institution. 

The reviews on here are broadly a good reflection of the reality: 

If you're looking for "lunch with the boys", with wholesome grub washed down with a pint / bottle of claret, and you're not pressed for time, then you'll love this place. 

However, if you're looking to nip out for a lighter or more refined lunch in a quieter atmosphere before getting back to the office promptly for an important meeting, this place won't fit the bill.

The stereotype around this gets stronger towards the end of the week and at busy seasons e.g. just before Christmas.

Not enough staff!!
So busy and the waitress was taking the orders and delivering food all on her own. I was on the ground floor so can only make comments in relation to that. The food was basic. Very expensive for what it was. The music was very loud and maybe it would be good for groups or just having a drink. Definitely better as a bar. I think the worst thing is that no one was there when you entered to tell you about the different floors. I probably would have been better or a floor higher up that was more focused on food but didn't know it existed when I arrived even though there is a desk where someone technically should be to seat you and tell you about the restaurant. Disappointed!

Eaten here a few times. The food and wine choices are excellent and it's quite unique in the way you have levels of dining. The ground floor is basically a pie shop (good pies) with a bar. Next up is a more standard dining experience, with a really pleasant menu. Top floor is the top end of the scale with great views through the glass "wall". It's very steak focused and they do it very well.

Great, eclectic restaurant/bar/social venue. Food is good, layout is fun. If you don't want another boring chain, and do want somewhere where you can even get breakfast and eat any time, this is a great venue to pick. Think fun with atmosphere rather than refined.

Had a great night out last night one of my friend's had a leaving do, it was amazing.  The atmosphere  great and the music was fantastic it would reccomend it to all my friends. We were chatting, dancing, laughing and enjoying the company of the group that was there.

Loved this modern British gastropub - especially the top level! The Scottish Cottage Pie was incredible, and they do a great job with most all of their meat-focused dishes, as they're literally across the street from the meat packing district. Enjoy!
The open mic here has a great vibe and the sound of the building is amazing.
Great church with a great community that meets here on Sunday mornings!
Very interesting church with a crypt with Roman remains...
Bardzo ciekawy kościół. Ładne wnętrze.

Such a lovely little restaurant for a veggie meal. So much choice and it was absolutely delicious.  Vegan options also available and, whilst I didn't have any myself, the desserts looked amazing. Service was friendly, the walnut bread and olive oil was yummy and it's not too expensive.  A great choice!
Beautiful vegetarian and vegan food! Very friendly staff and cute setting. Would highly recommend.

Having been a regular when I worked round the corner in Bunhill Row for several years, a welcome return visit after a goodly while. Still a simple and good menu, succinct winelist and friendly service. Great that nothing has changed here in that time. Sometimes there's just no need to change.
Overpriced for what it is and food not good quality, nor with much taste nor well balanced
Just Don't!  From the reviews here it looks like people have never eaten.  Everything is from a box and reheated in a microwave/oven.
Enjoyed walking through this beautiful city and enjoyed this area. So glad I came across it. The beautiful statues fill the streets and areas. So wonderful to walk around and get to the area.
Nice spot to take a moment and reflect on live life and relationships. The scenery is nice especially in the spring and summer. Perfect place for a date

Nice little park with a lot of food options. Find the Halal cart across the street and pause in the meditation garden with St. Ignatius. There's also a tiny splash park. If you eat at Fuel Pizza make sure they really heat your slice. (Fuel Pizza on Central Ave is much better, go there if you can)... Back to the park though. It's a neat little picturesque piece of Uptown. It's not a "playground"...but you can eat, walk your dog, and stretch your legs.
The green is beautiful.  Do not come in from college, use the parking deck entrance on tryon
Fantastic space. Sculptures to enjoy. Beautiful gardens and plenty of green grass on which the kiddos can roll around

Not enough staff!!
So busy and the waitress was taking the orders and delivering food all on her own. I was on the ground floor so can only make comments in relation to that. The food was basic. Very expensive for what it was. The music was very loud and maybe it would be good for groups or just having a drink. Definitely better as a bar. I think the worst thing is that no one was there when you entered to tell you about the different floors. I probably would have been better or a floor higher up that was more focused on food but didn't know it existed when I arrived even though there is a desk where someone technically should be to seat you and tell you about the restaurant. Disappointed!

Eaten here a few times. The food and wine choices are excellent and it's quite unique in the way you have levels of dining. The ground floor is basically a pie shop (good pies) with a bar. Next up is a more standard dining experience, with a really pleasant menu. Top floor is the top end of the scale with great views through the glass "wall". It's very steak focused and they do it very well.

Great, eclectic restaurant/bar/social venue. Food is good, layout is fun. If you don't want another boring chain, and do want somewhere where you can even get breakfast and eat any time, this is a great venue to pick. Think fun with atmosphere rather than refined.

Had a great night out last night one of my friend's had a leaving do, it was amazing.  The atmosphere  great and the music was fantastic it would reccomend it to all my friends. We were chatting, dancing, laughing and enjoying the company of the group that was there.

Loved this modern British gastropub - especially the top level! The Scottish Cottage Pie was incredible, and they do a great job with most all of their meat-focused dishes, as they're literally across the street from the meat packing district. Enjoy!
Nice spot, in the heart of the city, a majestic neighborhood you can enjoy through their windows. Good prices. Clean. Old style. Not so spacious.
Reasonable prices and clean beer lines make this little pub  excellent choice for "After work pint". Two dart boards, pool tables and even poker room downstairs... Proper man cave.
Not a tourist place at all. Probably one of the last few city haunts that hasn't been chained

I organised a team drinks evening and the staff were great. They really looked after us all night. Lovely location, tucked away so not overly crowded like the rest of the bars in the area. Reasonable prices and good selection of drafts.
Beer was good, service was good, food was unfortunately awful. Not a great idea to serve chips that are the size as a whole potato. Fish was small, overcooked and very dry.
It’s a good train station and some unique views from the platform if you walk to the end. Great restaurant in the alleyways below the station!

Looks good on the outside, not so wow on the inside, but they have places to eat and drink, public toilets (you have to pay). The main reason I give it 5 stars is that the trains take you to lots of different locations.

As stations go it is pretty good. There are plenty of info boards to look at departures and the ticket collection machines are close to the gates, unlike london Bridge. The staff are helpful and friendly and there are plenty of shops around to buy food etc.
 The underground attached does have the most consistent homeless community out of all stations. It thereband smells worse for wear, but that's London.

Not my favourite London rail terminus. At times access to the Underground can be restricted, and although the pebble stone forecourt is pretty and convenient for taxis, the subterranean interior - especially if you leave the station from the tube stop - nearly always reeks of urine, and at times is peopled by vagrants. An ugly station to be honest and not as many eating and shopping options as Kings Cross.

Gary working at the gates was really nice and super helpful in showing me cheaper weekly and monthly pricing for your Oyster card. Signage is also really good when looking for National Gallery, National Portrait Gallery etc.

Focused on road-based public transport, not much about the river or cycling. Would be nice if you could explore the exhibits a bit more, but interesting to wander around. Generous play area, and you can use your ticket for a full year!

Great London Transport Museum covering everything from the river, horse and cart, bus, train and tube history in and around greater London. Good mix of things to do for all ages. Expensive tickets but if you pick up a leaflet at most main train stations you can get two for one offers. If not ask the friendly staff if they have any spares. Tickets are valid for a year and you can gift aid to help them too.

I only really went because my partner is really into public transport and its history. However, I did find the pricing was very steep and I probably wouldn't pay to go again. I spent the best part of 30 minutes in there and then I left.
Brilliant museum, we were pleasantly surprised by the experience. I thought it was a little expensive at first but it's definitely worth it. Kids loved it! Worth going if you are on a trip to London!
Pretty decent. Price of admission is £18 but the ticket lasts for a year. Good place for kids it seems as they were basically oozing out of the walls. Has a little art gallery that is very cute.
Surprised by some of these reviews - you’ll never please everyone. Genuinely the best cookies I’ve ever tasted, bought my first box last week and will definitely be back for more!
We love Bens cookies and they had a fab range of flavours here
Great cookies and coffees really worked well. I lived the peanut butter cookie, a real treat
Quite possibly the tastiest cookie I've ever had! Expensive, but to be expected.

Great for cookies. Moist and freshly baked. Lots of variety. 

The milkshakes are average and I wouldn’t have again. But the cookies are a must 👍🏼👍🏼

Excellent little cafe come bakery just off High Street Kensington. Have passed this place hundreds of times on my way to work but never tried it. Today I popped in and had a big wedge of carrot cake with a delightful cup of Earl grey tea. The best thing about this place is that it is quiet, yes no screaming kids. Sheer Bliss. Highly recommended and the lady who served me was very pleasant. They also have a clean toilet on the ground floor. Will definitely be back.
So lovely to had cup of coffee and mini cupcakes 💙💙

What brilliant happenstance! I just searched "coffee" on our way back to the hotel from the Design Museum and Maps suggested here! We had a delicious latte and Earl Grey tea and FABULOUS cupcakes (cookie dough and red velvet). You'll love it!
The friendly staff make us feel at home.
A really cute little place just off the high street. Friendly staff and a great place to relax.

Lunch at Brown's was a great pleasure. Cocktails were delicious, the menu offered a practical and well considered choice and the service was just right. Although the location is excellent for shopping, we chose to focus on enjoying the restaurant.

Nice bar. Can get busy, but not too difficult to get a table, even on a Saturday evening. Prices are reasonable, and service is  friendly and quick. Rustic and fashionable interior / seating area. We'll situated around several bars and restaurants. Close to the docks, too.

Good food, reasonably priced, nice staff.  Had the breakfast, which was lovely, it could have done with more pudding and the option to buy a side of chips would have been great but over all the food was of great quality and the venue was clean and well kept. Background music playlist was jazz covers of modern pop songs (very cool)

I also left a sum of money behind me and i returned an hour later, staff had put it away in the safe for me. Thanks guys
Lovely lunch. Excellent service and a really nice atmosphere. Highly recommended

Liverpool one:,Ethan our waiter was brilliant. Christmas day and he was really friendly and helpful. Thanks for the excellent service  Ethan. Food was lovely and  would definitely recommend browns. Thanks for finding my jumper and getting it to me.

A fantastic meal. We turned up unannounced and room was made for us within 5 minutes. Brilliant food, excellent service. We had a great mixed of starters and pretty much every type of main. No disappointments. Will recommend and likely return.

Traditional kebab in a trendy setting with nice atmosphere. Good menu at reasonable prices. Fondou dip for chips is inspired but too much salt on their fries sadly. Otherwise food was great. Downstairs they have two mock up traditional kebab house shop fronts presumably for private events. Would be a good location for a small party. Baby friendly and nice staff.

Fancy kebab place! Traditional recipes with a modern twist. Nice flavours in general, the wrap with the pork and the dish with the aubergine are great. Nice interior, friendly staff. Positive experience
Top food at a reasonable price! Enjoyed the ambience and service was impeccable! Thank you for a great meal...will be back soon.

I been at Maison Bab for dinner with my boyfriend. The food was great, the best kebab I ever had on my life!!high quality ingredients, service was fast, waitress really friendly and professional. Great cocktails too! Highly recommended!

Top place in the heart of London, just a hop, skip and a jump from Covent Garden station. Exceptional staff, great food and a lively atmosphere. 'Tequila it makes me happy, con tequila it feels fine', as the song goes. Can't wait to come back! Cheers to Carlos, Tony and team :)

On my most recent visit the food was delicious which was a surprise because we'd previously booked the place for a Xmas team dinner and no one enjoyed it. Maybe there's a new chef or a new menu - either way, we were really impressed this time round.

The place is really noisy from about 6pm so it's not great for a catch up with friends. It also gets really hot, even on a winter day. Staff had to get giant fans out to cool the place down and this is in February.

Great food and great service. This place has a really good feel to it. The staff are very polite and helpful.  There is a good Mexican menu with a good bit of choice. Also got a gluten free menu. They add a service charge by default of 12.5% but that's the norm in London.  Nice and I'd really recommend it

I went for a work do and had a great time. We were perched up and to the left of the main W Terence within our own little area. We didn’t sit down and eat but had nachos and other Mexican finger food delivered in rounds. The staff were very attentive with the drink bring new buckets of beers quickly once the batch had been drained

One thing I miss from home in the States is decent Mexican food!! Found Cafe Pacifico online and had to try it. Wasn't expecting much as have tried a few Mexican places in London before and been disappointed. Cafe Pacifico exceeded my expectations! The margaritas are superb and they have a wide selection of tequila. As for the good this is as close to authentic Mexican I have had since moving here. I eat there now regularly with my kids and the food is always great and the staff are friendly. It can get busy so you may want to book a table if you are heading there for dinner to avoid waiting. FIVE STARS!!!!!!!
Good food but over crowded and poorly ventillated n air-conditioned. But again, food is great. Orange candy lovers must try this drink.
I really liked Scoop's newly developed menu. Food and dessert both. The variety and pricing is also impressive!!👍 But the service is bit slow.
Can Serve you Several varieties of dishes based on chicken. Nice to visit and pocket saving too
Very nice place. Reasonable price. Quick service.

Loved this place and its decoration. 💞
The mouthwatering food and drinks are delicious and the environment is beautiful.😊
Lot of combo options at reasonable price in Chinese and Mughal dishes. 💕
Recommended to visit there once when you are in Kolkata💞

Hurrah for one of London’s most historically theatrical restaurants. It has moved from its original location & brought to the new location its charm & ambiance. Since the 80’s I have dined here, with my show biz friends, first dates with my latest crush & business partners to close a deal. With the gentle piano music, still photography on the walls of some of entertainments best artist on the wall & posters from shows that turned the fortunes of some of our greatest producers, both in the west end & Broadway. When you go to the bathroom, you will see some of London’s finest collections of still photography with the great Joe Allen himself from the New York Restaurant. The bathrooms are a joy to visit. The menu is well thought out, as this is a place to talk, dine & drink. It is open late into the night, as many performers & theatre staff will come here to relax after the show. With the Strand Palace Hotel attached to it, you don’t really need to go home after dinner. You could book in there & in the morning on the Strand there are clothes shops & a pharmacy for toiletries if you have not planned your night there. Very surprised this is not a five star rating on this site. Just goes to prove some are very hard to please even in the best places in London
Lovely restaurant with great food. I had the duck which was lovely. Staff were great and we didn't feel at all rushed. Good for groups of friends and families

Really like this place. Not too expensive but great food done really well with decent sized portions. Good selection of good and drink with the exception of no cider. Service pretty good but occasionally a bit slow... Would recommend and roll go back.

Ask for a Sidecar (brandy and orange juice). Terrific cocktail, terrifically done. Food is reliably solid and service friendly. Sometimes it feels a little too pricey but it's one to come back to over and over. Comfortable.

Beautiful location but service makes Parisien waiter look good.....
When the serving staff at the central bar deem to acknowledge your existence (10 minutes in my case with a half full bar) the presentation is spot on.
Perhaps if the service wasn't included the staff would try harder and probably get bigger tips too!!
Lovely Grand Cafe setting. Very upmarket shops too. An overall fantastic experience!

Nice place with some high-end, though not exclusive shopping and dining. Especially good if you have more money than sense or just want to show off a little. Bit of a tourist trap in some sense, but food and drinks are decent.
Historic building next to the Bank of England. High End shopping with excellent dining.
This is a great venue in the City.  A Fortnum and Masons Art Deco bar, was not was I was expecting! I only stopped for a post work tipple , but will be sure to sample the menu on my next visit.

Pretty good play area for young kids (1-3 years old, I guess) which is free but needs booking ahead of time. They have a soft play area with a bit of climbing and a slide, a big Lego-style block building zone, some water stuff and a train area. Most of it is Docklands-themed. Would be nice if there were a few more things to do and some activities that changed or rotated every once in a while. They have a cafe next to the kids' area which is nice but has one very slow server.

Fantastic museum! Brilliant for kids and adults alike. Excellent displays, well thought out, and friendly staff. Can easily spend the day here. Mudlarks for the children is a great play area (booking a free time slot online advisable). Definitely don't have your lunch at Rum & Sugar next door, there are loads of great options across the river in Canary Wharf, or at Crossrail Plaza.

I've been here 4 times now as I recommend to friends and come back with them. Great place for learning about the sugar/slave trade and the working warehouse on the 3rd floor. 
2nd floor is devoted to WW2 and the Docklands being rebuilt. 

One thing to note - I found it very exhausting trying to do it all in one go so would suggest 2 separate visits

It's free but they ask that you make a contribution

Shall but perfectly formed museum with a great atmosphere throughout. Good for families. If you want to visit the Mudlarks room for the little ones, best to book a slot online the day before. It's free, but you need a ticket.

We live kinda near here and it's definitely high on my recommendation list for pals with kids or without. In fact I'd go so far as to say it is one of my favourite museums in London. The whole museum is really interactive and interesting. Its good that you can take a picnic, there's a small friendly cafe but if Noether of those suits there's heaps of places to eat right near it. My little girl adores this place. There's a chi

Its a wonderful park with something for everyone. It has a great children's playground, with everything you would expect, with swings, sliders...sand pits, climbing frames and more challenging things for bigger kids...there is a skateboard park, and a duck pond. There are gardens full of flowers to enjoy, tennis,bowls and golf, put and play and crazy golf..tea shops toilets and ice cream and a bandstand

Probably the most amazing free outdoor children’s park I’ve ever been to. The range of equipment is vast! Several wonderful jungle gyms, with slides varying from beginners level all the way to this humongous tunnel slide which actually I’d quite like to get on myself!! 

With sandpits and climbing walls, a zip wire and so many swings, two double swings (for two children or an adult and a little one) one fully backed swing, lots of regular ones and even two of those big circle rope ones. 

There is also a cafe with toilets attached however I believe there is a charge for these so bring change.

There is also a nice ratio of sunny to shaded areas.

I’d happily bring the children here one morning with picnic blankets and food and spend the whole day !!

We had very nice time walking around the park. It's big, it's beautiful and have a lot of space for activities. Just take your blanket and picnic basket and head to Victoria Park for a lovely day :)
And Botanical Garden next to it is just magical. Perfect place to spend a day enjoying great weather, beautiful area and walking.

Lovely park for a wall and some fresh air. 
Had a picnic by the duck  pond, with my baby. Lots of ducks for children to feed. Lovely and clean, no litter anywhere,  lots  of benches to sit on.
We never went in the park, as my baby is only 11 weeks, but in time, we will. 
We'll  be back
Fabulous park, something for everyone. Family friendly play area which has a huge range of play equipment for all ages. Also love the botanic gardens and big open spaces for picnics

I really liked the use of negative space to compliment the artwork on display. The bookshop is great as well!

Bonus feature: Big fan of the staircase design, which let's in a lot of natural skylight.

I stopped into the Whitechapel gallery whilst waiting for a friend. The space is very carefully curated & takes advantage of some unique angles. I really liked the use of negative space to compliment the artwork on display. The bookshop is great as well!

Bonus feature: Big fan of the staircase design, which let's in a lot of natural skylight.

Great gallery , beautiful building and  fabulous exhibitions selection! 
Visited  the amazing exhibitions of Collection of Contemporary Art and Sophia Al-Maria.
Highly recommended.

The outside of the gallery was more impressive than the exhibits inside, look up when you are standing outside it is beautiful. The gallery itself features different modern exhibitions throughout the year and we happened to choose a time when nothing seemed to capture our attention.

The gallery didn't have great exhibitions when we were there and it wasn't clear what was open/closed paid/free. It was difficult to actually spot the building especially as it is so hectic outside and all of the buildings around it look quite tired. That being said it's easy enough to get to - just maybe check whats on before you visit.

What an amazing place. Loved the evening. Could do with proper theatre seating though but I guess that'd come at a cost. But who knows they may be able to raise the funds. Food looked OK but unfortunately it was all pizza so not much choice. All in all a beautiful building with a great choice of shows. Worth every penny to visit

Beautiful building, nice atmosphere. I attended a great event - an evening with David Suchet, thus I have most positive impressions. And I had a chance to not only the lobby/bar area, but the concert hall itself. The staff was very helpful. The seats, however, not very comfy and their arrangement does allow a very good view from everywhere. There's still much work to be done with the premises, but the venue promises to be huge success. Wishing them luck with their fundraising for acoustic system.

Wilton's is an historic music hall and known as such because of the varied quality gigs featured there.  However, it's cool semi-restored digs are also a great spot to grab a pint with mates.  It's a favourite of mine.

Wow what a performance of Pirates of Penzance. Exhausted watching. Marvelous show. Excellent in every way. Cast & pianist. Can't wait for next visit. Nice wrap & pavlova too. Thank you for a fab afternoon.
A magical place. The staff are fantastic. The pizzas are out of this world. We loved our visit here so much we booked to see the show again two days later.

Fabulous Italian Restaurant. Their lunchtime menus are suburb. Outside dinning, if the weather permits. The service is quick. The staff are polite and happy. So much better than your food from a local street vendor/caravan.
Good service,  nice atmosphere quiet able to talk. Food tasty, reasonably priced set menu. Shop on site selling lovely Italian pastas sauces meat cheeses and sweet items.

Had such a lovely evening celebrating my daughters birthday as a family. 
The service was great and the staff were so friendly going that extra mile for us as a group. 
Thank you for my daughters birthday gift too
Very kind and lovely food. We had lunch with two regular customers and they've made it a really nice experience for all of us.
Had lunch. Nice place the starter was good and varied. The main dish was so so.

Refined curators of cool,the owners know how to present popular cultural references - authentic, signed prints and collectibles stacked, framed, artfully laid out around the premises. The owners looked busy when I was there but took the time to help answer my questions. Great for one-off memoribilia gifts.
Professional service and incredible collection of things you didn't know you wanted.
All good!
It is a pleasure to purchase books from Peter Harrington. The customer service is impeccable and the selection of books is unmatched.

Inherited some books which included a particular set. Took them to Peter Harringtons  just to get some face to face expert advice and valuation. Despite its prestige I was very warmed by the enthusiasm and assistance given. Thanks

Very inconsistent portion...

Buying their hot pot soup is like a gamble. The portion is different every time I buy the coconut chicken soup. Once, there was no chicken at all. Another time, it was some rice and all soup with barely any chicken and vegetables. Sometimes the soup is only 3/4 full. For £4.49, you will never know what you're getting. Because it's concealed in a solid container, you'll only find out when it's too late... 

Please review your food portion and be consistent, Itsu!
Of all the places we ate in London, we loved itsu the most and was right below our airbnb!
Exceptional customer service, one of the best Itsu branch in London, highly recommended, Raquel was superb!

Food was good but the staff weren't too interested in charging me correctly. I was charged 4 times for an item I only purchased once! I believe I was refunded but I'm. Not really sure as I wasn't given a new receipt. Altogether seemed a bit shady
Great food, great place to sit in.

Expensive and disappointing. 
The service was nice but very slow (missing 2 people they said).
I had 15£ eggs benedict, overcooked.
Great
Výborné
Great location but the quality of their food is worse

This was my first visit to the restaurant after my friends recommendation. Below is my feedback on various parameters.
Ambience: Very Good. I will give 5 * 
Food: Good. I will give 3 to 4* just because some items were warm but not hot
Staff: ok. I will give 2*  because of following reasons:
1. One of my friend's tie was spoiled with Wine by one of staff member.
2. Another member unlit the candle in front of 9 month old causing the baby to cough
3. staff was falling over us to serve rather than coming around 
4. 8 members on the table felt that we were not welcomed in the restaurant
Also, happy hours is for the restaurant, but we were told it's only valid on bar and not Dine are.

Overall, I would go to other Thai restaurants than coming back to Sri Nam.
Loved this place for years but has now closed down.

The restaurant need to learn about VEGETARIANISM:

Beware VEGETARIANS - most of their paste they use contains Shrimp paste.. also, Spring Roll etc all fried in the same oil as non vegetarian food. Poor rating as not true vegetarian despite saying 'V' on the menu

A good place to enjoy the Thai food, as the choice is quite limited for Thai food in Canary Wharf. Been there a few times and always enjoyed the food. Some of the dishes are spicy, which is nice. The interiors look grand and the ambience is nice. Prices are reasonable too.

Food very nice, I think this is the best wagamama branch in Birmingham right next to the bullring. Food is generous with ample portions at this branch, staff even gave us complimentary side as the chef's had made an extra accidentally, which was a nice treat, better than throwing it away. Staff are all happy, enthusiastic and respectful to customers. Food arrives quickly and on time. Highly recommend visiting this branch.

Amazing fusion food. All healthy stuff. Would prefer a seat with a back for this price band of restaurant though. There are proper seats three but three place was full.  Will certainly be going back despite this.

A tasty restaurant where you can enjoy Asian and Japanese inspired dishes to warm you any time of day. The staff are always friendly and welcoming and help make the experience even better. There are other Wagamama's in Birmingham but the Bullring unit is by far the best quality in terms of the location and friendliness of the staff.

Great place, amazing food. Helpful and friendly staff. 
Service is pretty quick too.
Reasonable prices. Win, win win.

This was my first time visiting Wagamama and I must say that I was very impressed.  The service was top notch and the food was very tasty and well presented.  I would definitely eat there again no problem.
Free parking, well stocked store nice staff

Lovely local store. Clean toilets.
Free car park.
Love Waitrose, love this branch, staff are great, etc. But this widgety app thingy with in-store offers only ever sends a notification once I've left the store. So it's a complete waste.
Waitrose continues its quest to be the supermarket with no food. Many items were not available, and the shelves were looking empty. Pick your game up Waitrose
I had problem with machine cashier and was looking for staff for help me.. they were short staff actually!!!

Brilliant service - turned up just before closing but the front of house staff were accommodating, friendly and got our order in with time to spare, as well as providing recommendations as to toppings for our burgers. The main meals were delicious, the camel burger especially was surprisingly sweet and delicate and the buttermilk chicken burger's batter was perfectly crispy and light. The sweet potato fries were a little bit overcooked on the outside (thrice, rather than twice-cooked, maybe!) but overall a brilliant experience in a hidden gem just next to Mile End station.

Nice cosy burger restaurant, with a big variety of burgers. They also have exotic meat in the menu like camel and kangaroo! The cheerful and helpful staff is always appreciated! Lunch special is £7.50, quite good price for a decent meal at Mile End (perfect for students)
Popular local spot, great burgers and choice of 'unusual' cuts of meat, and friendly staff. I'd say the prices were reasonable - they're decent sized portions. Get the onion rings!

This was my second visit the atmosphere is fantastic and the hot wings were amazing both times. Cannot recommend the hot wings enough. Last time I ordered the exotic meat sliders and had a delicious tasting experience with the camel, boar and kangaroo, however this time I ordered the wagyu burger and was disappointed. The burger was much smaller than the bun, a minor issue but no one likes that empty bite with just the bun and the flavour was less than I expected for the price and the name of the beef. A final upside the staff were lovely as always .
Good burgers but not amazing for a restaurant specialized on it. Oily chips and burgers smaller than expected. Friendly staff. Nice deal on Tuesday, Burger+side+beer 10£
Good food, friendly staff. Been here twice now with big group of 12 and we had a great time. Also good to pop in for lovely Lebanese food at good prices. You'll be assured of a warm welcome
Excellent food, I was actually surprised about the quality of this food... definitely recomand this place and I will come back soon

I love, love, love their tabouleh and hummus Kawarma, but all their food is great. They are always quick to deliver and I've been ordering from them for years. I just wish they found a more environmentally friendly packaging for their food and not use so much plastic.
Nice place. Had drink Jalleb.. Really loved it,  tastes like Turkish Delight 👍
This is my absolute favourite place to eat. The lunchtime platter deal is unbeatable. Always a clean plate at the end.
Terrible service for delivery, didn’t turn up, made no effort to contact me and when I called claimed they couldn’t find a driver.

Nothing really to shout about this Indian Restaurant, except that it is very expensive for bland food. The menu appeared diverse at first but doesn't excite, particularly noting how expensive it is, at least £10 for a main, + sides. The starters were flavoursome - spiced mixed grills and giant prawns, but the mains were stodgy. The giant bowls to serve the poppadoms were just bizarre.We went on a Tuesday night and were one of three tables all evening, but we were waiting for long periods to get the waiters attention. Avoid.

I was as excited as a little bean when my dear friend suggested that we get a lovely curry dinner. Mmmm I thought, what a special. Little did I know what awaited my sweet young mouth...
 I ordered my absolute favourite, da onion bhaji but instead received rancid tasting deep-fried cheese samosas. They made me feel all ill and that. Also the chicken was dry and I found a hair in curry.

I have NEVER walked out on a company before.

Until I came to Zeera.

The food was SO bad. The buffet food was so old and reheated poorly. The naan bread chipped my teeth and the drinks were flat.

The waiter was the rudest I ever encountered. Physically YELLING at me for using a bowl at the buffet instead of a plate.

I went with 2 friends when we were caught short when the restaurant we chose was closed.

NEVER again.

Don't do it. From one human to another, nothing good will come of it.
An absolute “NO-GO” the manager is arrogant the food is not very well and too pricey on top; it is one of those Restaurants to avoid! Do not go and waste your time and money !!!

You can't miss it, there's always a queue and damn are those bagels good. For around 30p you can get a plain bagel, and then depending on what you want to add inside - from cream cheese to salmon to salted beef, there's plenty for everyone. Anyhow, highly recommend the latter (just be careful for the mustard, it's not a joke, if you're not into crying because it's spicy (not the right term but you get what I mean), ask them to go slow on the dosage!).
Wow! One of the best salt beef sandwiches I ever had. The portion is very generous. The beef is absolutely delicious. The prices are great. It won't be long until I become a regular. :)

There was quite a long queue during my Sunday afternoon visit, but I was impressed by the efficiency and speed the staff served customers and shuttled them in and out of the place. That said, my tuna bagel was rather oily, which is a shame. The bagel itself, though, was very soft and fluffy. I can definitely see why this place is highly rated for it. I'll visit again, but probably get something plainer.

We went out of our way to get a salt beef bagel, which involved trekking through a pretty big rain storm, and it was definitely worth it! The salt beef bagel with mustard and pickles was just so, SO good - especially for the price! If this place were closer to our hotel I would've returned a few times. The meat was flavorful and tender, while the bagel was soft and seemed freshly baked. I would've given five stars if the people working there were even on iota more friendly, although their attitude does kind of match the whole vibe of the place. Highly recommend this place, even if you have to go out of your way to get here!
Top notch bagels! £4.30 for a huge salt beef bagel with loads of tender beef and tasty pickles with mustard. Definitely worth a visit if you are around Brick lane.

Amazing food, great service. Better to book as can get extremely busy and it's obvious why. The flavours are fab, the choice is vast. Obviously a very happy customer. The place itself is really nice with a cozy, friendly atmosphere. A great place for groups or couples

Amazing food! The only reason it is getting four stars is because our table by the door which had numerous people waiting for tables bumping into us when we were eating. The staff is friendly, but the queue needs to be managed better.

Get the lamb chops!
Super tasty dinner and great time! Love busy places! Means tasty food! Thank you so much for the time and the exceptional lamb chops! For sure will come back soon!

This place is super busy, best to book in advance to get a table. 
The food is awesome and came in good time once ordered.
I'd  definitely go again.
It's a bring your own booze place so you can go grab your own and overall can work out much cheaper then in-house alcohol.
The cost of the food is also extremely reasonable.
A great eating place and so busy. Bring your own alcohol. Been a couple of times. Good for groups rather than couples as the loudness of the the other diners is not too to romantic.
My favourite place ever when in London. The food is lovely but the atmosphere is really special, we have never felt more welcome! The owners banter and charisma is brilliant!

Great Service, Food and Drink!  Absolutely love this place and we were both treated like family.  Fabulous family :)  PS. Thanks for the bread and butter pudding-it was AMAZING!!!  Will definitely return.

As always great food and atmosphere! Made some great friends at the cafe over the years. As always proper cup of tea! Coffee has a great bite but mellow on the palete.
People talk to each other like humans should! If your looking for a hipster joint with fewer interactions this is not the place. This cafe has heart!

We went here on recommendation by a YouTube video. Was a great experience, some real English breakfast and eating with locals! Some tourists, but it's nice its not something really touristic!! Owner and family are nicest people of the world and we will come back if we visit London again!

There is no way that if you are in london and don’t go to this amazing break fast place. It’s a must go place, I had their traditional breakfast and trust me I didn’t want to breath while eating it was that delicious. The owner is very nice that he made changes to the dish in the menu to serve us. Please try their coffee it is the best. Would definitely go back whenever I visit londong again.

Just heartfelt, beautifully cooked tapas. Great wine list. This place is a gem of Hackney.

After going for a glass of wine and a starter somewhere else, we rolled up and had a selection of dishes. Everything that touches that bbq of theirs becomes absolute heaven. The lamb steaks and sardines are laughably good.

Great little Spanish restaurant. Location is just off Columbia flowers market with a couple of tables outside so great when the weather allows. Delicious food and more original than your usual tapas bar. Staff is very friendly too
Delicious food, genrous portions been there few times already and it's definitely one of my favourites in London. Can't wait to go back.

Delicious spanish tapas at reasonable prices. On top of that, the portions are larger than what would you expect in a tapas. Really intimate atmosphere with good music aswell. If you like spanish food, don’t miss this restaurant.
Went Friday for Christmas lunch. Absolutely  fantastic food as always. Great restaurant,  really friendly staff and relaxing. Happy Christmas to all the staff.🎄🤩

What an amazing place. Loved the evening. Could do with proper theatre seating though but I guess that'd come at a cost. But who knows they may be able to raise the funds. Food looked OK but unfortunately it was all pizza so not much choice. All in all a beautiful building with a great choice of shows. Worth every penny to visit

Beautiful building, nice atmosphere. I attended a great event - an evening with David Suchet, thus I have most positive impressions. And I had a chance to not only the lobby/bar area, but the concert hall itself. The staff was very helpful. The seats, however, not very comfy and their arrangement does allow a very good view from everywhere. There's still much work to be done with the premises, but the venue promises to be huge success. Wishing them luck with their fundraising for acoustic system.

Wilton's is an historic music hall and known as such because of the varied quality gigs featured there.  However, it's cool semi-restored digs are also a great spot to grab a pint with mates.  It's a favourite of mine.

Wow what a performance of Pirates of Penzance. Exhausted watching. Marvelous show. Excellent in every way. Cast & pianist. Can't wait for next visit. Nice wrap & pavlova too. Thank you for a fab afternoon.
A magical place. The staff are fantastic. The pizzas are out of this world. We loved our visit here so much we booked to see the show again two days later.

Loved it. Great place to visit. Lovely house and gardens and great if you use the digital tour guide to explain the history of the house. Gardens were lovely as well and the moat was beautiful. Lovely cafe and play area for the kids. Would recommend getting there early to take full advantage of the palace.

We are local to Eltham Palace (a mile or so away), so one of our favourite walks with friends is along the Green Chain Walk, up to the Palace.

We took two friends there last week, got full price tickets, looked around, and had tea in the tea shop. We do this sort of thing quite often.

But this week, when we came with another friend, we did not want to do the full tour (she was planning to come back with more friends, and we had only just been).

Imagine our surprise when we discovered (on a Friday late afternoon in April) that we could not have access to the tea shop (or indeed the playground (!)) without buying £23 ish tickets! Neither the playground, nor the tea room looked particularly busy either...

How mean-spirited, how grasping! We can just about understand having such rules in summer. But to bar one’s neighbours from using these facilities (especially families with kids (we are not such neighbours)) is pretty shabby.

Think again. Be more inclusive. These people pay taxes to help keep you going.

Shame on you.

A beautiful and interesting place to visit. The staff and volunteers were friendly and helpful. We enjoyed using the audio visual guides. A great cafe. We are sorry that the café and playground are no longer open to the public as our grandchildren loved it here.

Went Eltham Palace on a class trip today. The staff were very nice and friendly, very informative on the various rooms inside. The kids loved the rooms that had various dress up gear like the basement with War uniform and Virginia's walk in wardrobe. The grounds is beautiful with various flowers planted. The mout has fishes inside which was probably the highlight as the kids loved to see them racing past them.

We went for a wedding fair in the evening so only saw part of the palace, but everything was absolutely perfect! It has two types of decorations: medieval and my favourite- Art Deco.
I’ll come back for sure during the day!

Beautiful park with lots to do. Museums and lot of different rooms with plenty of historical stuff. Park itself is well maintained and clean. Good place to do cycling, picnic and relaxing. Parking is also available at £1.20 per hour which is very reasonable.  Rest rooms available  . Overall good experience and definitely recommend to visit.

One of the iconic place in the world. Where the time zone is set. This the 0.00 +/-GMT.
They have a museum and a Planetarium which you can book on the day or online before hand.
There is a souvenir / Gift shop with some unique amazing items.
A coffee shop is available with toilets or separate toilets are available around the park.
With £1 you can use the telescope to see the London buildings. A lovely place to spend with the family and kids.

Early April is almost the best time of year for the park. The poppies and daffodils are all out, and everything else is about to burst into flower. 
The gardeners seem to be working flat out to plant and re-plant beds just for your enjoyment. 
Less crowded than in high summer, but that also has its attractions.

WELL WHAT A GREAT DAY OUT WE ALL HAD AT GREENWICH PARK. 
CAN'T WAIT UNTIL THEY FINISH BUILDING THE CHILDREN'S NEW PLAY AREA.IT WOULD BE NICE IF GREENWICH PARK'S DEPARTMENT COULD PUT UP SOME WELL NEEDED LIGHTS.... ONLY IT WOULD BE A LOT SAFER FOR EVERYONE PLEASE!!

Great place to see a corgi meet up. Go to the royal observatory while your there. There is also a small food stand nearby that sells fries(chips) with some great sauces. We got the garlic and cheese fries and put a ton of the curry ketchup on it. They were great.
When looking through the telescope consider the heavenly fingers which created the moon and stars. How excellent is our God who has set His glory above the heavens - psalm 8 (kjv)

Iconic building on the Blackford Hill, Edinburgh. Dates from 1902. Disappointingly  no live observations from here although the original towers still exist.  Some of the copper cladding has had to be replaced and looks slightly incongruous by comparison with the original . Some lectures take place over the winter. months
Brilliant views of the city and a lovely place to learn about space. The hill up there is a bit steep but it's well worth the effort once you reach the top!
Great views from the hill, not very informative or helpful other than the open days.

Total joke of a place to bring 70 seater bus round despite a bus bay being in place. But no road markings stating bus bay. No yellow lines round the turning circle. Turning circle too small for buses. Last time I bring anyone here. Especially tourists spending money in our capital.

What an incredible place! I had no idea it even existed! Beautiful treasures and history- well worth a visit. I am not convinced younger children would enjoy this but certainly a great place for those who love art and history
Excellent museum. It is like small V&A. All items of superior quality. Good explanatory materials, friendly and knowledgeable staff. Enjoyed my visit more than expected.
Its a very intersting place that is very unique. Lots of interesting items.

Rangers House is a lovely feature of Greenwich Park. It houses some nice artwork but the best part is its gardens which, if you catch on a warm summers day, is a joy to sit and relax in. Sit yourself on one of the benches outside and take advantage of its peaceful surroundings.
The house isn't shown off very much but there are some lovely items in the collection.

We were walking around Falun looking for somewhere to eat (and drink) after a long day's work when we stumbled across The Kings Arm. I'm glad we picked this place. They had good food and a friendly staff. We had the Iggy Pop burger, which is usually Gluten free, but we substituted the lettuce for a bun. The burger was good and the fries were perfect. They had an English menu and, although the bartender did not speak a lot of English, the lady in the kitchen came out to make sure that she had our order correct. The Eriksberg draft beer was cold and fresh. They had decent selection and a full bar. We enjoyed our experience at The Kings Arm.

Very nice and cozy place,  could be there every day 
 The Sabaton Burger is the best,  prices are fair and  the stuff is friendly.  I will come back
Great place and good beer, remember Rockstad Falun 2014 :)
Fin musik av The Merith o Erika Blackbird.
Cool place to hang out. Good music, helpful staff.

CASH ONLY 
Super cheap and tasty food! Do not order a plate each, they are so huge you will not be able to finish it all! Alternatively take your own empty containers and eat your leftovers the next day- a plate from here is basically two and a half takeaway containers worth. They sell containers for 50p if you forget your own! If you go with someone you could easily share a plate and a side and both be very full after
Favourite for over ten years. Cheap and cheerful type of Chinese. Ho Fun with Roast Pork and Duck is my favourite. Food is greasy and probably not healthy as a regular meal.

This place was recommended to me and I was pleasantly surprised. I'm usually disappointed by portion sizes, but I can honestly say I wasn't this time. The only let down was the size of the spring rolls. They cost around £5 and were the tiniest spring rolls I'd ever seen. Honestly apart from that, I really enjoyed the food and the service was good. No complaints, except for the spring rolls ofcause. It was an relaxing atmosphere and I enjoyed looking out the window watching the world go by. I will go back again.

I've been a regular of Tai Won Mein for the last 4 years or so and have recently noticed an unfortunate deterioration of the restaurant. This is based on the last few visits where I have noticed increasingly smaller portions to the point where I no longer feel it is value for money. On my last visit I didn't receive my drink and was still charged :(
Decent food for a great price in generous portions. Good place to get a filling meal on a budget. Recommended especially for students.

Things I like: 
1.   Warm towels to clean my hands before/after dinner 
2.   When you order a feast (good for sharing), you get refills on bread/veggies 
3.  The people (VERY friendly) 
4.  Super fast!  
5.  Lunch prices are VERY reasonable. 

Other thoughts: 
The bread is so-so.   I’ve had better at other places.    Everything in our veg feast was refillable except for the collard greens.  The greens are so yummy...it’s a bummer those can’t be refilled.

I showed up with 3 friends at about 6:45. We were seated quickly, and the server even let us pick the table to sit at. The restaurant was comfortable temperature, with good lighting, and the chairs were also good.

The water at the table was cold and refreshing. I also ordered a tea-cognac which tasted good. The drink was served warm in a glass - the drink certainly tasted good, but I had to let it cool off a bit before I could comfortably lift the hot glass. My group ordered the Ethiopian feast which is basically an all-you-can-eat with each of the entrees. All the entrees were quite good, with reasonable spice levels. Our bread and water was refilled regularly, and the entrees dish
 was also refilled.

The staff was friendly throughout and I had a good time here.

Great place to have a more adventurous meal. We always get the feast, and enjoy the Ethiopian tea and coffee. I'm not a fan of honey wine but theirs is a nice option. We visited again tonight and enjoyed live music with our dinner. The hot hand towels were especially nice on a cold night!

I would give BN 5 stars without hesitation, but I can’t help but feel so wasteful when I get the vegetarian feast and they refill it so generously, but I can’t take what’s leftover. The tea is amazing. Amazing. Go for the tea, at least.
I went with three other people and ordered the vegetarian platter.  We just love our favorite dish.  Waitstaff was fantabulous as always.
A great place to get married! Bonus: two very large, all-year-round palm trees adorn the square directly in front of the town hall, perfect for feeling tropical on cold winter days.

Absolutely useless ! I called for an advice they didn’t understand what I was asking so put me on hold and transferred me to another unrelated department. The person on the phone was not even trying to help. Very bad service !
Nice place to have a wedding altho lifts can't handle big loads so loading in equipment is a nightmare
A great place with a lot of good vibes.
Only saw it from the outside as I was delivering to the new development next door.
Great atmosphere, amazing beer plus nice guest craft beers and delicious food served till late! What else can you ask for! Oh and you can join salsa class too! And sit in the cosy garden at the back
Favourite churchyard,with a garden area and play ground for kids
Great place to worship.

It was so great! I went to the guinea pig area saffron was the cutest! 5/5 I tried finding photos of her I really liked her when we had to leave I was so sad! I went with friends it was great the sitting place was great
I stumbled across this farm by accident. It's a lovely farm that you can walk around and has lots of animals. I especially enjoyed the goats who were enjoying lying in the sun 😁

A London gem. Yes there’s a nice cafe running out of the farm, but there’s also a whole host of activities and projects that contribute to the rich tapestry that is hackney. Education for kids struggling with the mainstream. Forest school. Visiting the farm. Community events. Therapeutic gardening. Youth clubs. The list goes on!!
Such a gem in the city! Fantastic trip even if you don't have kids. Great to go on the weekend as it's in walking distance to Broadway, Victoria or Columbia Road flower markets!
Lovely community center and farm. Listened to Hackney Harmonies concert here. Nice concert but acoustics were terrible. Huge fan/motor noise disturbing throughout

With all honesty, probably the worst coffee ever I had in my life. I am not exaggerating, it tasted like they washed the coffee machine into our cups and topped up with pre-heated milk! We only sipped to release the taste which lead us to leave the premises immediately!

I visit to go Open Water Swimming - rare in London. After the compulsory induction there are session weekend morning and Thursday evening. Available if water temperature 11°C or above and sunlight. small loop is 500m and my GPS agrees. larger loop is 750m officially, but I have never managed to get it less than 780m (even swimming breaststroke). Nice hidden cafe too.
Open water swimming in summer is not to be missed.

Lovely water sport venue clean, tidy well kept and the instructors are very helpful. there is ample parking on site. It can be a bit tricky to find as it does appear that you may be driving down a very narrow lane but carry on pat the climbing center for about 100 yards and you will find the gate on the left.

I go here for the open water swimming on Saturday and Sunday mornings during the warmer months. Well worth a visit. There is a 750m and a 500m course, plus you can just swim between the jetties to do lanes of you want a more gentle into to open water swimming. Nice clean and modern changing facilities, proper showers and lockers. Staff are really lovely and there is a cafe. What's not to love?
Great for local, but also London,  history.  Beautiful displays,  obvious a lot of care had gone into them. Larger than expected,  worth a visit if you are in the area.

Interesting and inspiring place! Many historical things about Hackney and it's life years ago. Great fun for kids to play around with provided toys, play on musical instrument and listen to explanation about the objects (via headphones). Thought-provoking exhibitions. Very friendly and supporting staff. Thanks.

Hackney Museum is a small museum in the Hackney area of London focusing on local history of the area. Considering the history of Hackney, a lot of the exhibits focus on the influx of people over the centuries and decades. The story starts with the Roman period, but the story rapidly shifts to the last 200 hundred years with a particular focus on immigrants and by extension the poorer members of society.

There's also a small exhibition room which is currently dedicated to "black" music. Truly amazing to see some old school equipment. A real gem of a museum.
A insight into Hackney's history. Well worth a visit.

Hackney Museum is a wonderful place to take young kids who are interested in a bit of history about Hackney. The trip there is free and young people, as well as adults, can go in and enjoy themselves. It truly is one of a kind place

Our last year at The Residence  
I have loved our last 10 years at this hotel but it's time to move on. It is spotlessly clean, all the staff are lovely and the facilities second to none.

Excellent service and very comfortable rooms and suites. 
A very busy hotel but with a quiet atmosphere
Beautiful gardens and good food.
Excellent location with a very helpful and kind staff. We enjoyed our stay very much. Thank you!
Great hotel with nice garden, pool, rooms and restaurants. We had a good stay! And also to be mentioned is the free parking in the garage.
Excellent place to stay and the most wonderful & helpful staff... I come here year after year (8 times so far)

As Toowong locals,  we eat at Green Paw Paw on a regular basis and absolutely love it every time!
The restaurant itself isn’t anything fancy or big, but the food is heavenly and reasonably priced, relative to other Thai cuisine prices. 
Personal favourites are the Thai Fried Rice, Yellow Curry and Chicken with Cashew Nut. 
Seems to be very authentic and full of flavour. 
Can’t recommend this restaurant enough - best takeaway in the western suburbs xo
Great place! Tasty fresh carry, good size of portions. Absolutely good value for money. Not very spicy so answering the question about spice level I’d pick something hotter than I usually do.
Good Thai food at decent prices in Toowong. Friendly staff service. Has improved significantly under new management.
Some really tasty dishes - I especially like the Kao soi chicken and the drunken noodles. Some of their curries can be a little watery. Great prices though!
Good flavors. Tom yum was good and panang curry is creamy. Great value for money and I’ll come again to try more dishes.

A brilliant cafe, that has an 'in crowd's of it's own.
The food is tasty, well presented and fairly priced.
It's been a while since enjoyed eating at Mess"s and have noted that the decor and tables how fit their clientele lol
This is a lovely cafe and I hope to use it for many years t come:-)

The food and service here are always great! If you haven't tried Mess then your missing out. It's one of Hackney's hidden gems for sure. Love love love this place.... Especially the Halal English breakfast options 👌🏽
Good selection of well-made and nicely presented food. Very good service. The Eggs Florentine had perfectly cooked poached eggs and Hollandaise sauce.
Good food and presentation, not to oily like most cafes. I was able to get my buggy in comfortably. I'm going back soon 😁
Food is brilliant and the service is just as brilliant. Can get packed but that says alot😀😀

Run by an older Vietnamese couple (I think), nice atosphere, quieter than many of the other Vietnamese and pho please on that road. Food has been great every time. Great service (mostly Vietnamese students) who are always paying attention. Bar service isn't super quick, but the cocktails are really really good. 

On a road *full* of Vietnamese restaurants, definitely my favourite

I've eaten from many of the Vietnamese places on kimgsland road and this is without a doubt my favourite.  The bun hue is actually spicy and the stock is packed full of flavour. We also had the spare ribs, juice and ample, and tiger prawns were delicious. Highly recommend this place.

Viet Hoa is my absolute favorite Vietnamese restaurant in London. It’s been around for over two decades and the owner Li is an exceptionally warm and lovely host. Everything I’ve ever ordered there has been fresh and of very high quality (and extremely tasty), and everyone I’ve brought here now is a returning customer too.

Went here on a Friday night around 7. Was practically empty at that point, although it got quite busy around 8:00 - 8:30. So if you want a guaranteed table maybe aim slightly earlier. The staff were really friendly and knowledgeable, and they were very accommodating for vegan options (they do veggie broths for the Pho even though it's not listed specifically on the menu). The food was really good, especially the spring rolls. Would definitely recommend!
Friendly and.efficient staff.with tasty food and reasonable prices
A good meaty treaty place. My go to restaurant for when I want a hot grill of beautiful mixed meats in front of me. Always worth booking just to be sure you get a table.

If you like meat and wine you have to try this place. The steak is delicious, big portions, really carefully cooked over the coal asado and they are so friendly too. We're so full but can't wait to come back again

Always recommend this place to friends and colleagues. It’s relaxed, unpretentious and friendly. I’ve been to flashier London restaurants like Hawksmoor and St. John, but Buen Ayre, for my money, does the best steak I’ve ever had. And the wine list is great too!
One of my absolute favorite restaurants in London! Great, well-cooked steak and really friendly service. Will definitely be returning anytime I'm in the city.
Really flavoursome and beautifully cooked steak. Chips were gorgeous. Service was friendly, I would definitely eat here again.

Absolutely loved it, like walking into Alice in Wonderland only in ancient Egypt or Mesopotamia. The contrast between the tame exterior of the converted pub and the outlandish interior was the most fantastic impression. A delicious hideaway!

This is a local restaurant to me and has always been a good standard - I went a week ago and the food continued to be good value for money, with amazing decor, atmosphere and the service was fine too.  Would definitely go again.  For the ambience, money and location it's one of the best in the area.

Hidden gem of East London!!
Great atmosphere and delicious food ... Friendly staff.

Would tell anyone to try this place. Tuck into comforting dishes such as Oven Baked Tortilla, Chicken Fillet Steak, Beef Goulash and Braised Pork Loin Steaks... Pudding Plum Tart Tatin is a must!

Cool venue, fantastic service and great food. Would recommend.

Lot's of small niches to get cosy in. Surroundings are covered in Egyptian decor
