Where else can you sit in a Pharaoh's head? The cocktails are brilliant but the food a little lacking. The atmosphere and incredible décor more than make up for it and it is a great place to take people just to see their surprise. The wallpaper in the toilets does come with a 12+ rating!

The management of this place has no consideration for all the constant building works that is constantly going on. I know so many people who had showrooms who have left and they say it's the best move they have ever made. Their complaints about no heating, electric, noise, dust, broken door handles are ignored by the arrogant  managements. You can't park your car unless you pay huge fees, won't let you park your bike unless it underground and on and on ,
Very funky building, quite an unusual concept, good place to go for ideas for high end furnishings etc
A whole mall dedicated to designer collection. Top designer's shops and collection.
The Design Centre is the ultimate destination for interior design fanatics.
Great inspiration for decor shame parking was limited and opening hours doesn't extend to weekends

The flats are lovely and so great for students. If theres ever any issues they are fixed so quickly and so it makes staying here feel so easy and care free. Alison and Aline do such an amazing job of looking after us all and are such lovely people. This is the perfect place for students

Aline and Alison have been absolute stars! From the day I moved in, they’ve been so friendly and welcoming and always on hand to help out with any troubles or emergencies. As well as being super efficient and ready to answer any queries, they’re also really lovely to chat to and brighten my  mornings on my way out. The accommodation is really clean, quiet and convenient - would highly recommend!

The accommodation is modern and the staff is very helpful. Whenever I had an issue, the maintenance team solved it on the day. The building is located in a central area as well and usually there is someone at the reception and so security-wise, I felt really safe.

The rooms are great quality and have a very home-like feel. Everyone has their own kitchen and bathroom which is so nice. Hammersmith is a great area with lots to do. There is grocery shopping and coffee right under the accommodations. The service is great and there are always people to help out. Aline and Khan are eager to help with any housing questions/issues as I had a lot to sort out with my job. Lots of students and interns and I feel so safe with their multi-layered security. Everything is so convenient I'm happy I chose this place!!

Nice, quiet and secure Studios to stay. New building and modern rooms with all the facilities. Really close to transport, supermarkets, coffee shops, hospital, the river to go for a walk, etc.
Great and helpfull staff at all the times. Thanks guys for your services during the last few months!
very pleasant cemetery, especially the gardens near crematorium - lovely when roses are in full bloom

"For there is good news yet to hear & fine things to be seen, before we go to paradise by way of Kensal Green". By GK Chesterton. 
The first of the mahoosive commercial cemeteries opened in London. Recorded in the Penny Magazine as "The first practical attempt to remedy a great public inconvenience". In 1833 out of the 54acres 39acres were consecrated leaving the remaining 15acres for nonconformists.
It has mahoosive Doric arched entrance with 3 avenues. The central avenue has an Anglican Church with Doric porch and flanking colonnades. Beneath which lie mahoosive catacombs.At the East is an Ionic nonconformist Chapel and under the North walled colonnades are more catacombs.
George 3rd's children are buried here. Along with Isambard Brunel elder and younger and the elder's wife Sonia. Thackeray, Anthony Trollope, Wilkie Collins, Charles Blondin, Joseph Locke and Harold Pinter to name a few of the many famous laid to rest here.
It is very beautiful and atmospheric. Take a picnic and a camera!
Purposefully left to overgrow so wild flowers can seed and wildlife thrive.
Nearest station is Kensal Rise. In close proximity to Ladbroke Grove.
Final resting place of the wonderfully humble Christine Keeler
Freddie mercury's cemetery. It's a good voice
i would like to say i love this it was an amazing to know that freddie mercury was burried here 10/10 i would like to be buried here xoxo
Huge well maintained park with 2 pet play areas and tennis courts. Always a pleasure to hang out here. Lovely place to go for a run.
Great local park with 2 cafes and a garden centre. It's always kept clean and a great place for kids.
A park that feels small but has some big lawns and nice areas for strolling and running. Gotta say I was amazed by the cherry blossom inside.

This is a great park in Hammersmith. 

Very well tended throughout the year. There are some nice green spaces for relaxing on especially in the summer and some are "no dogs " which is good for those who do not want dogs running around them. 

Good place for adults and children alike.
Lovely mature green space very family friendly, so close but tucked away.
Nice ambiance. Good selection of food. Nice flavours. Good service. Desserts great. Would definitely return.

Amazing food. My kids loved it so much and we will be back! The meat was so tender and they gave a marvelous choice of tasty sauces. One of my favourite restaurants and i would definitely recommend this for a delicious meal out! So much choice for the whole family and the staff members were so helpful and nice, we love Abu zaad!!

I went to this branch today with a friend from a different country driving for 20 miles if I could give this place 0 stars I will honestly do that.
I didn't enjoy my meal and I told one of the waiters about the meal that it is so bad he just tried to convince me that food is nice without doing anything else, even he was watching me all the time  and he saw that I was eating only salad because he doesn't care about the business  and he will get paid in the of the day.
I am sure if the owner was there he could do something for me and he tries his best to make happy.
The best Arabic cuisine. Must visit place. I absolutely adore their hospitality. Yummy grilled dishes.Been there couple of times and willing to go anytime :)

This is a really bad restaurant in terms of hospitality and service.  The food is just ok but there are better options in the area for better prices.  The place itself is extremely vulgar! waiters and staff can be heard shouting inside.  A waiter was REALLY mean to us when we were wondering why our simple order of pickles did not find its way to our table even after the mains were served! we then asked them to cancel it and they said ok if you want!!!! very mean! this is beyond bad service.  the table behind us was shouting at the waiters all the time because they wouldn't serve them bread for more than half an hour!!!!  the whole ambiance was vulgar and we would never go there again.
Interesting exhibitions and short films. Really nice staff and a lovely garden in the back to read a book and catch some sunshine. Definitely recommend for a chilled afternoon.

Up to date, modern art, film,  craft galleries, for all ages. Will make you all think, about what is actually, occuring on our planet! 
Great Cafe, garden, classes, volunteers, book shop, managers. 
Always 💯% HAPPY, educated, relaxed, atmosphere. 🌴🐚🐦😍🤗🚴👫👨‍👩‍👧‍👦
Great space for art exhibitions. Fully accessible with a cafe and a garden.
Pleasant little cafeteria. Enjoyed the hummus salad but found the glass of orange juice at £3.50 a bit OTT.

Nice galleries upstairs, always very relaxing atmosphere very good cafe.
Don't know what to make of the toilets used to be man and woman, they went through the effort of removing the urinals and now they are both unisex toilets, what i see is that most women prefer to queue and use the toilet for less able people.

It’s beautiful and you could see a lot of Freud’s collections in the reading room. If the weather is nice, the garden will open, and it’s quite good to seat there for a little while.
However, since it’s not big it may then be a lit bit crowded if you visit on weekends.
This place gives you a sense of peace. Everything in the right place, harmony and calmness. Spend some time in Freud's garden, especially if it's a sunny day.
I went here when I was studying abroad. It was quaint and full of history. I enjoyed walking around the house, feeling relaxed and seeing first-hand what I have read about for so long!

I absolutely loved this place! It is quite small but you can easily stay there for a couple of hours to see everything. 

You get a good insight into Freud's life in London, how he got here and the work he's done. There is a whole room with the possessions and works of his daughter and a couple of sketches and a painting from Salvador Dali too! 

The beautiful garden garden at the back is lovely in the Spring and the summer. 

The entrance tickets that you buy are valid for a year (the guy told us that at the ticket office, but that could change at any moment so don't hold me to that) and they do take cards! 

I'd highly recommend this place!
Loved this museum. This was a house that Freud actually lived and worked in.  It showed about has life and work. Told how he ended up living there. Worth a visit.

We took the tour, which covers the West Cemetery, but includes the entry cost of entry into the East Cemetery too. Our guide was very knowledgeable and imparted some of the rich history of those characters who lie buried here. Wealthy and poor, wicked and good, Victorian and modern, they're all represented here. It'll take a good hour and a half to do it justice, but we spent two hours here.

Beautiful place for a Sunday morning stroll. Visited the graves of Karl Marx, Douglas Adams, George Elliot and other renowned writers, activists, politicians and thinkers.
Peaceful and green I soon forgot I was in the city. There's also an opportunity to visit the other half with tour , will do that next time.

Booked on-line for the guided tour, had a warm welcome from the guide when we arrived and it was very useful for  them to have a secure cupboard to leave bags. The walk was through the cemetery so a decent pair of shoes required, stopping at various  graves. Some steps in the tour and a bit of uphill walking. The guide was very  knowledgeable not only on the graves but the Victorian funeral practice.  No facilities on site but a cafe is available in the public park next door. A very interesting visit which took just over an hour.

This was an absolutely terrible trip. I'd been looking forward to visiting Highgate Cemetery for a long time. When I got there, they took £12 off me for the guided tour saying that this was the last one of the day due to weather conditions. Bearing in mind that it was a normal, mildly cloudy day with low wind, they then almost immediately told me the tour was now cancelled. I asked if the whole cemetery was closed, to which the receptionist said it was just the east. So after they credited my card, I went to the west, where they then admitted the whole cemetery was closed due to a fallen branch. 

Bearing in mind that I'm on a low income, and hardly get any time off work, I'm seriously annoyed. It took me an hour to get there, and an hour to get back. The transaction will take ages to go back onto my card, and the cost of the tube has been wasted. They didn't seem particularly apologetic either.

They've been running this cemetery for years, they should know when it's likely to be a good or a bad day in the morning, and update their website accordingly and with proper notice. 

They certainly shouldn't take money and then cancel 3 minutes later. The tour guide who saw the branch could've messaged the lady at reception in advance too before they took my money.

I feel so let down, I've wanted to go for ages, but you don't know if they'll even let you in after taking your money so it might not be worth the risk.
It's such a beautiful place to visit in London. There are lots of famous people buried here, Karl Marx's tomb brings most of visitors amog others. There's a 4£ fee in but it's definitely worth it.

Lovely place for a dip except on very hot and busy days when the whole world tries to get in and then moans about how busy it was!  It is not a large space but it is one of the only places to swim in natural, non chlorinated water in North London.
An amazing swimming pond but the closing times in the summer could be extended!

The lifeguards are cheerful and watching and keeping the ponds and surrounding sun bathing areas are all is in order - a safe beautiful spot to enjoy the long hot summer days of 2018
priceless and better than going abroad

I went with some friends, and The Life Safe Team ruined my day. It seemed they didn't like my swimming style (just mine) and any time I jumped to the water they were calling me the attention. Ladies, don't bother, I swim since  I' m 5 years old in Olympic pools, so I know what I'm doing. My first and last time I go there.
Fantastic swim! Very basic changing & toilet facilities but friendly staff, cheap entry fee, clean water, even a shower.

I love this charming and quiet place , at summer time or winter time it is always a pleasure. Pay attention to the opening hours, winter time has an early closing that might surprise you.
Pergola is beautiful as well as the gardens. Recommended for a walk with a family

It's an amazing place. It brings you back in time so to speak. It's wonderful and delightful just to go for a walk around.
Either you want to go for a walk, run or take your dog out it's perfect, even for a romantic date but be aware that it closes it's gates in some parts after a certain hour depending on the month as it is different. For example on summer days it would be open later than the winter.
Even so it's a nice place to see from around :)

Went along for a photoshoot on a wet and miserable day. The place is incredibly beautiful, spacious with plenty of opportunities to get some walking in or just admire a small piece of serenity away from the urban surrounding. Well worth a visit for a peaceful time.

This is a beautiful hidden gem of a place in North London; we visited on a wintery weekend and it was peaceful & quiet - you can wonder around at your pace without any crowds. If you love nature & want a little calm then head here.
This place is so beautiful. Highly recommended on sunny days.

Don't miss this fabulous coffee shop. It's opposite Gospel Oak overground station, the coffee's great. The cakes are great. It's small, it's independent, it's friendly - so friendly that when I lost my kindle some weeks ago, I had no idea I'd left it there until the manager saw me going into the station today, and called me over to give it back. I'll be back.

What’s the best part of the view point ?
Is this being able to watch at the whole LONDON ? Or the hard slope to get here? Definitely the latter, as it is quite rare to have a clear sight view of the town.
But it is worth it anyway as Hampstead Heath is all around you and beautiful

The best place to have pasta, in fact all the food is amazing.
Home cooked with love.
Great place for a picnic. Be there about 90 minutes before sunset with a basket and a mat. You would probably enjoy it very much.

Amazing at night when you can see all the city lights and not see the awful amount of haze caused by the toxic levels of pollution over the city.

The sign showing you what buildings you can see needs to be updated as the city is moving at a rapid pace and there are buildings that from then view point even I can’t recognise!

Once that’s done and a few more bench’s are added then it will be an even better spot
Best crepes in London. The queue is well worth the wait to grab an amazing crepe from this little stand - the salty butter contrasts the sweet crepes in the most perfect way

Luckily I did not have to queue almost at all but generally be ready for 15-20 mins queueing. 
Crepe was tasty although not the very best one I've eaten. To be honest I took the cheese ham an egg one and it was too buttery and fatty because they put too much butter and cheese. Maybe the sweet ones are better. It is bit pricey but to be fair it kept me full for 3-4 hours so for me was good value for money.
One of the best crepes I've eaten so far. Pretty expensive, but worth it. We came at lunch time on a Monday and there was no queue

Long queues are always associated with this venue, but that's part of the fun for waiting for your crêpe. The food is excellent and tastes awesome as it's freshly prepared in front of you. Well worth it.
Tasty, sweet crepes. Worth the wait as there’ll be a queue on Saturdays
Very nice librarian, many books available on different subjects, cosy place.
Very good selection of books.
Great selection of books
Incredible variety of books, the librarian usually is spot on in his recommendations, prices are ok.
Soooo many books

We have been using Weng Wah restaurant for many years.
It was a jewel of the Belsize Park area.

Recently it has changed hands and altered in character.

They changed the decor, but not for the better.  The previous installation had a certain exotic charm.

The food is still good, but the prices have risen considerably.  It is no longer a place where I want to bring friends to have a pleasant time with good food.

Pity

Although I wanted to be more positive I just can't. Service was awful the last time we visited. They were rude and the waiter didn't admit his mistake so we were forced to eat something we didn't even order. I don't say the food was bad, quite on the contrary it was really tasty but they really need to improve their service.

Just ordered Chefs starter, Duck and Beef with cashew nuts and mangetout 

The duck was floppy and not crispy. Received Beef filet with cashew nut and CAROTS!

Having used Weng Wah for 15 years and wife for 35, now forced to go else where to enjoy a Chinese take away. 

Weng Wah, get a grip!!!!!!
Weng Wah House karaoke is fantastic, we love it , the best place to have a group of friends or family, after 3 course meal then we start to sing a song, come and try don`t be shy.

Even though I don't live in the area any more I still order from this place. The food is really delicious, the chicken teriyaki is a must try and the staff are really polite and friendly although delivery time has been increasing lately.

Decent place for breakfast. Decent fare.

The staff is very nice and helpful. Best place in Hampstead to meet for an early business meeting.

Their selection of dishes is not the widest but I would recommend the eggs benedict.

Good food but the portion sizes are outrageously bad. I had the popular sausage pasta dish: it was so small that I left hungry and feeling ripped off. This chain obviously does very well for itself - making it all the more shameful that they behave this way.
All 4 of the dishes we chose were off the menu. Only told after about 20 minutes. Took 1 hour 40 minutes for one course. Continued decent of a once enjoyable restaurant. Manager no help..

Continued decent. Whilst we have experienced issues in the past the overall dining experience has been fairly good. However our last visit was a joke. After waiting about 30 minutes to order we were told all 4 of our choices were unavailable. It took 1 hour 40 minutes for just a main course. When we called the manager all she said was sorry. I only saw one waiter for the whole restaurant.
Really nice breakfast meal. Nice staff. I will back :)

Always a good spot if you can grab a table. One of the better MAB pubs. Good beer good food, smiling staff at 5pm on a sunny day. 
Bloody toilets where even clean at that time after so many bodies
Lovely pub, conservatory and garden. Can get very busy at popular times. So close to the Heath. Dogs in the garden only. Food a bit average on our visit but has been very good in the past.
Nice food and ambience. Very cozy, friendly staff and great pie and Sunday roast. Book in advance on Sunday if you don't want to wait 45m for a table

I am very disappointed with the food and slow slow service. It used to be one of my favourite pubs to go to and to have a nice meal. I am afraid I won’t be coming.  The food we ordered was ghastly. I still cannot get over its taste. 45 min later we are still waiting for our desert. I love the new decor that is why I give a star but the food and service not so good.

Unbelievably slow, we waited for our food for about an hour. Very poor client service as well. Food wasn't anything special so overall really not worth it. Shame because the space would be amazing, especially when the weather is nice.

Has excellent set lunch @£18 for 3 courses. Service staff were professional and welcoming and kindly showed us around the restaurant after lunch to see their private dining rooms - we even met the chef to give him our compliments! A Primrose Hill institution not to be missed!
Incredible. It was my birthday and they treated me so well! We even met the chef, Bryn Williams. The tasting menu was impeccable. Would recommend this restaurant to anyone.

Stopped here between meetings for a quick bite to eat. What a treat! Incredible food, so much flavour in each dish. Service was impeccable and the setting is too good for a quick bite to eat at lunch!
My absolute favourite restaurant in London. Great ambience, atmosphere, staff and, most importantly, food and wine. Couldn't recommend it more.

It is the first time I rate a restaurant with 5 stars for everything I value: food, atmosphere and price.
The food is locally sourced, creatively put together, and delicately served. The result? A burst of flavour. 
My friends and me tried nearly everything on the entire lunch menu: carrot soup, salmon&avocado, broccoli risotto  (wow factor), vegetable sides (baby potatoes and greens) and deserts: beignetes, cheeses and java cake on a tropical fruit. It was mind-blowing. 
At the end, the surprising price for a (michelin star deserving) lunch menu ranged from 15-18 GBP (depending on whether it's a 2 course or 3 course). 
The service was the one you would expect in a posh nosh restaurant, yet the warmth of the staff was just like that of a family run restaurant: friendly and sweet.
We were so amazed we asked to meet the chef, Bryn, to congratulate him on such an experience. I bought his book as well, and intend to try out the recipes myself in Barcelona...
Will we return? Certainly. Do we recommend it? Definitely! A must!
HIGHLY RECOMMENDED.  A great experience overall.  Najc was my server and he was excellent.  The food was unique and showcased the region's cuisine very nicely.

One of the best meals I've had in years. The service was wonderful and the food and flavors were spot on. No detail was overlooked. Truly spectacular all around.

P.S. I highly recommend the local wines and the smoked olive oil.

We are here for Christmas Day dinner and couldn't be happier with the outcome! I had the 6 course meat menu and my partner had the 6 course fish menu. Both were fantastic and of an international standard! We also had the matched wines which were matched perfectly, displaying some of the less internationally known Slovenian wines. 

The service was also professional, knowledgeable and very friendly! 

The decor is not overly impressive but does have a traditional charm to it. 

If you like fine food I highly recommend you give it a visit.

Delicious food - came here for dinner on Saturday and had the tasting menu (four courses and you could get dessert). Was initially underwhelmed by the decor and dated background music but soon discovered that this was a true local gem. Every course was beautifully presented and tasted divine. Service was impeccable. Reservations a good idea, the restaurant was full. Would highly recommend.

Manna restaurant is incredible. Firstly the staff are just so friendly and so attentive, talking you through the foods and wines, and just generally being so incredible. Then the food, simply incredible, very well thought out and incredible flavours, a true adventure of taste. I have been visiting Ljubljana each year for a while and always come to Manna during my stay for such a special experience at a very good price. Could not recommend highly enough. Love Manna.

Spring is a wonderful time of year here, with a terrific range of forest floor bulbs and plants. There are many scented shrubs and lots of seating for unexpectedly warm days at this time of year. Look out for the carpets of violets from mid March complemented by the late flowering pure white daffodils. A joyous place!
I love this place. Very peaceful. I often go here to photograph the wildlife and people.

Beautiful historic cemetary containing the graves of several famous authors including William Blake, Daniel Defoe, and John Bunyan. It is also home to some squirrels who are very friendly unless the resident fox scares them off.

A fine resting place for several eminent people, it also acts as a small bird sanctuary. Not all of the graves are generally accessible, many are behind locked gates and railings. I imagine that you can access by appointment. Graves include William Blake, John Bunyan, Daniel Defoe and poor Mary Page; see photo of gravestone.

Burial ground of many non-Conformists including John Owen, Isaac Watts and John Bunyan. Most of the graves are visible, but be aware that some require permitted access by staff as they are in the fenced off areas. A peaceful, secluded location hidden in the bustle of that end of town.
Interesting, relaxing place. A haven of peace just 2 mins from the hustle and bustle. These buildings were a slum 100 years ago; you wouldn't believe it now.

Nice little park.
Pity about all the dogs everywhere. Seems more of a dog park than a children's park dispite no dogs allowed in the children's area.  
A bit of a deep placed sand pit a danger for younger kids to fall into.
Pity the benches are covered in bird poop.
Lovely, quiet space inbetween kings cross and angel. A small park for children to play in, lots of beaches and a short walk from Chapel Market, which has some great street food.
Great place any season!
Great place to wind down after day of work. Lots of benches to sit by yourself and find a good view of the church.

Great view both during the day but better in the evening. Great selection of beers liquors and food. Perfect spot for a fish and chips plus IPA beer. Highly recommended especially if you have a guest from abroad.
Lovely small church amongst Inns if Court or nearby. Go at lunch time and there may be an organ re ital or other. When I was there the organ recital was wonderful
Awesome church, one I saught out purposefully. Very old, rich history, and there was actually a production going on in the church the day we walked by.

If you like charming places this is a must for a London visit. I enjoyed an organ concert with an excellent acoustic in a medievo atmosphere. The small 5 pounds charge is worth. The surroundings of the church are amazing , you should walk around the place to see very nice building an gardens.

It was shut 🤷‍♂️
Second time round we found it to be very interesting and not from the Templar perspective as expected.

Absolutely impressive. I loved every single exhibition of this quite small but very well curated museum. I can also recommend taking part in the guided tours offered by staff members I learned a great deal and it was also a real pleasure to have a chat with the student giving me the tour.

This museum covers the history of surgery and houses a huge collection of anatomical and pathology specimens. The collection is displayed beautifully as this building was constructed especially for this museum. I highly recommend a visit.
My favourite museum :)
website crashed when tried to book for exams LDS  part1
Went there with a group of friends and our kid's to meet Jones the Bones. Very informative and funny... highly recommend.

The most wonderful ice-skating ever! Good music! Good ambience! The bar served nice drinks, beers and a snack! We visited too the Charlie Brown exposition! Marvelous! The history, the cartoons! On the store we just wanted to buy everything!

Amazing place in a prime location easily accessible with good music friendly staff and excellent service. Plenty to explore from the beautiful ice skating to interesting art exhibition just to mention a few gems. Nice drinks, beers and snacks lots of fun good experience will definitely recommend to friends.

It is a gem of a venue with many permanent art exhibitions and interesting temporary exhibitions. The current (at time of writing) Peanuts exhibition is a very poignant tribute to Charles M. Schultz and certainly worth a visit.
Loved the Charlie Brown gallery (entrance fee). There was an ice rink and a big Christmas tree at Somerset House, it looked beautiful! Inside the house, there were a lot of shops.

A beautiful building just off the strand

Go through the gateway and into the courtyard and you will find a peaceful place in a busy city 

There are fountains in the summer,  evening open air cinema and a ice skating ring in the winter

Cafés where snacks and drinks can be purchased - not cheap but nothing is in London.

Sit and people watch or go to one of the exibitions there 

They have a guided tour on some days where you can explore the secret places in Somerset house

A historic and lovely place to be

Well worth a visit when in London a must place to go

The most wonderful ice-skating ever! Good music! Good ambience! The bar served nice drinks, beers and a snack! We visited too the Charlie Brown exposition! Marvelous! The history, the cartoons! On the store we just wanted to buy everything!

Amazing place in a prime location easily accessible with good music friendly staff and excellent service. Plenty to explore from the beautiful ice skating to interesting art exhibition just to mention a few gems. Nice drinks, beers and snacks lots of fun good experience will definitely recommend to friends.

It is a gem of a venue with many permanent art exhibitions and interesting temporary exhibitions. The current (at time of writing) Peanuts exhibition is a very poignant tribute to Charles M. Schultz and certainly worth a visit.
Loved the Charlie Brown gallery (entrance fee). There was an ice rink and a big Christmas tree at Somerset House, it looked beautiful! Inside the house, there were a lot of shops.

A beautiful building just off the strand

Go through the gateway and into the courtyard and you will find a peaceful place in a busy city 

There are fountains in the summer,  evening open air cinema and a ice skating ring in the winter

Cafés where snacks and drinks can be purchased - not cheap but nothing is in London.

Sit and people watch or go to one of the exibitions there 

They have a guided tour on some days where you can explore the secret places in Somerset house

A historic and lovely place to be

Well worth a visit when in London a must place to go

If you want to try a real Italian pizza in the middle of London you should definitely come at L’Osteria 57! Unfortunately I just have a photo of starters but I assure you pizza made by Ivan is mouthwatering! Besides pizza they offer a very interesting Italian menu, from starters to desserts, as well as some traditional Italian digestives as a great touch to the end of the meal. You should definitely check this place if you haven’t yet! The prices are very reasonable  and during the days when there is a good weather, there are also a few tables outside which I know smokers will appreciate!

Very cozy place. It is very small but very warm place with very friendly and smiley staffs. Prices are very comparable with neighborhood. The place is closed between 2 o'clock to 4 o'clock. I guess it is Italian siesta time. If you looking a place for quick bite or  cozy atmosphere L'osteria won't disappoint you.
Very nice restaurant, staff were very efficient and friendly! Lovely food as well!
That's the best Italian restaurant I've evet seen. Pizzas are yummy! 👍👍

cosy restaurant, good atmosphere, friendly and helpful staff.
the food is far from being authentic Italian but it isn't too bad.
the pizza dough is amazing but unfortunately my calzone was stone cold in the middle, the mozzarella hadn't even melted.
One of my fav places in Exmouth Market. The menu is small but concise and most importantly - delicious!!! Food is authentic and yummy and desserts are homemade goodness! Would genuinely recommend!
Authentic Japanese cafe. Excellent and great value for lunch. The cakes and sweets are also very nice.
Lovely real Japenese food and friendly atmosphere! Big portions for good price too. Momo is a great cook!! :)

Dinner. Burdock tea (3.5), Plum wine (4.5), Haru Maki (2.8), Vegetarian Curry (6.5), Yuzu ice cream, and Pumpkin Cheese Cake (3.7). Prices excluding service charge. (Ex-)employee returning as customer, so a bit of conflict of interest in review. But good food, reasonable prices, fast (may be slower at times) and kind service (ex. refilling tea)
I love this place,  the staff are lovely and the food reasonably priced and absolutely delicious.  I rate their sushi and the fried chicken is amazing.
Been going here for 25 years since I was a student. Best, cheapest, traditional fry-up breakfast for miles. Highly recommend.
Average service and price point. However is popular with students and local construction workers looking for a quick and easy takeaway lunch.
Friendly staff and food are competitively priced.
Extremely friendly staff great prices! And really nice food I thought! Deffinately will be back when I'm working in the area again.
Independent cafe in the Pret-jungle that is Holborn, staff is super nice and food is great and extremely cheap (under £3 for a massive toasted ciabatta)!

Amazing service, food and staff. The value is incredible and the 3 course deal is by far the best in the area. It’s hard to come by great customer service, in such a busy environment,  but this place has nailed it, not only with a smile but a fantastic atmosphere. The meal sizes are great. Will be back for sure. To the gent who served myself and my family, thank you very much, everyone was overwhelmed by the service.

Someone call the police: this is criminally good value for money. 

If you’re a fan of a quirky interior look no further than this restaurant. It’s candle lit and quirky with buckets of atmosphere. 

The food is tasty, uncomplicated and the service is charming and faultless. 

I had the vegan option, stuffed peppers topped with vegan mozzarella. My father had the beef goulash and we both wiped our plates clean. 

The wine washed everything down very well and was a lovely Italian red, we had cheesecake for desert and polished that off swiftly too. 

I only wish we didn’t live on the other side of London, but next time we’re in the area we will be back for sure.

used to be an avid fan of this place when they were in Farringdon, but whilst their staff was great and friendly, and their atmosphere is still just as good, their food was definitely not up to their old standard. The duck and lamb mains were both lacking flavour (perhaps salt?), and the lamb was quite under cooked. On the plus side, the pigs cheeks were delicious, so not everything was under par.

Still represents a great value place to eat - if they get their food quality back up.
Have been coming here for years, cannot get enough of it. Reasonably priced great service delightful hidden gem in Kilburn. The decor and atmosphere is just wonderful.

We’ve been lucky enough to visit here a few times now and bring family on occasion too! One of my favourite restaurants in London. The atmosphere is always great, as is the service and the food. Would always advise pre-booking especially if you want one of the high seated booths over looking the restaurant. Lovely wee restaurant!

What was particularly noteworthy about this restaurant was the amazingly warm and friendly front of house team, who could not have been more accommodating or welcoming. The food itself was utterly delicious from start to finish, and those chips are as good as everyone says. Very reasonable house wine served in carafes. A beautiful, stylish building with a cozy bar downstairs.
Simply wonderful restaurant that deserves its billing as the best in Covent Garden. Sensational chips and good wine that is excellent value by the carafe. Highly recommended for a pre-theatre meal.
What a fabulous restaurant. Everything from the welcome and aperitif to the cookies & cream dessert was perfect. Truly great service and a fantastic menu, brilliantly executed. Hope we return soon

Really, really good. Excellent food in a cool and comfortable setting, staff helpful and chilled. Even better than sister restaurant Kitty Fisher. Obviously you have to have the chips we ordered most of the menu and there wasn’t a weak link.

We have been to Cora Pearl twice now. Once for an impromptu evening meal and once for Sunday lunch. On both occasions we were warmly greeted by the staff who were very helpful in explaining the menu and advising the best wine to complement our choices, all without being intrusive. 

The food is out of this world. Perfectly cooked cod with Smoked Eel, Beetroot & Horseradish as a starter and the Sunday lunch is cooked to perfection - a rare find in London.

Will definitely be returning!

Another fine example of why Chicago is such a cool city to explore on foot. The outside of this building has all sorts of great detail work and it would be easy to check it out and just walk on by, but the central lobby is not too be missed. Go on in and see for yourself. You won't be disappointed.

A must see in Chicago. The interior stairs are amazing. And the details in the columns, redesign by the famous architect Frank Lloyd Wright, a treasure. Don’t miss the elevator doors. Otis Elevators state of art

Truly a hidden gem in the city of Chicago. It has the most amazing spiral staircase I’ve ever seen. Chances are, you’ve seen a picture of them at some point. I haven’t done the tour, but it is on my to do list in Chicago. 

It’s hard to get in if you’re simply trying to get a look at the stairs. But if you’re inconspicuous about it, no one will say anything. If anything, sign up for the tour!

A true historic gem! This Frank Loyd Right building is a muat-see for every architecture enthusiast. You cannot simply walk into this building by yourself. If you want to be able to go up the iconic stairs, you must book the official guided tour. You can however walk into the foyer, just not up the stairs.

I wish we would have had more time on the tour to spend in this building. It was outstandingly beautiful. You walk in the front door and it's like stepping back in time. So much attention to detail. My husband and I were both absolutely Blown Away. Definitely intend on going back next time we're in Chicago sightseeing. A must-visit for any trip if you love architecture and beauty
Lovely place to be in the nature. We love the little woodlands there.
I went once inside the Islington Ecology Centre to ask the way of the Finsbury Park and the staff was friendly and helpful.
Nice for family walks

Amazing little oasis in the middle of the city.  What used to be the old rail yards has been transformed into a wooded area with a pond, some fields, and plenty of interesting places to explore.

Well worth a visit with the kids.
Very nice quiet and safe area for the family...

Great exhibit by Hyon Gyon while I visited. The two stories of gallery space itself is very nice and open. There is also a bookshop / gift shop at the front of the gallery with books from artists who have had shows there in the past. Great spot!
I've been here twice. The art was of high quality both times. Me and my friend sat here for a while analysing the displays. The guard staff was helpful too. Was allowed to take pictures.
Interesting place tucked away in London, a good way to spend an hour or two look at some more recent art.

I am an artist educator running some of the youth workshops at Parasol Unit and also take other student groups there whenever I can! The foundation showcases tight and beautifully curated solo shows that give great insight into an artist's practice as well as very engaging group shows. It's an extremely accommodating space with very knowledgeable and helpful staff. Visitors feel intimately involved with the works in the exhibitions due to careful curation and information.

Can't wait to return! My daughter and I stopped by to check out the gallery. Buggies are not permitted in the exhibit, but their Education Coordinator (who I find myself feeling lucky to meet!) was so incredibly nice, she took the time to chat with me about the gallery and offered to watch my daughter for a few minutes so I could quickly browse around the first floor. We will definitely be going back soon.
Had my birthday here. Really tasty food, incredible value. Thought it was excellent but definitely book! It’s popular

wholesome tasty food at a very reasonable price, only negative is the acoustics upstairs are a little echoey and you'll find yourself shouting over each other. Get a table downstairs for a more relaxed dining experience
Cosy and intimate restaurant. We had a first culinary efghan experience and we were very satisfied. Highly recommend it.
Menu is so delicious and choisy. Highly recommended to visit, many people always
Delicious dishes and very friendly staff. The only dissapointing side of it is that is cash payment only.

What a place. Situated half way along Upper Street, it's about a 10 minute walk from Angel tube. Well worth it though. It's a great little restaurant. Decked out in candles, the only light in the place is dim, but perfect for the atmosphere it creates, which is warm and welcoming. 
The food is excellent French cuisine, at incredibly reasonable prices. We both had a three course meal, including a bottle wine from the a la carte menu and paid a little under £90. Superb value for money for such lovely food. Although we'd have been happy to pay much more, such was the quality on offer.
We will definitely be going back to try the other dishes on the menu. Both the lamb neck and the duck dishes were exceptional. 
A hidden gem of a restaurant. Well worth a visit.

Decent enough food for very reasonable prices. Food is good but won't blow you away, however, can't go wrong for the price. Service was attentive although atmosphere was lacking a little when I went (we were the only people there!) for lunch.

Really nice French food from a very unexpected place. Great for dinner as they turn some candles on and the place gets this romantic old restaurant vibe. Prices are good and menu is varied. I love that all the starters and mains are the same price - very easy to get your way through the menu.

My favourite restaurant in London. Far from pretentious and expensive. Steak fresh and delicious, Duck succulent and customer service 10/10. Amazing atmosphere. There is a reason why they have a loyal following.
love it actually. downstairs is very pretty (for dinner at least (when i went)). food was good and reasonably priced. feels propa french

Pleasantly surprised by this little Italian restaurant after living across the street & never visiting til this week. Definitely one of the better restaurants along Upper Street. 

Had the chicken Milanese & risotto - both were super tasty. Service was friendly & the venue was pretty full for a Monday evening.
This place is amazing. What a great atmosphere. The food is fantastic and very reasonable with friendly staff and great decor I would give a 10/10.
Highly recommended! Me and my friends had an amazing Christmas Day Lunch at here. Staff are always friendly and nice. Definitely will come back for more yummy foods 😋
Great food, fast service, reasonable prices, wonderful hospitality. Would definitely return!
Lively little spot. Tables rarely big enough for the pizza they serve & this is a good thing. Kind of kitsch. Kind of love it. Great house wine too.

Great coffee not great music. They used fantastic beans for a lovely coffee, which more than made up for the easy-listening covers of songs that deserved better. My friend liked the music though. Recommended.

Visiting a friend & after marching round The Heath I was treated to a lovely lunch & cuppa there. There was even a celebrity sighting; actor Bryan Brown taking in the world as it passed before his cafe table just outside on the patio.

Excellent pit stop to liven up your walk in Hampstead Heath. Unpretentious, friendly and great value. The best thing about it is the people who work there: always kind, funny and mischievous. Always a pleasure to drop by.
Pleasant cafe at the bottom of the hill. Good place to meet before or after doing some climbs on the bike up.

I have been going to calendar for years and never once have a had a warm welcome or so much as a smile from the staff. Today I was told that I can't sit under the heater because someone else might want to sit there! The main waiter/owner (not sure) seems to have utter contempt for the customers and is very rude and disrespectful! I will not spend another penny in that establishment.
Went for the new year's lunch with family and was amazing. The food and spread were great. It was topped with the presence of a mentalist and live band
Superb ambience. Fantastic service. The Sunday buffets are fun. Go there for a great experience.
food was good.. service is also good except the food was served a little late.  must try fish tikka here it was very tasty.
It was an okay experience. The coffee was good but the atmosphere was pretty noisy due to a party at the club next to the cafe.
Nice food. Nice ambience. Looking forward for next visit
Daily Mass at 10.00 a.m.  On Saturdays there's adoration and confession after Mass.
A wonderful Walker organ. Many recordings have been made on it and there is a fine recital series here each year. It’s heard at the Sunday midday mass.

Could not speak to Priest/administration to arrange a Mass for my late cousin

Altered rating to that from 1 ☆ to 5☆ parish secretary Lisa rang me within 2 days and a Mass was arranged.  Thank you Lisa.  God bless.
Really good church know one of the priests that are so helpful. Blessing from the priest father David.
Great church

Brockwell park is a great place to visit with the whole family, there is slways something going on in it from the County fairs to a host of other activities. The park is well maintained and kept clean and great for the walkers among us who want to have a physical challenge.  Worth a visit!
Great open park with a good amount of hills for running. Fantastic park to take your dog for a run. Beautiful views from the top

Lovely park with loads of amenities. Was surprised to stumble open so much green space in London! With loads of eateries at one side, too. A swimming pool, bike tracks, pond, band stand and loads of pokestops too!!!

Nice Park, with lots of space to breath and lots of different activities to perform. Cycling, bmx, calisthenics, running. Tennis, football, training court, swimming pool, vegan cafe, many accessible toilets, a huge playground, and easy access to all of these. I was there shooting a short film recently and it was 20 degrees, (in February!!!).

Peaceful  naturist morning reflectional beauty of the cool I rising of  the coming of day. Mind impact positives bringing forth the shinning ray of lights. To god be the glory, therefore once the moon light is to become at a later time, overall the dimension of the land the way of being ahead is knowing and understand the power of labour in earning.

A historic and unique building in heart of London. Located few miles away from the parliament and Westminster, Lambeth palace is a hidden treasure. The gardens are one of the most beautiful in London while the building itself has a great historic background, being the base of archbishop of Canterbury. The interior is like a time machine in the past, with an astonishing library and the portraits of all the archbishops. I definitely recommend that place, especially in the sunny days.

That’s fantastic palace to see in ur life time 🤝Beautiful secret gardens behind the Palace. Has a classical rotunda on a mound, pond, statues, magnificent roses, large swathes of grass, mature trees and a fantastic kitchen garden.
Only opened to the public on certain days of the year. And well worth a visit. Suitable for all ages and abilities.
You have to book a private tour of the Palace.

Beautiful secret gardens behind the Palace. Has a classical rotunda on a mound, pond, statues, magnificent roses, large swathes of grass, mature trees and a fantastic kitchen garden. Two mahoosive white fig trees that grow against the Palace were planted by Cardinal Pole during Queen Mary Tudor's reign. 
Only opened to the public on certain days of the year. And well worth a visit. Suitable for all ages and abilities.
You have to book a private tour of the Palace. 
Next door to the Garden Museum and Archbishop's Park, The Old Paradise Gardens, and a short stroll away along the River Thames Albert Embankment footpath from all the attractions South Bank has to offer.
An honour to visit. We were treated very well, in what felt like a lovely community environment.

Lambeth Palace is the seat of the Archbishop of Canterbury, the head of the Anglican communion. I was invited to the Palace by Rt. Rev. Dr. Graham Kings, official Chaplain of the Archbishop of Canterbury. He was gracious enough to host me in his home and I slept in room where the statue of St. Thomas More was standing. Participated in the morning prayers and it was really moving. They prayed for Ecumenical Christian Centre, Bangalore where I am the Director. I am looking forward to have more communion with the Churches and could come together in many dimensions. May the Holy Spirit guide the leaders to come together and thus to serve God and humanity.

Young people were using the park as a sort of makeshift soccer academy. It was fun to interrupt my morning walk to watch a bit of the game.

Like most, the could use a bit of attention by way of rehabilitation. It is not falling apart, but it is not as slightly as it could be.

My in laws live right next to the park so whenever I stay over I take my daughter to this park. Great clean park, lots of dogs so if your not a fan beware! They have a lively playground and for the older kids, tennis and basketball courts. They also have table tennis which is a pleasant surprise. I also go for a run the the park after a gym session which in the mornings is very refreshing.

I went there a few times to walk and read in the sun, it's quite calm and chilled if you want (depending where you sit) you can also enjoy a bit more activity of you get closer to the bigger groups or a pub nearby which sometimes has music. All and all it's a cool place
Very good location. Last sizable park before the river Thames. Lots of trees and greenery.
Very nice green space in an urban area. Great for walking and families. Attractive gardens and sport areas. Has reasonable facilities and a café.

My wife and I were visiting from America, and decided to take a look. We ended up spending all day in the museum. I could not believe that such a cool attraction was free. Of course, because of the great time we had we gave a donation and spent money at the gift store, but were more than happy to. What a fantastic place to visit and learn. This was probably the coolest thing we did in London, and if you are visiting London I would HIGHLY recommend it.

Clearly huge amounts of money have been poured into this museum in recent years. The displays are impressive and there's a good sense of narrative in the WW1 section. The balance between appealing to children and providing detailed information is good. 

The rest of the museum is a bit more random feeling. It's very hard to move about certain exhibits if it's more than a little busy so it's worth trying to come at an off peak time. However, you can't really fault it for this considering entrance is free.

Great attraction, although it is free it is always good to add to the voluntary contributions. The staff know their stuff and it is worthwhile taking time to talk to them. The cafe serves some great refreshments as well. The exhibitions are laid out thoughtfully, we spent most of the morning there. The holocaust exhibition is as you would expect, thought provoking and sombre, but extremely memorable. I had been here as a kid and the overriding memory was the large guns to the entrance, it was good to see them there still and again as an adult.

A great day out with lots to see.  I would recommend giving yourself plenty if time to see everything and read the information.  The holocaust area is well set out but very emotional to visit - it is almost silent as people walk around this part of the museum - Young children are not permitted in this area.

I expected more. The museum seems too small for the amount of people they attract. Apparently there are still halls being renovated, so maybe the score goes up next time. The first world war exposition is good but I think the setup of the mark IV (or is it a V?) Is way too dramatic and doesn't allow people to actually connect with it like the other tanks in the museum.

Always an amazing experience! This was my second time on the London eye but the first time for my kids too experience it! We had a blast! There is so much to see and the ride is a really long ride so you feel like you get a good amount of time in your container pod.  So many great spots and things to get pictures of while you are on the ride. Highly recommend!

One of the most iconic places in London. Easy to get to from Waterloo Station. Its always busy. Great Tourist Place to take pictures from of the Thames and London City. You can book tickets on the day or online. What an amazing experience. The view from the top was astonishing.
Its worth it!

The main thing - the ride - was obviously pretty nice. I liked the view and the atmosphere. 
Now to the reasons of why I only gave it 3 stars:
1. The waiting time. I've waited approx. 1.5 hours - even though I had the most expensive ticket!
2. The room in the cabin. Maybe because of so many tourists waiting, I don't really know: The cabin was a little bit too full. Now I know, that not everyone needs a sitting place, but I believe many tourists use the tour as a pause from their city trip.
3. The view. Don't get me wrong, I liked it. But for the London eye to be described as one of the main attractions of London to go to - it wasn't good enough. Now the problem here was a pretty funny one (not really): One of the parts of the London eye obstructed the view, which then results in approx. 20 sec of obstacle-free view above London.

For a glorified Ferris wheel this was pretty good. My group of friends was able to get the student rate, so that was good. We also all went together I a single pod, so that was also good. There were 12 of us, so small groups may have to be with us people. We also went at a later point in the night on a Friday, so there was no line. The staff was very friendly and nice! Would definitely recommend the view from the top, even on a cloudy day.

In an era where text messages are the norm, love letters are believed by many to be a thing of the past. While shooting your loved one a text saying that you miss them can be a great thing, why not show them how you really feel by sending them a letter? Do you have someone in your life that you adore? Show how much you appreciate him or her by giving them a unique and thoughtfully-written love paragraphs.

Many of us might not be used to writing letters anymore. But there is something incredibly romantic about a letter, especially when it is written to a boyfriend, girlfriend, husband, or wife.

I cannot recommend this enough. Definitely one of the best meals I've ever had, arguably the best. Absolutely delicious. I had a sharing meat platter thing. Unbelievable. Friendly staff too. Highly recommend!!!
Delicious and original food at reasonable prices. Nice and helpful staff. Pleasant atmosphere. Definitely worth a visit.

Lovely service and delicious food. For me, the fitfit was the highlight, but my friends loved the gorgeous coffee (and frankincense). It was all a delight for the senses. This wasn't my first time there, nor will it be my last.
Really delicious food and good service, very pleasant staff.  Had the vegetarian sharing dish and it was more than enough for two people.
Delicious food, perfectly spiced and authentically Eritrean! A taste explosion for both vegans and meat eaters alike.
Great Ambiance. Really good food. Went for the breakfast buffet and they had a lot of good choices. They even have gluten free options as well.

Went for wedding reception. Things where good, not great. Table with bride, groom and wedding party served last. Seemed to serve one table at a time. When the head table was served, most others where finished. Adding one additional server may have helped.

I travel a great deal and I have had breakfast at my fair share of hotel restaurants,  I have to say that this one in particular was very good.  I would most definitely recommend this place for anyone staying at this hotel.
Excellent food and the prices reflect that, it is a little pricey but well worth it if you enjoy fine dining. The service is excellent as you would expect from an upscale restaurant.
Went for weekend breakfast; good variety--hot & cold,  unlimited coffee, etc.; Staff is friendly,.

I took my family here for Mother’s Day roast.  Ambience and setting were lovely, staff were nice and helpful as usual. I had the roast beef which was very tender, vegetables were just right and the Yorkshire pudding was light and crispy. Everyone enjoyed their meal. All in all, a pleasant Sunday’s lunch.

Lovely setting, lovely staff. But a little disappointed since I was excited to go having seen so many good reviews.

 The beef itself was lovely, flavoured with rosemary, thick and tender. But there was something about the yorkshire pudding (I think) that left a funny greasy (like egg yolk) aftertaste in the mouth.  Homemade lemonade was nice and sour to cleanse the palate.

An absolute marvel of a place - friendly staff, delicious food and quality service. It is connected to the Park Plaza Waterloo Hotel by a glamorous lobby with comfortable couches and occasional live music.

Its bar is irreproachable, though the prices are disproportionately high compared to the restaurant. I recommend the Tomahawk to share with a friend, and the Affogato as a dessert.

This is an outstanding restaurant.  A hidden gem!  Great tasting food, fantastic staff, it was all around a pleasant experience.  I want to say a special thanks to the manager who made our last meal in London a memorable one. 

Thank you!

Florentine is an all-day dining brasserie-style restaurant in Waterloo and boy is it a top restaurant well worth your time. 

With a pan-European menu, it has slick interiors in low-lit settings that provides an intimate atmosphere. It's comfy as heck and great for groups as well as loved-up pairs.

The food was fantastic. The rib-eye steak was meat perfection - juicy and just the way I like it. The tiramisu and Venetian doughnuts were also a sweet success. The outstanding item on the menu was the ravioli. It's just smothered in this incredibly buttery sauce with shavings of truffles that took it up a level. 

Noise level is generally kept to a minimum which allows for meaningful conversations to flow. Service was fabulous too. Receptionists are so welcoming and waiters are very attentive making sure your glass is always full.

It's perfect for dates or to celebrate a special occasion (think birthdays). You won't regret coming to Florentine.

My girlfriend and I visited Fujiyama on a Saturday night. And they were packed!  it is a beautiful restaurant with a great ambience.  We were seated rather quickly. It took the waitress a little while to come and take our order. After waiting for our order for over an hour we asked the waitress if we can get it to go. It was brought out minutes later.  If the wait wasn’t so long I’d give this place five stars.

The sushi on the other hand was absolutely amazing!  We ordered five separate rolls and each one was better than the last.

This place is definitely a five-star restaurant but when they get packed on the weekends it is crazy.

We will definitely be going back to Fujiyama in the future but next time we’ll get our order to go.

Great place for a special lunch.  Food is always amazing, staff is friendly and helpful.  Some visits may have been better then others but that has nothing to do with the food.  I really love the ambiance of the place.. you get a great feeling when you walk in and it all makes for s great dining experience.  😋

I went here for my grandmother's birthday and we had the best night! The staff is so kind and I believe the manager personally sang happy birthday to her. I recommend anyone to come here if they have the time.

Fujiyama is a fun place to go with a crowd. For the past several years my niece has selected this hibachi restaurant as her go to place for a birthday party that includes family and close friends. The chef does his best to entertain guests with a little cooking show. Although I can't help but think he is laughing at us peasants as he tosses food in the air to catch in your mouth. The food is okay. Veggies, rice and shrimp are always good. Meat usually gets to dry and is not tasty. I guess that's why you get lots of sauce. The place is a bit loud so can be a challenge to hear even the person next to you. But not bad for a once a year gathering.
japanese food and the setting here is great. I like it here, great food & service. Fast, efficient, and courteous service. The bill won't break you.

My friends and I had dinner here recently and it was very good. Several of us had sushi, which was excellent. Several others ordered the pork chops, chicken fried rice and a veggie dish. Everyone enjoyed their food and our server was very helpful and in fact, gave us individual checks - which was greatly appreciated. I definitely recommend this restaurant. The food is wonderful!!! Adequate portion sizes and services. The price is fair as well. Only con they charge two dollars of you ask for additional sauce. I get it but it seemed like they didnt put enough on the plate.

Ordered sushi one early Sat afternoon and the seafood was tough and tasteless, just not fresh overall. My date ordered the fried pineapple rice dish. Had hair in it. Different length & texture from ours. Definitely overpriced for that quality. But I guess you're paying for ambience and the fact there's nothing much else in the area? 
Sad because I thought I found a nice & super close asian bistro.

I had a great time here but my date not so much. We arrived late and there was only a few people at the restaurant as it was very close to closing time. I ordered the calamari and she ordered a tea. When she got the green tea it smelled like a rusty pot and it tasted metallic, nothing like classic green tea. My calamari was excellent. We then ordered our entree. She got a sushi bowl salad type thing with some sushi rolls and I got general tap chicken with Jasmine rice. Well again my meal, excellent but gets not so much. One bite into the bowl and she found a nice long thick juicy hair, very healthy, good texture and black. She was obviously disgusted. She asked for a remake but for whatever reason they couldn't make get another one (I'm guessing because it was closing time). So she ate her 4 shrimp rolls and I ordered her calamari appetizer since she had some of mines and enjoyed it, plus she was still hungry. She really did not enjoy the experience but my experience was decent. The atmosphere on the place was great. It was in a great location.

The food is wonderful!!! Adequate portion sizes and services. The price is fair as well. Only con they charge two dollars of you ask for additional sauce. I get it but it seemed like they didnt put enough on the plate. We really love the place. We go here for everyone's birthday. The food is good and atmosphere's not bad. My Bridge Club went to lunch before our weekly game and really enjoyed the ambiance, variety of food choices, and excellent service of Ichiban. It was indeed, Number One!!
Bowie has very few restaurants that are not franchises. This Asian bistro is one of the few options available for decent Asian food and sushi. The food has fresh ingredients and the service is good.
Wonderful gallery! Saw The Origin of Life by Dean Kenning there, one of the best modern art exhibitions I’ve ever seen. Lovely little cafe downstairs too.
Gig was fantastic. Music top. Worth going every time
Really distinct place with high-concept modern art. Cute little café downstairs. They commissioned the stuff in there now themselves and I loved it.
Great vegan food
I drank something here and conversed

Sister restaurant to Trinity and Bistro Union, upstairs serves sharing plates of high quality 
 modern European cuisine on high up sharing tables. Absolutely fantastic restaurant for a date, with a bit more of a casual atmosphere.

A historic place where you must see. Iconic place to have pictures to proof you visited London. You can walk around the place and have good access to rest of London monuments. Opposite the square kid the gate to Buckingham palace were you can walk directly to it and watch the change of guards. Nice restaurants and cafes are present near by. Public transportation is available to anywhere in London. Enjoyed it a lot

Iconic space with cool lion statues and fountains. With the traffic circling around it, makes you feel like you're at the center of London. Definitely recommended for first-timers, though personally I don't go out of my way to see it, or for repeated visits - a little too much concrete for my tastes.

No much to say here... an impressive square that you must check out when visiting London. Apart from the statues and the museum, it's the atmosphere that makes this a unique square. Plus it's close to cool areas like Soho and Chinatown.

If you're visiting London, Trafalgar Square is one of the most iconic places of this great city. Apart from gazing up at Lord Nelson, the apportioning of the square is a great place to be, hang out, or meet (new) people. It's worth a visit, even if only to say you've been. 

It's a good place all round; charming scenery, amazing street performers, and a overall lovely atmosphere. 

Be aware that this is a very popular tourist destination. It is very close to the National Museum and Buckingham Palace, so depending on the time of day, it could get really busy.

I like it. It’s a good place all round, charming scenery, amazing street performers, lovely atmosphere, and centred right in the middle of London. It’s easy to get to, as there are many taxis in the area, and you can easily get the Piccadilly line to here. All in all, it is good and I would recommend it to anyone to anyone who is in London or nearby.
For me, this is the best museum in Europe. So many fantastic works of art.
Don't waste your time. The gallery is almost empty. Go to the national museum.
Short and sweet narrative of Bangkok fine arts.
Great exhibition. Especially, Marsis great paintings.
Definitely worth a visit! Intriguing artwork, and I think I literally spent hours there.

This is a very well laid out gallery. There are many early works, including many of prominent Aboriginal people and early pioneers. There are sculptures as well as paintings and sketches. Although I found much of it interesting, there are probably too many displays to make seeing the whole gallery a totally enjoyable experience. On the other hand, there is so much information about each of the items that it would be difficult to rush through too quickly.  It's great that our explorers, Australia's original people and business, sport and political figures are acknowledged with a portrait in the gallery. There is paid car parking below and a cafe.

Amazing! Spent hours here. So interesting and so much to see. We didn’t want to leave. On the day we visited it was quiet and relaxed and the perfect activity for a cold rainy day in Canberra. Will be back here again for sure.
A beautiful space. The collection is very diverse and incredibly high quality. The staff are friendly and helpful.

Mostly really good. 
Did have issues getting around with the pram and nappy bag as security was pretty tough. Recommend you take minimal on the day. Very basic parent room but it does the job. 
Echoed a bit (noticed when my newborn wouldn't stop farting lol). 
Well displayed artwork and pretty easy parking. Cafe was pretty good too.

NGA is a world class gallery, a large gallery comparable to those interstate and overseas. There are permanent and touring exhibitions, featuring a mix of contemporary and traditional art from Western and global artists. Something for everyone, suited to all ages and physical abilities. Good selection of indigenous art, and well curated selection of Australian art generally.

Great memorial. Edith Louisa Cavell (/ˈkævəl/; 4 December 1865 – 12 October 1915) was a British nurse. She is celebrated for saving the lives of soldiers from both sides without discrimination and in helping some 200 Alliedsoldiers escape from German-occupied Belgium during the First World War, for which she was arrested. She was accused of treason, found guilty by a court-martial and sentenced to death. Despite international pressure for mercy, she was shot by a German firing squad. Her execution received worldwide condemnation and extensive press coverage.

Wonderful area to sit and relax as well as to learn more about history. It is important to see more and more monuments and statues made for women and the profound part they’ve played in history and the betterment of society. 
Access to other attractions, as well as to the transit system and Trafalgar Square, is easy from here.
Highly recommended!
A lovely monument to an amazing woman.
A very nice and famous place in London.

If you think it's nice and lively during the day, it becomes absolutely magical at night!

I could spend hours getting lost and browsing in the M&M and Lego stores. There are three movie cinemas to watch from around the square. But most importantly, there are many talented street performers to watch in awe.

Not technically the centre of London but feels like it is. Would be more enjoyable if there were less buskers. Feels more like nightclub when they are all in full swing. Though if you sit in the centre you can avoid them. Apart from that expect to see multiple themed events the year round
Very lively and diverse atmosphere. Great day out for family. There is an M&M store which is four floors, lovely for young and old. Had a great time with my family.

A great public open space - a central square with statue which is nice to be in on a warm sunny day

Around the square are a number of cinemas which regularly have premier openings for films so keep an eye out for them if you like star spotting

Also a number of hotels and loads and loads of restaurants  and bars most of which have outside seating

Right in the centre of the west end of London

They also have a Christmas fair and street entertainment 

A very busy place full of life and fun

Be aware of the few idiots who want to spoil things and look after bags phones etc - it's a safe place but they do have some who try to steal your belongings as with everywhere which is busy and popular

A good place to visit when in London albeit the prices in some of the places are quite high

Give it a go - you will not be disappointed
Good area to visit. Perhaps consider this as a place for hotels to stay. Lots if night things to do...shoes, shops and restaurants.
Friendly staff, nice food. We had a banquet for 7 people with a pile of beers. Loads of well prepared, tasty food and reasonably priced as well.
Really nice surroundings lovely friendly staff and great food.  Brilliant value for money.  Well worth a visit.
Fantastic food and friendly service. Only place that has good aromatic crispy duck. They make some great food.
Would give zero stars if possible. Food was terrible, and the service was even worse! Avoid like the plague.
Remember that You have to pay extra money for rice. Beef was... lets say "good" and the service really nice.

Our favourite Chinese restaurant in London. Great food, friendly and very helpful staff, good location and atmosphere. Not overpriced. Really the best. Stayed open a little later while our Uber finally arrived. Try you won't regret.

My family and I have been coming here for generations. It has miraculously managed to keep the same level of price and quality for many years. 

It is a very nostalgic place and an insight into Chinese restaurants. It practically has the same decorations, ordering style and menu after all these years. It hasn't changed much and it is considered in my opinion an iconic look at how Chinese dim sum in London should be served.

Been here several times and service is always good.  No complaints regarding the food and price is acceptable.  This time had the set for 2 @ 14.80 each.  Set included egg fried rice and sweet corn soup.  So stuffed afterwards.

Hands down this is the best Chinese restaurant in London.
I've been let down by many restaurants in London with their fake Chinese food.

Joy King Lau has good service and respects the elderly customers. The sweet and sour pork is so fluffy and the sauce is very traditional.

This simply is the best in London for Chinese food.

This is a wonderful Hong Kong/ Cantonese restaurant that has been a linchpin of London's Chinatown for around 50 years or more.  The staff have changed over the years of course, but this restaurant has not followed the latest trends.  Rather it continues to provide good traditional Cantonese food and the staff are quite friendly.
This is a treasure I shouldn't even be telling you about!

Amazing concert venue. I have been going to this venue for years and I'm always amazed by the ornate detail of this theater. Great space and easy to get in and out of. Great places to grab something to eat and drink nearby as well. Weather it be comedy shows, music or plays, the Palace is a great spot to enjoy.

Beautiful building in downtown Albany. Saw Justin Moore last night.. Pretty clean. Sticky floors but that's what happens when drinks spill. Would definitely go to another show there. I didn't think any seat in the house was a bad seat. We had 10th row. But I also went to back for a breather and those seats weren't bad either.

This theatre is absolutely gorgeous and sounds great. The staff is awesome and concession costs are reasonable with a decent selection of canned craft brews available for $8. I highly recommend seeing any show here.

Attended a concert here with my daughter. Small venue made it seem very personal. I don't believe there was a bad seat in the house! The baroque style 
interior was beautiful. Depending on the band, I would definitely make the four hour drive to return to the Palace Theatre.

I really enjoyed seeing my favorite band at this venue. The architecture in this place is beautiful. The sound is great. The staff was kind.  Seating for the event was first come first sat. I will definitely return for a show in the future.\mm/

Beautiful place! Gorgeous atmosphere. I pictured myself waltzing regally in front of everyone, my hands linked in front of me, my legs swishing against my purple gown — the color of royalty — on my way to my rightful place in the throne. The teatime meal is pretty good. I love the savory plate (the smoked salmon sandwiches — yum!). Not too fancy, not too old country either. It's just right! The rest of the menu isn't too appealing, and their coffee is quite good. Just ask for extra hot (which is regular hot in the US). The London Christian Singles night is fun, and so is Jazz night. You'll enjoy the gorgeous architecture and clean fun. Be sure to pay a visit if you're in the area.

Gorgeous café, beautiful atmosphere. Went for one of their jazz night performances, which was lovely and engaging. Slightly too expensive for what it was, but still very enjoyable. The dinner is not great, but I've heard amazing things about the afternoon tea and will definitely return to try their scones!

This place is really nice, although not as secret as the multiple signs directing you to it would have you believe. It's not like they want to be secret! They want to share delicious scones and tea with you, or beer and a meal. Your choice; either way you will leave satisfied.

I was invited by friends to a Jazz evening at the Crypt, on occasions lopike that it is closed to the public and only admitted with tickets at very reasonable prices. We had a table dry near the band, they were good and had a lot of loyal followers. The place is self service and there is quite a lot of food to buy, soups and good main courses, sweets wine, soft drinks. People quite frequently come and collect the empties. I only had a soup and a roll as well a couple of glasses of wine, we had a bottle of white between the 2 of us and the third was on red wine, we also had bottles and tap water. A fantastic evening. People were jiving in the aisles. The concert was from 8 - 10 with a little break. I could not say if it was the Saxophone, the bass, the drummer or the singer were best, I loved them all and was bobbing up and down on my seat.They also played requests. I will certainly return

Really nice hidden little cafe is a pretty spectacular setting with a great atmosphere. Food is decent and price is good.

Would definitely recommend.

Cheap and fast. Tastes cheap and fast. Not that it's bad, it's just not as good as Japanese food can get. I had high hopes. But they did a great job with getting our food out quick due to it being an hour before a show. Bento boxes look good.

In the 10+ years I've been going here, it never disappoints. Excellent staff, great food. As authentic as you're going to get in London. It would be a crime if high rents and redevelopment ever touched this joint.

Amazing service and the food was very authentic! We had free snacks and Japanese tea on arrival. I also liked that we were given our bill after we ordered so it allowed us more freedom to leave when we wanted.

Awful place!!!  If you enjoy being shouted at in front of others and overpriced food this is the place  for you. Staff are rude and abrupt with no manners!!! The food is virtually inedible, dry and tasteless!! Woman on the till openly discriminates and we felt pushed to leave due to her attitude and hostility towards us!!! Won’t be going back, can get a better quality of food and service elsewhere.
Great food and reasonably priced, always enjoy their food. Does get busy so you might have to wait a bit. Service is quick and food is not Michelin star, but very tasty.

Loved this place. Location was perfect. Room were comfy and had everything we needed. Staff were very friendly. Loved the roof top bar. Ezio served an amazing cocktail, so good we went back the night after we'd checked out. Views over Leicester Square were perfect. Would definitely return.

Great location right in the middle of the square plenty on your door step and round the corner from China town. Staff were friendly and very helpful. Sky lounge was nice and had some nice views. Good size room and facilities.
