Fabulous location and great views if you get the right room. The room decor was cool - themed around early C20th cinema. The negatives are it can be a bit noisy if Leicester Square is busy and the room wasn't particularly clean (the wooden floor was sticky and the mugs were dusty). I'd definitely stay there again.

Great location. Very quiet room. Rooftop restaurant was awesome for breakfast and to even do some work in the morning. On some days you can see the sunrise from there if you get there early enough.  I will stay here again. Walking distance to many great Asian restaurants I had Chinese, Korean, Vietnamese. Very populated area at night - I felt comfortable walking around by myself.

Fantastic hotel in the heart of Leicester Square. Had a great view from our bedroom overlooking the square. Rooms are modern, clean and kitted out with coffee machine, dressing gown, safe, etc. Great bed and TV too. Balcony restaurant on 9th floor overlooking all that the eye can see.... fantastic in the evening. Reception friendly and helpful. Expensive but worth it.
Good hotel with nice food option.
Very costly , but good in taste, quantity is also ok
Good place to stay in. More comfortable, convenience to restaurant.
Place is good and cheap for holding meetings and conferences
Nice location for a hotel. It is before ambala and this is nice place for stay if you travelling for long location. Nice rooms available. It's right on the road so easily visible.

If you think it's nice and lively during the day, it becomes absolutely magical at night!

I could spend hours getting lost and browsing in the M&M and Lego stores. There are three movie cinemas to watch from around the square. But most importantly, there are many talented street performers to watch in awe.

Not technically the centre of London but feels like it is. Would be more enjoyable if there were less buskers. Feels more like nightclub when they are all in full swing. Though if you sit in the centre you can avoid them. Apart from that expect to see multiple themed events the year round
Very lively and diverse atmosphere. Great day out for family. There is an M&M store which is four floors, lovely for young and old. Had a great time with my family.

A great public open space - a central square with statue which is nice to be in on a warm sunny day

Around the square are a number of cinemas which regularly have premier openings for films so keep an eye out for them if you like star spotting

Also a number of hotels and loads and loads of restaurants  and bars most of which have outside seating

Right in the centre of the west end of London

They also have a Christmas fair and street entertainment 

A very busy place full of life and fun

Be aware of the few idiots who want to spoil things and look after bags phones etc - it's a safe place but they do have some who try to steal your belongings as with everywhere which is busy and popular

A good place to visit when in London albeit the prices in some of the places are quite high

Give it a go - you will not be disappointed
Good area to visit. Perhaps consider this as a place for hotels to stay. Lots if night things to do...shoes, shops and restaurants.

We had a great stay at Travelodge in Marylebone. The hotel room was very quiet and we had a great night sleep in the comfy bed.
The staff were very accommodating keeping our bags safe before check in and after check out. Especially Nesh on reception  was very polite.

The hotel is right next to the tube station and Oxford Street is a 15 minute walk away. 

We will definitely be coming back.
Good budget option for central London. The location is very convenient and the rooms spacious and clean. The staff were friendly and helpful.

Friendly staff and had a good one night stay. I got 40% discount on the price. A bit noisy area due to it being close to train  station but I would stay again. I could not stop the shower after bath and there was no phone in the room to call the helpdesk . But I found the number on Google and called from my mobile. A friendly staff came to room quickly and fixed it.
Conveniently located for Marylebone station. Not tried the recently opened restaurant, but close to the various restaurants along Baker Street. Staff are consistently friendly and helpful.
Couldn't sleep because there was so much noise on the street from the very early morning deliveries. Couldn't shut the noise out. Good central location of you don't mind not sleeping.

I love this place, I often visit this place and take pictures, Both the Wellington Arch and Marble Arch(originally sited in front of Buckingham Palace) were planned in 1825 by George IV to commemorate Britain's victories in the Napoleonic Wars. During the second half of the 1820s, the Commissioners of Woods and Forests and the King resolved that Hyde Park, and the area around it, should be renovated to match the splendour of rival European capital cities, and that the essence of the new arrangement would be a triumphal approach to the recently completed Buckingham Palace

First time ever here and it was very enjoyable. 

I’d recommend that if it’s not raining go to the very top and experience the views on either side of the arch. 

There’s detailed information on the actual ‘Battle of Waterloo’.

When back at the start I’d recommend trying the Sloe Gin and the English Mead which are excellent.

The Wellington Arch is a triumphal arch commemorating the victories of Wellington during the Napoleonic Wars. The arch is topped with a distinctive quadriga of Nike, the winged goddess of victory, descending on a chariot of war. She holds a laurel wreath, the classical symbol of victory and honour. The slightly odd part of the sculpture is the charioteer, which is a small boy. The symbolism of which eludes me. The magnificence of the monument is somewhat muted by it's location in the middle of a busy roundabout.
Great place to walk and feel the London vibes. There are many restaurants and coffee shops around, other interesting points and many buses and subway lines.
Small but really interesting history about the arch, Wellington and Battle of Waterloo. Great view from the top.

Grandiose, packed full of history, well preserved and presented with talks or audio visual guides this is a slice of history and art to entertain, amaze ,and imagine.... and the art is beautiful and you can get up and close to admire!

I visited the home of the Duke of Wellington in London and I have to say the house and staff are extremely brilliant.

Both Martin and Aurora, (English Heritage staff) were really helpful and were able to tell so much knowledge about the history of the Duke and his life.

There’s no inside images on this review as photography isn’t permitted 😐
Really great place to visit to see lots of the Duke of Wellington's history. The audio guide is really good as it talks you through all the rooms. Great paintings and lots of fantastic history

Number 1, London; what can be more of an address than that!  A grand Georgian building home to the first Duke of Wellington and containing many many paintings of the Duke, his contemporaries and historical figures. Quite a  wonderful collection of historical silver too.  Well worth a visit.
Great smaller museum with a beautiful gallery room. Also amazing silver setting for the dining room.

Had an amazing time, I always wanted to visit but hadn't had the chance until recently. Staff were so kind , I was helped by a lovely girl who took photos , I suffer from panic attacks and I got lost, she was so attentive and helped me to remain calm ( I told her she deserves the 5 stars alone her name was Eden).  I will definitely be visiting again as I really enjoyed this long awaited experience despite the expense.

Excellent Madame Tussauds museum. I came to London on March, that could explain why there were not too much visitors so it was just perfect to take time walking around and taking pictures. Cool and helpful staff. Realistic wax figures and lovely London spirit ride.

Fun family day out. The staff were very helpful and friendly after I fainted in the queue. Offering me the use of a wheelchair and helping my family explore each level with ease. Thank you. Brilliant customer service.

We have enjoyed our visit. We think it's better to buy your tickets online before you go( choose the fast track tickets so that you don't have to wait). The spirit of London tour ( in a miniature taxi styled train) was nice and our son enjoyed also the star wars section and the marvel 3d movie.

Quite a small museum that definitely brings life to Sherlock Holmes' character. The staff were quite informative and welcoming. 221B was definitely a highlight for a fan such as myself.

You can buy tickets from the gift shop next door. As it is a small space, there are only about 15 spots per session!

The best example of living period costume I have come across!  Absolutely everyone was in character! After giving the introduction, the butler was asked if Sherlock Holmes was real, and he kindly explained that the museum was there to help build the story. Brilliant experience and highly recommend!!

Worth visiting if you are a fan. It is on the pricey side, though. And you will run out of things to see pretty quickly as it is small. But to experience what it might have been like to live in an Elizabethan flat, it's pretty cool. Also it's very busy.

I would not recommend... if your Scottish,  stay well clear!!!

The management's xenophobia towards any one who is Scottish will have you reeling through your teeth.

The cashier refused to take our legal British tendered money of £20 clydesdale note. 

We asked to speak to the manager but instead the supervisor was called... its ridiculous!

We ended up fulfilling payment via bank card. For us, that was the matter over and done with. But not for the supervisor... instead, he followed us out the ticket office onto the pavement and humiliated us in front of the general public!

I will not be returning and I definitely do not recommend! Stay well clear!

A nifty little locale for those who are fans of the series. The people were all extremely friendly and knowledgeable, throughout. Felt like the cost of the tour was a little too much, plan on spending a couple hours to make it worth your money.
Nice food. I accidentally knocked down a glass from the table with my purse and they were very kind about it!! I recommend the lamb kefta  kebabs :)

One of my favourite places to eat in London. Always make sure I visit Maroush when in the city. Great service and plenty of options available on the menu, food tastes great. Definitely recommend people to come here if you're spending the day shopping or in town, lamb shwarama was my favourite on the menu.

We hadn't booked but luckily they got us a table, the disadvantage was it was downstairs and when the door opened we kept getting a cold blast! The staff were very keen, gave us the menus and a minute later cane to take the order. The food was nice, and the place had a good ambience.

Always always excellent service. The chef behind the counter was extra ordinary today. He made my dish exactly how I wanted it. We were spoiled today as always. Love Maroush. Never let me down when I bring my friends in. The staff were also lovely.

The food is nice. The restaurant setting isn't great. It feels like street food or a cheap place even though it's not. People going all around you and they are in a hurry for a turn over because they want to sit everyone in that ground floor. Not giving you an option to sit upstairs or to have a  time to relax as you eat your meal.

An institution that has stayed true to what it does best, The Sea Shell of Lisson Grove offers an ample selection of seafood and variants of its signature fish and chips. Top marks for the batter, which was light and crispy and served as the perfect canvas to the generous portions of fish. The fish was fresh and juicy, and sat beautifully with the batter. When your fish and batter stands up to each other in perfect harmony, you know this is a place that has honed its craft well. 

Chips and mushy peas were well executed and dependable. Oddly enough, the coffee was excellent.

17/03/19
Very nice place for a nice old fish and chips meal. You get a big amount of food for a decent price ( i didn’t go to the restaurant because prices are really high so i just went to the takeaway section , ordered and ate on the high tables for half price, your welcome ;) . My recommendation : cod , chips , pickles , rolls is the one ! Cod poppers are really nice . Everything is really fresh and cooked well. Average meal price £11 but its really worth it. Parking is right outside the store . One of the best places for fish and chips in London👍 👏 see you soon !
Best fish and chips in North London- an institution. Wonderful fresh fish cooked in delicious crispy batter. Do not have fish and chips anywhere else!
Portion size was good and not too reasonably priced. Unfortunately, family and I vomited that evening after eating here. Don't think we will be coming back here

That two of our group were compelled to share our experience with other diners should speak volumes. See review directly prior to this.

We arrived with a reasonably large party, 15 of us. Though the food when we eventually got it was brilliant, the restaurant was simply ill equipped to handle a group of this size. 

Slow service, forgotten items, staff not attentive, staff irritated when serving us. The whole experience, for quite early on a Saturday evening was sub par. Also, the attitude of the waitress that manged our table was poor, her demeanour doesn't really lend itself to customer service.

There also didn't seem to be anyone in charge, so managing our frustration was something they did inadequately.

The service was friendly and fast, even though they had some big groups come in.  Nice atmosphere.  

I had the fish and chips which was good.  A bit too oily for me but that might be the style many like.

The service was terrible, had to go again and remind the waiter that we want to order food (burgers). The food came in very quickly and was reasonably tasty, however in order to pay there was another long wait to wait for the manager to apply a student discount.
Overall tasty food, however absolutely not worth the price.
Lovely casual place where you can just sit and chat with your friends while having an easy going meal. Nothing fancy. Well priced. Dessert menu could be better as there wasn't much choice.
Staff very friendly and efficient. Good value for money. I recommend that, if you order a burger (I had the kimchi), that a side order may complete your main
Pleasant atmosphere. Two for one cocktails are great. The vegan burger isn't particularly amazing, but overall was satisfactory.

Meat Liquor should definitely be on your list if you're a fan of burgers and chicken! This particular restaurant is my favourite of the chain as it resembles something out of a zombie apocalypse, very dark and dingy interior with lots of deep reds and industrial, metal type decoration. The service is reasonable but they do get exceptionally busy and orders start taking longer to arrive and sides and sundries get forgotten about unless you repeatedly remind them. I have tried most of the items on the menu, with the dead hippie burger being my favourite. Food is always bought out hot and the portion sizes are very generous. Perfect place for a naughty cheat meal. Will most certainly return

Without a doubt the best chicken burgers and wings ever. Overall great. Only issue I have had is the seating on arrival. Sometimes asked to stand around by the bar when tables clearly available. But the food is that good its worth the wait.

Staff member got shirty with me when I politely asked about our table after waiting more than 30 minutes. I don't appreciate being spoken down  to like that and will never be returning. Reading the other google reviews there seems to be a couple of reviews which concur about the attitude of the staff. Vote with your feet, there are many places which understand customer service and deserve and value your custom. This isn't one of them. Not sure why people are so keen on the food as it was also way too greasy compared to what other burger places.
I go purely for the chicken wings. My brother got me hooked on them. They are delicious and should honestly market the sauce used. Staff are friendly and the service is quick.

Great atmosphere, there's a lot of cool drawings on the ways and it's a got a dark theme decor. Meal was really nice. I would mention that if you're coming from other parts of Europe it can be a bit pricey. But that's with all places in London.

I went for my birthday and had an excellent meal - just can’t believe I had to keep my jacket on. There were other members of the public who were sitting in T-shirt’s. Apart from that exceptional food. Can’t complain

After 20 year's have finally returned...and no this is not just old school French. But French food at it's best, chicken breast that melted in the mouth i had to ask how was cooked. Staff knowlegable and friendly.
Yes, this is prim and proper but go treat yourself, look at offers.
I think now for me  a regular London haunt.

Highly recommend this restaurant to vegetarians and carnivores alike. The vegetarian menu lives up to its name and is truly exceptional, and the wine pairing is just an added treat. All of the dishes were cooked and prepared to an enormously high standard where technique and presentation had been given a lot of attention without sacrificing richness in flavour. I almost lost hope in French vegetarian food after my recent visit at Restaurant Gordon Ramsay, but Le Gavroche restored my faith in vegetarian-friendly French fine-dining. Will happily return very soon.

Absolutely delightful! Flawless service, flawless food. Service was perfectly balanced between formal and informal. Made to feel very welcome. Lovely relaxed ambiance. I can't think of even one area on which they can improve! Very good service also by the lady opening the door to the restaurant (you need to ring the bell on arrival) and welcomed us, hung up our coats, and bade us farewell on leaving.
My wife and I had the fixed price lunch and it was amazing. Such great food, drinks and staff. The ambience in the reataurant was also good.

Short visit, hard to think of anything they could do better.  Didn't try the cafe (because of other reviews)... but the grounds and house are much better than I'd have expected for a free attraction.   Perhaps some more litter bins in the grounds would help keep them tidier.

Beautiful place to go walk around. The gardens are beautiful and the forests are incredible to wander through. Theres even a farm and at the right time of year you can see the little lambs right after they're born. Great place to bring the kids to burn off some energy.
Very nice area for longer walk. There are so many birds singing, you really feel like you got out of the city

I often visit the coffee shop following a trip to the Clockhouse nursery. The cakes are amazing. Lovely coffee and wonderful sandwiches. Prices are what you would expect for the high standards. Really friendly staff.

First time here and had a great time. Had the best ham sandwich ever, will be coming back in the summer. The only downside was there was so much dog poo everywhere which was disappointing, even in front of the cafe by the lake. Not used in seeing this a stately hall.

What an absolute pleasure to have this on our doorstep! Can't believe we haven't been sooner! Well priced drinks and the cinema is large with good leg room. We came for the NT Live All About Eve and I can't recommend them enough either, really get to see the actors facial expressions which you miss in the theatre! Kiln or Tricycle, who cares, what is most important is what it brings to the community!

Lovely little space with a great view from all seats. Watch out for the regular Upfront Comedy Club nights as well as a fab selection of theatre and films. Nice touch having recycling bins and bathrooms that do not assume your gender identity (signs invite you to "please use the bathroom you need").

They have parent and baby screenings every Monday evenings 2pm. For Brent and Camden residents it just costs £4.50, others for £6.00 still reasonable! I didn’t see any drinks and food sold for during a movie, but there is a free space with plenty of tables and seats on the ground floor(the screen is on the lower ground floor) where you can enjoy chatting with your friends also babies before/after a movie. The staffs are very welcoming and nice. I’ll definitely come back again.

Previously know as the Tricycle theatre the Kiln is on Kilburn High Street., you could almost walk past it it’s not that obvious. It’s quite an intimate theatre with a cafe, bar and restaurant attached. During matinees the full evening menu is served which is not obvious when you check out the website.

I have only just discovered this wonderful local Theatre and am impressed.   From the moment you walk through the doors you will be embraced by the vibrant atmosphere! Great use of colour and light to cheer the soul on a miserable February night.  Staff were wonderful and incredibly helpful. We had a vegetarian platter which sounds boring, but was probably the best bar nibble i have ever had. Very tasty,  fresh and a fab balance of flavours - all for just £10! The theatre seats were comfortable and quite roomy.
Wish the Kiln was my local - heigh ho!

Great place for a gig.  Excellent selection of food trucks, beer and spaces to hang out.  Main auditorium is big and the atmosphere great.  Sound could be better, but that's subjective and depends where you stand.

Awesome place with extra ordinary places. Beautiful gardens and parks with small lake. There is bars, Ice skating ring, exhibitions about BBC, Action Park and Theater. I enjoyed walking through the alleys. Good place to have a picnic with friends

The Alexandra Palace Theatre is a short walk from the local railway station but the walk is all up hill (views are fantastic) so please note if using the railway then be prepared for the walk,  There is a free car park at the theatre.  The theatre itself is a funky restoration of an old musical hall theatre crossed with loft style architecture, liberal amounts of steel and a decent bar.  Its an excellent venue, you will not be disappointed.

What a lovely day/evening it turned out to be. To start with I must thank all the staff from the car parking attendants to the Bar staff who all conducted themselves in the most friendly and professional way. All wore a smile and spoke with respect. Also, thank you so much for the free car parking which is great and very helpful to all who attend the venue. It’s a pleasant peaceful area with breathtaking views over London. The family and I very much look forward to visiting Alexandra Palace again. Once again... Thank you.

Lovely building, suitable for all sorts of events. Parking in the on site car park is available but I recommend you get there early as the car park fills up very quickly. There was even a shuttle bus from the car park up the hill to the entrance. Beautiful view across London too.
Nice place to visit. They have family activities on Sundays and I believe on Wednesdays during midterm holidays.
Fine place -friendly, helpful. A treasure trove of starting points to explore.
I LOVE THE LARGE OPEN SPACE PARK AROUND THE MUSEUM
Easy to get to. Would be nice if sold drinks or some food. But shops near by so not essential
It's a nice place. I think it has more potencial

The Marshes runs along side the Canal, and is a pleasant path to walk, and/or run, dog walking and so forth. Need to watch out for Cyclists, as they do bike along the path also, but tend not to ring their bell to warn you when they are coming. With that said, it is peaceful area where you can have picnics, or pay a visit the Cafe.

I love Tottenham marshes for a walk with my kids. Lots of nature and the Lea navigation  with some lovely narrow boats. You can easily forget your in North London. If you cycle along the river you can get to the Olympic stadium and limehouse at the Thames and the other 12 miles to broxbourne and a lovely pub to refresh yourself.
Wild looking park, I love walking around here altho it might feel a bit dangerous at times as very isolated. Perfect for walking dogs!
A good place for a traffic free walk, Jog or simply escape the City scenery. Highly recommended if your local don't forget the River Lea runs right through here too.🙂

Great place to get away from the city and experience some nature near water. Real humans (as opposed to instagram humans) live here on houseboats and you forget the mental pressures of the city around you.

Great great great I'm ex RAF and this museum goes from strength to strength. The latest addition a whole new interactive area is just amazing the kids LOVED it and we even went back to that part before going home. All the aircraft and displays are clean tidy and informative s great day out and it's FREE... So please remember to pop a few quid in the donation pots as you go round everything goes to help restore the aircraft so every penny well spent in my opinion.

This is an excellent Museum showing every event in aviation. I wanted to experience everything from the first flight through to current date and it did this. The staff were 1st class and incredibly helpful, I also did the Spitfire Experience that was worth every penny and needs to be advertised more clearly, so you don't miss it. You could spend a whole day here and not see it all. If you love aircraft you will love it here.

An amazing day out. Loads to see and do. Bring your own picnic or eat at one of the many cafes. Minimal charge for parking and free entrance to the museum. Some incredible exhibits from 100 years ago all the way to the new GET fighter jet.

Beyond spectacular, really.  Such a dramatically-special place it's hard to believe!  One needs to experience this to understand the unique value that has been created with the latest re-vamp.

Staff are truly amazing & fully dedicated to this critical, historical, wonderful attraction.

Do not miss this, guys ...  go!

Give yourself at least half a day  -  it's huge.  Take a decent camera with you, as well.

Enjoy!

A real experience I would totally recommend you take the time and visit.
Unfortunately the restaurant I use there wasn't that good it was okay possibly recommend a picnic.
The restaurant some years ago was completely different and much better seems to have lost that.
The gift shop could be a lot better room for improvement in that section.
But the museum itself I would totally recommend you visit I'm sure the experience you will receive will be worth the time you've taken to get there.

Great place for a gig.  Excellent selection of food trucks, beer and spaces to hang out.  Main auditorium is big and the atmosphere great.  Sound could be better, but that's subjective and depends where you stand.

Awesome place with extra ordinary places. Beautiful gardens and parks with small lake. There is bars, Ice skating ring, exhibitions about BBC, Action Park and Theater. I enjoyed walking through the alleys. Good place to have a picnic with friends

The Alexandra Palace Theatre is a short walk from the local railway station but the walk is all up hill (views are fantastic) so please note if using the railway then be prepared for the walk,  There is a free car park at the theatre.  The theatre itself is a funky restoration of an old musical hall theatre crossed with loft style architecture, liberal amounts of steel and a decent bar.  Its an excellent venue, you will not be disappointed.

What a lovely day/evening it turned out to be. To start with I must thank all the staff from the car parking attendants to the Bar staff who all conducted themselves in the most friendly and professional way. All wore a smile and spoke with respect. Also, thank you so much for the free car parking which is great and very helpful to all who attend the venue. It’s a pleasant peaceful area with breathtaking views over London. The family and I very much look forward to visiting Alexandra Palace again. Once again... Thank you.

Lovely building, suitable for all sorts of events. Parking in the on site car park is available but I recommend you get there early as the car park fills up very quickly. There was even a shuttle bus from the car park up the hill to the entrance. Beautiful view across London too.
Excellent Spanish restaurant. Been twice now and loved it both times. Lovely staff, great food and not expensive...

Fantastic dishes. Always top quality and maximum flavour, nothing greasy, good quality ingredients and friendly service! Loved the alberino, ox cheeks and beetroot salad - full approval from the Ukrainian girlfriend, who is naturally an expert on beetroot... Apparently!
Absolutely delicious food and fast and friendly service.. Highly recommend specialty for the people who looking for fresh and healthy good. 😊
Very good food. My first time in a Spanish Restaurant and I found it with loads of option with a very nice presentation..Thanks La Fabrics
Food was wounderful and staff friendly. Atmosphere was relax.  Will come again.

Possibly one of the worst take away experiences. Five of us ordered so the delivery was quite heavy.  Everything leaked. We ordered  vegetarian and meat and so those that were strictly veggie found the meat sauces eaked and contaminated their orders. The soup containers were squashed and the contents swimming in the plastic carrier bags. The Currie order containers so dented and leaked there was no sauce. ( it was swimming with the soup ). The bottom line is that this establishment is not set up to support take away. We rescued what we could but of course our appetite was ruined and only two of us ate whilst the veggie contingent cooked themselves some pasta! The one star is for punctual delivery.
Really good, tasty Thai food served here. We love the curries and usually had that when we visited.

Great value and delicious food. Service was good except for a new waitress who didn't speak English too well and kept making mistakes with our order. I will be returning despite my criticism as the food was good.

I have been going to Os regularly for more than three years and have never had a bad meal. The staff are always friendly and the food excellent. You will struggle to find a better Thai restaurant in London.

I eat everywhere and pretty much anything. I read the Deliveroo gowing summary of this place and ordered a range of food. Every dish from the starters to the mains was a huge disappointment at best. The chicken in the noodles smelled so bad i gagged. The red curry was not. Just coconut milk and sickly. The penang curry awful. The satay was stale tough meat and burnt yet limp vegetables. I looked for something edible but had to stop as i had to run.literally.

The way they handle student complaints is absolutely preposterous. The staff is useless when it comes to teaching, the student adviser dan is a coward that kisses up to the doctors. The placement mentors/ radiographer are up tight arrogant pigs that bully vulnerable students who are too afraid to speak up. They get threatened with future unemployment when students question their way of working and call out the people in charge.  If I could I would shut this place down. These people
Are the reason our kids are getting depressed and hopeless.

Very unprofessional when it comes to hiring. Attended interview but haven't heard from them since then. I guess my application was unsuccessful. Just for you information, it is a common practice to notify your interviewees about the outcome, so they can carry on. It is even better if you can provide some brief feedback on the failure points to make it possible to improve in the future. All applicants contribute their own time to your hiring process and they would like to hear from you in return. I hope you will find this information useful.

World renowned hospital in the field of heart surgery, 
My partner had his heart surgery done back in 2005, and is still around, now it is my turn.
Nice staff big hospital good doctors
Wondeful renal and transplant staff

UPDATE: Visited again on a Sunday, their Almond Wellington was so good!
The music was even better than before.

Great music venue, good food and drinks

I've made several trips to this hidden gem. A vegan restaurant with no pretenses. Good food, well prepared and in a good amount at an agreeable price. I rarely give 5 stars, this one merits it. It's simple in its deco but big hearted and that is all you need. A rare find and I'm not even vegan leave alone a veggie.
What a great restaurant. Lovely food. Great Vibe. The owners are amazing hosts. Cant wait to tell all our friends about this place.

Nice vegan restaurant. We were there for a vegan meetup and the restaurant was big enough for everyone and there was music. Nice atmosphere. The food wasn't bad, but I couldn't enjoy it because it was too spicy for me, another people did enjoy it, and when the chef found out that was too spicy for me offered me to change the dish, so nice service.
The atmosphere is lovely. I had the falafel burger that I wasn't keen on but the portion sizes are huge. I'll try something else next time.
Great tasty and mouth watering food. Beautifully and delicately presented. Enjoyed the very fresh food.
Always a pleasure to be taken care of by Sarah and her colleagues. The food is consistently good and the sushi dishes are made by a team of Japanese sushi chefs.

One of our favourite places to eat. An amazingly large menu with great prices that leaves you dreaming of your next meal before you’ve even got this one. 

Worth a trip!
Great, fresh and authentic food and very friendly staff. Would recommend!

Great food! 

However the waiting time for food was a disaster. Waited 40 mins for a cup of tea and hot food was cold when served over 1 hour after ordering. 

We have been regular customers for the last 3 years but the last few months the dining experience were getting worse and worse. Waitresses and the kitchen were too busy for take aways and dine in experience was hugely compromised.
We love L'artista. I usually go there with my friends on weekend. It's a signature dish and we can say it : "Italian food is unbelievable." It's not very expensive. I love it and I recomand it!

Food is pretty good but really its the atmosphere that makes this place. Lively and bustling. Occationally the whole building shakes when a train goes over the top (its under a bridge) but I love that!

Very good food. We eat here quite often but you have to get used to the noise of the other diners. Very good value for money.
The pizzas are very very good and of a decent size. The service was great too. Will happily go back.

Lovely food. Very bad service. 
They forgot my food, told us we was liars and said we never reserved a table.
My 1st experience here was great but tonight ruined my night and I was out celebrating a new job! Safe to say I wont be coming back.

Friendly staff providing poor service. Very noisy but not surprising (nor avoidable) given their location directly beneath the tube line. Good sized portions of decidedly average food, garlic pizza bread was a very tasty (and garlicky) starter. Pasta dishes were tasty but nothing special. Zucchini Fritti side was good, broccoli side was overcooked and came sitting in water.

This place is supposedly known for their roast ducks but you pay fine dining type prices for what is basically a load of rice with a few pieces of duck to nibble on . If you're not oriental with a small build then you will most certainly leave this place hungry. 

The other issue is that you cannot pay by card on orders under £10 and on weekends its completely cash only regardless.  I need not say more about how ridiculous that is. Probably to avoid tax..

There are far more issues with this so called restaurant but most are evident by just taking a peek inside.

My family has been going here for 25 years and we love it. Absolutely no frills but delicious and incredibly consistent. This was our "second kitchen" growing up. Crispy chili beef, capital ribs, salt and pepper squid and the DUCK.

been once SO FAR! am due in the area again this week and will be there at  least once. i thought this was awesome. food fantastic. service quick and polite. when in north london will bend my choice of hotel to be as local as possible to this place!!!
Excellent restaurant.  Delicious food and very good service.

been going here for over 20 years and it is still the best chinese food I have ever had! They are always so welcoming and generous and the food is epic.
I want to eat this food forever

We loved it here and came as a family with two children aged 10 & 7. 
Plenty of parking, which is paid at the end of your stay.
There is definitely too much to see to be able to cram it all in within one day, we only got to see a quarter of the grounds and although we managed most of the house, it would have been impossible had we taken the time to read everything/listen in detail to our audio guides. 
We picked up our free audio guides when we arrived and were impressed that our first stop, which was the kitchens, had a children’s and adults option, depending on how condensed you wanted the info to be. However that’s were the child friendly bit ended! All other rooms had the same audio regardless of age. The kids became quite bored rather quickly, so we took the guides back and instead I read as much as I could in each part and retold it to the kids as best I could. 
I do feel that Hampton Court Palace could be more child friendly and interactive, possibly with ‘fun fact’ plaques and maybe a fun quiz for the kids to find answers to within each section.
We loved the chapel and were told many wonderful things about it by a lovely lady volunteer who had such a beautiful passion for the chapel and the Tudor period.
There are plenty of toilets around. There is a cafe but we had a birthday picnic in the car! 
Gift shops were great and not over priced - you can also order online if your pushed for time on the day so you don’t miss out - perfect.
Great family day out. Superb food at the cafe. Fantastic kids playground. Staff were brilliant and friendly. Fun Easter egg hunt too. Kids and us adults loved it.

Excellent palace with many interactive exhibits and activities for adults and kids alike. The audio guide is very informative. There are also informational signs and plaques in each room if you do not want to use the guide. The gardens are beautiful and great for a picnic on a nice day. Horse drawn carriage rides are also available in the garden for a small fee.

Incredible historical palace, the restoration and preservation is breathtaking. A massive amount to see inside and set in beautiful historic gardens, including a massive grapevine that is over 100 years old.  There's a nice cafe and several gift shops. The royal school of needle work is based here. This also has some incredible tapestries on display in the Great hall and one of the best preserved examples of an early form of indoor tennis court.
Also in the summer there's an amazing playground for kids setup in the old tilt yard. It has castles, a dragon sand and water (and it's own cafe) and the kids playground and be entered separately from the palace (at a small cost)

Such a beautiful experience. Went shortly before closing times and the gardens were practically empty, and bathed in sunlight. Was also lucky enough to spot a fox crossing a garden path! Sublime!! You can really feel the history when walking through this place.

Georgian house set in a park by the river Thames in Twickenham. Had a guided tour on a Saturday morning very knowledgeable guide. Lovely wallpaper in a lot of rooms including Chinese paper in one of the rooms. Cafe in the park lovely coffee and cake. Also do light lunches.
Love how clean and well kept at least an acre of green space. The historic site of the white marble hill house is kept clean.
Located in Marble Hill Park, one of the most beautiful parks in London situated between Twickenham and Richmond. The house and park is a perfect place for a picnic or biking.
Nice to look at but a shame you cannot go inside. Surronding grounds peaceful. Benches to sit down, dog walkers, joggers, walkers and passers by on a walk through the park areas.

This is the last example of a house in Palladian style left along this stretch of the Thames. The grounds are open all year but the  house is open from March to October.  The stnd out feature is the exceptionally comprehensive tour, which lasted over an hour. Where the very knowledgeable guide told us the history of each room, it's context (historical, artistic and cultural) in detail. This brought it alive and made the experience quite different from just a visit with an audio guide. I'd definitely recommend!

My favourite house to visit which has had some wonderful restoration. A mixture of styles and influences in the decor. Beautiful stained glass... stunning rooms. Also a cafe, gardens & gift shop. The guides in the house are very knowledgeable & friendly. I keep on returning to this stunning house full of history & a touch of the quirky about it.

What a spectacular place to visit!! the house is very beautiful and staff are very friendly and full of historical information about the house. The gardens  are well looked after and clean, currently there is a exhibition of historical artifacts which have been brought back to the house. Suitable for all 😀
Interesting place if you like Gothic style buildings.  Food in the cafe was good also.

Incredible stately home with so much history.  Every single room has a story to tell and the staff make it interesting, even for my 12 year old who normally hates this kind of thing. The Gothic style is quite different from the usual grandeur of National Trust type properties and we found ourselves spending proper time looking around and asking questions. Takes around 1.5 to 2 hours to go around properly and parking is free. Entry price is reasonable, especially considering it's privately owned. Highly recommended.

Strawberry Hill House currently has an excellent exhibition of over 150 items once owned by Walpole. It helps bring the house to life and shows off its architectural quirkiness. There is a cafe on site which is welcome on cool autumn days. The house is a 5 minute walk from Strawberry Hill train station, an easy journey from Waterloo.

Excellent choice of food and drink without silly -length queues. Stands are clean and view is good. The standard of rugby on the day was less than exemplary but it was good to see Gloucester in flying form!
Always great coming here with the family. Drinks are fairly priced and there is always a great place to find some food. Seats could give more space but still standard seating for a rugby game!

Having been to the stoop several times, I’ve seen the development and growth over the years. The staff/stewards are always friendly and there to assist you if you need it, and the multiple food stations give good options when you need a light bite. Make sure you take your card though, as they now only accept card payments to reduce queue size.

Drinks come in reusable plastic cups with Harlequins print. Cups can be brought back for return of deposit, or good enough to be taken home. The deposit scheme has the effect of  encouraging enterprising fans to collect discarded cups to keep the stadium tidy.
The game atmosphere was a bit quiet on my visit but an early red card could have been a contributing factor.

Always such a palaver getting through the security then ticket scan, so many people pouring in through insufficient entrances. Then the chaos of getting through the crowds as there is no order, just shove your way across the tidal wave of people. Loos always rammed with people going in via both the entrances and exits. Bars much better now but prices for food and drink are high, captive market! Finally sit in seats designed for thin people, not ex players etc wearing thick coats. Seats too close together.

I went to Kew today to visit the orchid display but I forgot what a wonderful place Kew is to visit. I found that the new greenhouse was spectacular. The overall care and attention is 1st class. Staff were extremely friendly and polite at the entrance. We parked which was not too expensive at £7-00 a day. My only complaint is that the restaurant serves the most appalling self-service coffee. The cakes were lovely. I would suggest people bring food with you as you could really have a lovely picnic in the warm weather. if you really like coffee avoid the self-service one but a great overall day. 
I could see they are in the process of building a play area for children which looks amazing. 
Well worth the money and time. I am definitely going back soon with a flask.

This is a great way to spend a day in London. The gardens are lovely. We booked online so entry was slightly cheaper & straightforward. We also booked the land train which we found very useful as it gave an overview of the whole gardens - which are extensive - and then we used it to hop on/off as required. It was helpful to have the main features pointed out by the train driver. Facilities are excellent.The treetop walk, while not extensive, was worthwhile. I would have enjoyed booking in for one of the events but that would require more planning than we did.

What a beautiful place! Lived in London for more than 5 years and never thought I'd find place like this! 
Completely family friendly with different activities and tours. Also a new kids playing area coming up.
All the plants are breathtaking and just amazing. I was walking around in complete euphoria. Fresh air and the smell of spring. 
Great place for photography, date, day out or just something relaxing to do on Sunday. 
All the views are worth every penny paid for entrance. On the way out I bough such a nice and original souvenirs just to remember I visited this place. I wish will have a chance to come back here again.

This is a beautiful park, I suggest visiting here if you're a fan of long walks and looking at nature's beauty.  

The overall walk around the park will take you two hours, but this excludes visiting certain landmarks within the park you may want to explore. I've added pictures to a tropical grow which is extraordinary.

Always love Kew - any time - any season - go there. Recommend becoming a member as it works out much cheaper for families of 3/4 who go often. If you are fortunate enough to live in London for a year or more I recommend visiting each season - winter for the lights, spring for the magnolia, summer for concerts and autumn for the amazing colours... and all other times for the brilliant events going on and the nature. a very special place... bring a picnic.

Repository for UK historical documents, photos, maps. Lovely place just to drop in with library, cafe etc. Study the rules for obtaining and handling documents first. You should also understand how searching the catalogue works. There are Research Guides online for most areas of study. Marvelous resource if you have prepared first.

A national treasure- not what you would expect. Modernised, digital & historic, professional staff and service- drop-in welcome. Great coffee and surprisingly wine! Book shop and great exhibitions. Just attended Dame Stella Rimmington evening lecture, ex head MI5- riveting, one-off my heroines. Check it out.

An extremely interesting place to visit. Really very helpful, pleasant staff. I have just requested a non-naturalisation letter regarding my deceased relative and this has promptly been mailed to me. A wonderful service. Thank you so much for all your help!
Very helpful staff, the cafeteria there has amazing breakfast and Lunch Buffets.
TNA has adminstrative records dating back a thousand years.

Still as good as it has always been. Prices a bit higher now bit still very good value. Where else can you get a convivial, northern-Italian experience with excellent food, as much as you can eat and great wine and a warm welcome?

They do their thing and they dont cater to others, but they do it very well. Reminds me of a real Italian welcome. Always happy to go back.

Good food and friendly staff. It was not crowded at Sunday evening at all. Needs reservation and they ask for 20£ pp deposit (by bank transfer) to secure it. Prepare for a lot of delicious food, must go hungry.

I’ve been taken to this restaurant as a birthday treat, I loved the food and such captivating service.
It was more than just a meal, it was a unique experience.
I especially loved the fact I didn’t have to order or choose anything. You eat what you get given!! Every dish was a surprise.
Highly recommended!!
Love this restaurant. Sit back choose the colour of your wine and enjoy the chefs selection,  6 or 7 courses of lovely food. Great for groups or couples lovely food need to go back soon.
Good. Not cheap but good. Second time here. Let me add, great staff!

Traditional French restaurant In Richmond which has views overlooking the Thames. Amazing value set menu £13.75 for 2 courses. Had the escargot followed by the calves liver which unfortunately was overlooked but the Maitre D was very understanding and returned with some re cooked liver. The staff are very friendly and helpful.
A proper restaurant, not a pretend one like all the chains - nothing but fast food joints with table service. Great service and food.
Perfect, authentic French cuisine with enthusiastic and entertaining waiters, great wines and a lovely atmosphere. The gratin dauphinois are superb!

Very good food with friendly staff.

They should really cut the tree down outside to give a view of the river
Amazing service, with a great menu! Will definitely be going back soon!
What a lovely restaurant.  We hadn't booked and was lucky they had a spare table. Loved the crispy duck!
Good tasty authentic Chinese food with a few Pan-Asian dishes. Friendly and welcoming staff and nice decor. We will definitely be going back.

It’s not only the best Chinese restaurant in Richmond. More than that, it’s one of the best restaurants in Richmond, full stop. Huge menu, great flavours - and if you’re ever unsure, just ask for a recommendation from Eddie, the faultlessly polite manager, and he’ll set you on the right track. 

I’d recommend any of the sizzling dishes - particularly the garlic king prawns or the beef in black bean sauce. The duck is also a winner, either in the pancakes or in the cabbage leaves.

Excellent night out for a special occasion. Not on for a weekly visit but a very very good for occasional visit. Excellent food, fresh and of very good quality. Waitor was very knowledgeable and made good recommendation for our taste. They were very accommodating to all our needs as we had a 8 week old baby with us. This restaurant  will become our regular outing. Thoroughly recommend it to any wanting a good evening out.

We live a good 80 minutes drive from the restaurant so only get to visit a few times a year. Wish we lived closer as the service and the food us always excellent and we are always greeting like long lost friends.

Amazing food, surroundings and staff. It’s a cost place quite spacious including the outside seating area for when it’s summer time. Food quality is great! Price is reasonable. Will definitely go again.

Beautiful Sunday roast with unlimited Yorkshire!
My first-time in London/Richmond this is perfect for anyone just visiting or I presume locals.
Wonderful staff, pleasant atmosphere (well planned, not noisy), delicious desserts and perfect location.

Up there with the best steaks I've ever had the pleasure of tasting. Our waiter Lawrence was very helpful and knowledgeable on the selection of cuts on offer and showed us first hand the size and cuts before we placed our order.

Also, upon arrival we were given the option of having a drink at the bar which we agreed upon, after a gentlemen took our coats. After a bottle wine, we took to our table for a delicious meal.

Thank you for making us feel welcome and for providing a five star service.
We love Gaucho.  Had a mother's day deal that made it even better. Service and food at Gaucho usual Hugh standard!

Went there last week to have a lunch with friends and it turned in a very good experience. Nice venue, good service and staff and great food. The waiter who served us was Jose really nice guy and very professional. I had the rib eye as a meal that I highly recommend. We'll come back very soon for sure!
The food were serve fast. very tasty. staff were very friendly. lunch menu was affordable. definitely come again. picture was of ladna noodle.

Really impressed with this place. Unpretentious and affordable, which is unusual in Richmond, the food was authentic and delicious. On top of that the staff were incredibly welcoming and attentive without being annoying. I'll be back.

Really disappointed. Arrived about 8.30pm on a Thursday and despite the restaurant being relatively empty we felt rushed and not wanted. Starters arrived within minutes of ordering (pre-cooked, not fresh).
Plates were cleared before we had finished our starters! Mains of green chicken curry and massaman were pretty tasteless and weak. 
Won’t be going again unfortunately.
Time for Thai the other end of Richmond much better.
Excellent food in a pleasant casual dining room and fairly priced.
Lovely staff, food was great and they took care of us til the last minute. Would return with pleasure.

I absolutely adore this place, it is one if my great delights in life to pop into Richmond Park, have a stroll and spend time with friends.

I have brought so many people here, from young and old, fabulous place to have lunch, snack or a glass of wine.

I so much enjoy sitting outside to enjoy the spectacular view.  Somehow l don't think l will ever tire of it, and will continue to bring people here. The delights on offer is always of a high standard, the chefs know what their doing.  Staff are at hand and welcoming.

Even though it gets busy during certain times, l have always managed to get a table.

Pembroke Lodge is a fine old building in Richmond Park which sells food, primarily lunch, and afternoon tea. I found the food mediocre, average. That was a tuna & onion sandwich and smoked salmon on rye bread. I suspect from my knowledge of eateries that Pembroke Lodge is not as well managed as it could/should be. Their afternoon teas are good though, the quality of the scones, clotted cream and jam.

I WORKED AT THIS PLACE PEMBROKE LODGE  FOR 6 MONTHS COOKED FOR THE CAFE AND HELPED OUT LATER WITH THE SERVICE. I HOPE ALL THESE RICH PEOPLE  WHO GET MARRIED THERE KNOW THAT THERE WAS BULLYING AND ILLEGAL WORKING CONDITIONS WITHIN PEMBROKE LODGE I NEVER GOT A  BREAK WHILE I WAS THERE I LOST WEIGHT WAS  STARVING ALL DAY AND DID NOT GET THE STAFF LUNCH THEY PROMISED ME AT MY INTERVIEW,  I WORKED 18 HOURS A DAY FROM 6AM TIL MIDNIGHT AND I ONLY GOT 1 DAY OFF IN A FORTNIGHT THEY WERE BREAKING THE EMPLOYMENT LAWS. I DEVELOPED DEPPRESSION BECAUSE OF THE STRESS .  I WAS CONSTANTLY PUT DOWN BY MANAGERS AND BULLIED BY THE KITCHEN STAFF, THEY ALSO HAVE EMPLOYED PEOPLE COMING OUT OF JAIL AND THE COOK'S HAD NO COOKING TRAINING WHEN THEY ARRIVED THERE.

Lovely establishment...it was pretty busy between 3-4 pm but there was still some seating available. The cake was wonderful and the seating area was very nice too. Lovely scenic views outside the windows. Staff could have been friendlier but overall it was a great place to spend the afternoon. Will definitely visit again!
Beautiful views and gardens. At the Caffè fresh and hot pastries and cakes. The scones are the best! The food is good too and there is always a place to sit and relax.

Amazing, really like this place. We have been looking for a good fish restaurant for some time and finally found this place. We went for a celebration, it's a little on the pricey side but it was well worth it. The food was delicious and the wine selection very good. Would highly recommend this place for date night to anyone.

Really nice location on the river. We didn't get a table by a window and were infact directly behind a wall. Food was all in all very nice. A bit underwhelming to be honest. Mussels were very nice, incredibly garlicky which I enjoyed. Crab linguine was nothing special. Rhubarb Crumble was lovely. Service was quick and subtle. However it was also quite condescending. Overall not as good as I hope but a pleasant location and meal.

Went here for lunch and the restaurant is great. Really nice location. Try and get a table over looking the river if possible . The food was exceptional. Especially the passion fruit pavlova. Brilliant service by all the staff especially Jean Francois. Really highly recommended.

Very pleasant venue, with attentive but not intrusive staff. Good menu choice without being too expansive. All guests enjoyed their meals, with hot fruit de mers starter getting great revue. Mains very good though turbot described as 'unexciting' especially for price. Sirloin went down well as did other fish dishes of lemon and Dover sole. Deserts enjoyable. Can't comment on wines, though one small glass seemed pricey. Go again? Definitely esp if can sit as we did with view of river beside us.
We just went for a family mean with my 16 month old. The staff were wonderful and attentive, and looked after us really well. The good was excellent.

Love to have breakfast here. My favourite is egg royal :) they also have great smoothie.  I put 4 stars , because I feel that place gets sometimes a little dirty and tables are to close to each other. Sometimes hard to get up if it's busy.

Seems to have gone down hill. I have been eating here for over 10 years 8-12 times a year. The seating arrangement is tight at best. While the food is good it does seem on the pricey side. I would say they could justify that cost if their service was something to shout about but it’s not. It is inconsistent. Sometimes the food is late and sometimes items are missing. So why has it gone down? It has been three visits now and there is no greeting when placing an order. No thank you having placed an order. No warm welcome and it seems quite off putting. There was a time when one particular lady would have the biggest smile and make you feel at home even if she was rushed off her feet. I think I have had enough now after the cold reception.
Great cafe, one of the best around. Always enjoy the grub here. Good ramp access for prams and wheelchairs.
Amazing pricey but very good quality food
We had the Falafel burger. Absolutely delicious, with sweet potato fries! 😋
This is a lovely little coffee shop with friendly staff and a good selection of food. Very happy this is nearby!

Friendly and attentive service and one of the best breakfasts in Richmond town.  For something lighter they have a great choice for brunch, my favourite being scrambled egg on toast with/without smoked salmon ☺ Panini good too.

Very small but has great food and lovely coffee without the Richmond prices - eat in or takeaway.

Under new management since 2014, so I have resumed my patronage.

Excellent place to wait for the bus on a cold winters day.  That little blue bus icon on Google Maps tells you when the next one is due, or use TfL's website - just Google "tfl live bus" to find it.

This caff has free Wi-Fi (just ask for the password) and a lovely latte and fresh croissants, cakes and bread.
A small independent caffeteria, nice staff, friendly, very good service, I had an excellent cappuccino.

Lovely independent cafe. Four of us all had the Full English Breakfast. We all agreed it was one of the best we’d ever had and at a very reasonable price. The owners were very friendly and accommodating, putting tables together for us. (The only downside being that it’s very small). Would definitely go back.

Very good small local cafe for eat in or take away. Run by a lovely couple who make you feel very welcome and at home.  Nice sellection of open sandwich/ baguettes/raps. Fresh bread and cakes. Great full English breakfast and other hot food. Coffee's are wonderful.

Frequent flyer here, give this spot a try and you won't regret it. Lots of food
The lunch specials are phenomenal and the service is short and sweet. Call in for carryout, or dine in you will be well taken care of
Best of meat and heat! My beef and string beans were fantastic. If you're looking for quality Thai food, I would recommend this eatery.
I have no idea how to pronounce what I ate, but dear lord was it good. Super friendly staff, also. Definitely going back.
Very tasty food! I love it "Thai hot" - very very hot without ruining the flavors of food. Soups are delicious.

Great pick up service,  in and out in minutes.   Staff was helpful and friendly.   Blue crab sushi had a little too much rice but otherwise balanced taste.  The padd see ewe was spicy as desired, just lacking an amount of chicken with the dish.  Would recommend this place.
I was here last week and food was delicious.  The staff were so friendly. Lovely pleasant place.

A truly tremendous experience, everything was perfectly flavoured. I love a good curry and this was exceptional. The service was excellent. Seems like they know what they're doing. See guys again soon.
Lovely restaurant, we always enjoy an evening here. Great service, friendly staff & a nice setting. A great place to dine in Brentford. Prices good too!

Well well well, where do I start? The boys? They're the safest man in town. The food? My G, I'm not even lying when I say it's the pengest food in the whole galaxy. Get yourself down to Albany or die without visiting the 8th wonder of the world.
5 star all round!! Absolutely bangs! Best Indian in London...FACT!

This has got to be one of the best theatre show I have ever been to. The place is really classical and very clean. My fiance took me out to this theater to see Aladdin musical for my birthday. The staff are super friendly and very helpful. The seats were really comfortable and the positioning was great, could see the stage very clear. I would recommend this theatre to all my friends and family to experience the magical feeling of this place.

Very nice old theatre decor. We were in the grand circle and the view was fine despite being almost at the very top. Our bar wasn't too busy - but we were seeing Aladdin, so perhaps it's because there were lots of children. The show was fantastic. The queue for the toilets was huge, but the intermission was long enough to accommodate it. Drinks were about what you would expect at a London theatre- about £7 for a small glass of wine. Mostly friendly, helpful staff, but the odd one who was a bit of a jobsworth. I wouldn't hesitate to return here to see something else.

Aladdin - 22.03.19. The show was spectacular! Great songs (old and new) along with some good twists to the story to adapt for  the stage production keeps things fresh and fun (even for massive fans of the original film!)
The genie obviously stole the show! 
Highly recommended for a fun night, catch it before it goes. 🧞‍♂️🐫

Wow! The seats were extremely comfortable and had a lot of leg room - the staff were really friendly - and the bar was genuinely reasonably priced for a theatre in London. We went to watch Alladin - absolutely brilliant. Worth the visit to watch - the stage effects were insane. Well worth a visit.

I visited this lovely Restaurant on Sat 7 Sept with my wife and 4 of our Grand children.Wow the food was absolutely delicious and there was plenty of it. The service was fast and efficient.The staff were friendly and polite and made us very welcome. nothing was too much trouble. It's not the first time we've visited and we will certainly will keep coming back.Forget all the others this is the plaice if you want real fish and chips that taste how they should.I cannot speak highly enough of this Restaurant.So next time you're in London , head for The Dining Plaice. 2 MORE THINGS .The price of the food is really good and they make a lovely cup of tea.
Best Fish and Chip shop in Soho! Don't be fooled into visiting flashier options, this place is fantastic! Huge pieces of fish served for less than £5 which taste incredible. 5 stars easy!

I know two stars looks harsh but it was below average and for me 3 stars is average. The chips were great, the fish looked a good size but when it was cut into was all batter folded to made it look like a large cod. It was also dry and oily.

I have been eating here for 35 years but after my latest visit I will sadly, not be returning. "Large cod and chips" consisted of a small portion of anaemic chips and a small piece of very tired, watery fish in rock hard batter. Prices also seem a lot steeper and the restaurant which, in the past was always packed was half empty, and unsurprisingly so if standards have fallen so badly here. A great shame for what was always one of my regular favourite London chippies.

Great place to go after shopping around Oxford street etc. The service and food was really good. It doesn't look like much from the outside as the interior design is really simple but the quality of food definitely makes up for it.

Used the app to order dinner for 3. 
Speedy service and food was great.
My 5 year old daughter ordered the ice cream with fruit salad and it was a huge portion.
Table was sticky / dirty but it was very busy.

Formerly a cinema, built by Monty Pyke. Two tiny entrances unfold into huge theatre of bars, tables and revellers. A drinkers pub but hugely popular with the soho crowd. Satisfying venue regardless of what type of pub you like. A great and cheap place to start the night, before you explore Soho
Cheap drinks get what you pay for. Too busy at night wouldn't bother eating here food is awful. Gets packed very quickly.

I strongly recommend for food. It is very convenient to order from the app, in less then 5 minutes you will have your drinks with you. Great place to goo for drinks and food from Sunday to Thursday, plus the food and the drinks are significant cheap comparing to other restaurants, Friday and Saturday is far too busy, so I would not recomendo in both of theses days.
Very busy pub in very popular location. Plenty of bar staff so service very quick.good sized  pub too.recommended
Amazing food! Great service! Small in terms of space, though nicely optimized. Been many times. Always good experience.

Don’t go for the Sushi or Sashimi 🍣❌ 
It’s the worst I’ve had in a while, not fresh at all and tastes very “fishy”. The rice was undercooked, unseasoned, and still warm. Definitely overpriced as well. I don’t understand the good reviews at all (bots?!)
The fried chicken and shrimp and side dishes weren’t too bad but I still wouldn’t recommend the restaurant. You can get tastier, cheaper Japanese food in the area.

My first time eating here (had dinner) and the food was really tasty. It can get really busy (queue of people waiting to be seated) as it is very popular and the food is reasonably priced. Would have given 5 stars but the venue is small and a little uncomfortable trying to eat whilst there are a queue of people waiting in the wings for you to finish and leave lol
Not too expensive but good quality Japanese.  Famous for their Fried teriyaki chicken. The spice one is a must.
one of my favorite to go spots. great food at very reasonable prices... but mainly GREAT food. try the bento or the don squares. you will not be sorry. you WILL however, be very full.

Great value for money, especially in central London. The food is excellent for the price. But I wish they didn't assume I was an alcoholic. While waiting for a friend I ordered two beers but was told I could only have one. They would only bring the second when my friend arrived. Just plain odd.

Torn seats and a bit scruffy, but clean. The food is reasonably tasty and the portions quite generous. Service has always been emotionless but it was never a problem as they were attentive and not unfriendly. Recently however it has become colder. They make strange demands and comments (as above and noted in other reviews), and have become quite pushy: asking repeatedly for your order with barely 30 seconds between pauses, trying to clear plates and bottles when you haven't finished eating or drinking, offering the bill and effectively ushering you out. 

It's a shame because it had always been a relaxed place to get a nice, fast and affordable meal.

Edit: 3.5 stars

Absolutely disgusting restaurant! Ordered £35 worth of food and only received half of the order. Number on the company page does not even work so we are stuck eating Rice, Pepsi and very smelly prawns for dinner. 

Hate this place

We have been dining in this place for 3 years now, very tasty food, generous portions, but the attitude of staff can’t be tolerated anymore. Besides the fact they always rush you to order, and say “sit” pointing their finger on the table they want us to sit at, they don’t recognize their loyal clients at all. 

Today for the first time we didn’t want to order mains to start with, instead we asked for 2 drinks and one soup saying we will order in a bit. In 2 minutes waitress came back to us, saying minimum order is 5 pounds per person, otherwise your order can’t be placed. We were shocked, after all these years that’s how we were spoken to, therefore we just left. 

Please train your staff, even though it looks like a family business, encourage them to learn some basic manners and English. It affects the whole perspective on your restaurant, even though the food is good, it’s not healthy to eat in such a negative and frustrating atmosphere. 

Thank you.

I had a bowl of Laksa mee, and a Coca-Cola in the restaurant. The service is good. The atmosphere is pleasant. And the staff are knowledgeable. Will return to Tuk Tuk again. After my Laksa, I met up with some of my colleagues in the Admiral Duncan pub, for a quick drink. That is Soho. I like the area. It is so compact and. It is easy to walk around. Sadly, Tuk Tuk was badly affected by the recession in Soho, and is closed permanently. Thank you.

I have been coming here with my partner regularly over the last few years. We always enjoyed it and would have highly recommended it for good food reasonably priced  However on our last few visits we have noticed a decline in the quality of the food. Finally on Thursday we ordered the set menu. The food was cold, dry and overcooked. The spring rolls were full of grease and frankly, disgusting. The duck, which we waited a long time for, managed to be dry and greasey at the same time and was completely tasteless. We didn't even wait for the final courses and took them home as takeaway.
Perhaps they have changed the chef (they certainly haven't changed the oil in a while)  or maybe they have just got complacent  but either way, we won't be back anytime soon.

If you like Thai food. This is the place for you. The staff is very friendly and very attentive. The food is delicious and you can choose your heat . The menu is wide with choices of appetizers and lots of dinner choices. We like the chicken dumplings as an appetizer. They gave a great and reasonable lunch menu as well.

We have been here several times. They have a lunch menu which is less than $10.00. I ordered the peanut sauce over chicken. It comes with a choice of soup or salad. The soup was a flavorful chicken and vegetable soup. You also receive a spring roll which has a good flavor. Service is fast and friendly. Plenty of people working which helps if you have a time limit at lunch.
Amazing food for a great price. Love the chicken sauté and Tiger Cry when ordering. Little to no wait when dining in and pick up times are quick. Service is always polite and professional.

I recently just tried this place for the first time and the food was amazing!! The service is very friendly and welcoming and the atmosphere is great. I would totally recommend this for a lunch or dinner stop
This place has amazing food. I tried the pineapple Curry and boyfriend had the yellow curry both were delicious! I would highly recommend this place!
Best Italian in London - hands down. Services is warm and very enjoyable and the food is always hearty, tasty and comforting. Book now! You will not be disappointed.
Love this little place! Lovely homemade food and a delicious selection of Italian wine. Was a great spot for dinner with my friends 😊

I love it this place
The staff is so nice, quick and take care about customers 
I will come back again.
I have ordered twice, both times the topping had fallen off both into the box. Very disappointing...
Pizza was crispy, toppings were incredibly flavoursome. The ravioli was absolutely incredible and fresh. To top it off the service was fantastic. I couldn't recommend this place enough!
Essen in Ordnung. 2 Hauptgänge ca 20£. Auftung des Gedecks gehobener als das Essen.

Très bon resto italien.
De plus, servi par Romane qui après un accueil en anglais et entendu notre accent helvético-anglais à poursuivi dans un français parfait. Normal, elle est française.
Merci Romane

We like this place. The staff are so helpful and do their best to offer alternatives although I should say the menu is very good. The vegetation dishes are tasty (not the usual boring options). Whilst Balans remain a reliable chain, the location makes this one a little better. We've never had to wait too long but if you want a table for more than two, best book ahead. Glad to say, never feel the need to rush here so it makes for a good first date choice😉

1. Warning there is some very graphic sexual artwork on the walls - not suitable for kids or conservative adults.
2. Food is good quality
3. Service was prompt
4. Servers very polite
5. Not too pricey, reasonable vfm
6. Reasonable portion size: was very full at the end

Found this place, given the place we intended was very busy. We're not disappointed. We had the full English and the smoked salmon & scrambled eggs - both were delicious. Staff attentive, vibe relaxed, clean. Would totally recommend

A great place to escape the hustle and bustle of Soho, or actually be part of it, depending on what time you go. Great music, fantastic drinks and very friendly staff. 
Healthy food options for all tastes and dietary requirements. Stay close to the front of you want to be seen, or find a secluded place in the back for a more intimate feel. It’s a great place for a date.

One of the best restaurant in Soho area. We grabbed dinner before going to the movies. The staff is welcoming and warm and the service is great. We had 8 of their small dishes and everything was amazing from the arancini to the seared scallops or the chicken sliders or the ravioli. The taste was so authentic in each item. Definitely recommend this place!

The food was superb. The service was kind and helpful. The restaurant is ½ block from the Piccadilly Theatre (The Curious Incident of the Dog in the Night-Time). They are open until 11pm. We had an excellent meal after the play. I would go back. It was not expensive. We just ordered a lot!

The indian restaurant, tempted by range of authentic & imaginative fusion 
dishes. 
They are specialist in tandoori dishes.The food cooked is with the good quality & aroma of fresh ingredients. Really ignites the taste buds. The portions are small but tasty.
Vegetarian dishes are excellent there. they re made from fresh products. i enjoyed eating samosas and a palak paneer which was not made with cream. prices are a bit expensive.

We found this Indian restaurant in Piccadilly London by just pure chance. What a gem. This was the best Indian food I have ever eaten. Fantastic food and the service was excellent also. Good welcoming staff. Thank you for the bailey’s and brandy 👍👍👍. Diarmuid Begley

Not sure if others got a cheap deal for their glowing reviews but I personally was very unimpressed. Popodums and pickles fine to start but after that I was not liking it at all sorry. Yes I should have complained to staff but didn't want to ruin a night out to the theatre by causing a scene.  I swear my lamb Tikka was actually cheap stewing steak it didn't taste right texture and left much even though I was hungry. Chicken Korma consumed by my daughter seemed to be made from a few frozen type meaty lumps in a very bland sauce  : am I expecting too much to see fresh chicken breast provided? Anyway,  I am going to avoid the place in the future ..local Indian Restaurant is much much better.
So much cheese! Was amazing. Had two different cheese fondues between the four of us and the chocolate fondue to finish. Incredibly full but just so damn tasty.

Amazing service. Very attentive, and quality food.

Recommend booking first. Traditional Swiss restaurant

Amazing restaurant! I just had a fantastic fondue with my boyfriend on Valentine’s Day, not only was the food fantastic but I got a free box of chocolates and a rose to celebrate v day! Definitely book in advance to avoid disappointment
Was a diff experience but thought over £20 per person for cheese bread and potatoes was a little OTT....but cheese was lovely  would I go again prob not ....
Nice, authentic swiss French cuisine. The beef slices, snail and half and half fondue were all great

Great food and great service, definitely coming back to try all the other things on the menu. Unfortunately did not have room for dessert this time. Great ambiance and lovely place, just a shame that they no longer open on Sundays. Beef was perfect, snails equally so and salad and bread really fresh. Great service from all the staff. Sweets at the end was a very nice touch.

Absolutely amazing. Has the tardis effect. Small looking smart restaurant. 
Once you step inside, another world. Beautiful restaurant. A large staircase with interesting pieces of Art on the walls. 
A private Diner and one floor is a Bar. A Green and Red room with comfy chairs as you climb the stairs. On the top floor is a good size area with sofas and a Bar where you can hold Events. Stunning building x
Nice, traditional French restaurant in the heart of Soho. Prices reasonable (can't argue with Chateaubriand & bubbles for two for£45!) and friendly service. Will definitely revisit.
Food executed well, excellent service, great atmosphere but most of all.. the cocktails were divine. Reasonably priced menu.i highly recommend.

Superb multi floor bar / restaurant. If you’ve consumed a few too many poisonous waters, you can get lost in the interesting maze within. 

Staff are strict but efficient, private dining rooms are very spacious.

A gem.

Food was nice but at this price point there are way better options. Especially on the finer points of presentation and attention to menu item details. £100 meal. Like a London taxi feels like the meter is running.
** edited. Wow. Seems the online Attitude after a review is a real bonus for diners...

Nice Italian restaurant. Good food and atmosphere. Make sure you book in advance as the place is quite small. 
Loved the old Italian chef who came out of his kitchen with two small plates containing a taste of his new recipe for some vegetable stuffed pasta for us to try. Delicious!

It's a Soho classic. Unpretentious, down to earth amusing staff, constantly changing menu and small but good selection of wines. It's not the cheapest but the food is always excellent. If you're looking for a great Italian meal with fresh ingredients and great taste I'd definitely recommend.
