The Park charges a fee of £120 for the privilege, and your photographer has to have public liability insurance of £5m. We were then told we wouldn't be allowed to drive the wedding car into the cemetery, and that we'd have to carry all of our equipment in on foot. My bride explained that if it rained on the day her dress could potentially get ruined, but the Park Manager explained in a surly and sarcastic way that all of the paths in the cemetery are very clean. We were also informed by the office clerk that ‘we don’t permit any vehicles to come into any of our parks for Wedding photography.’ We ideally wanted to have shots taken with the wedding car and conceded we’d be happy to pay a bit more to be granted an exception to drive a 1970s Asquith Taxi at 5mph into the cemetery and park by The Pavilion for a few classic shots. The Park Manager said he would consider our request, but of course we never heard from him again. Breath-taking arrogance and a complete disdain for the local community, not to mention a complete lack of any commercial sense. Needless to say, the sun shone on the day and it would have been perfect for us to have those photos as memories of a very special day, but we had no licence due to the unnecessary bitterness and bureaucracy of a small group of people who manage a public space as if it was their own back garden.

Visiting the Cemetery is like going back in time for this part of London. The staff on hand are very welcoming and helpful if you’re looking for someone, the list is long for interesting people buried here, from all walks of life. Including my Grandad. Nice to see so many people using it on my visit, from walking and looking at the headstones, to making a shortcut to Chelsea football club.
R R R R.  U U U.  BBB. I I I.  S S S.  H H H
Best food in town

I want to go to this College when I get older, and I've done a lot of research about this College and I've seen a lot of good reviews, I think when I get older this is going to be one of my favorite experience's in my life. This personally, I've been looking for this for a long time!
The place to transform your ideas to reality. The best art college in the world. Every art student dream to do their postgrad here. Great experience once you are here.

Outstanding and go to as many of their exhibitions and talks as I can.
Great to see the new emerging artists

Possibly one of my favourite art galleries in London. The Saatchi Gallery is located close to Sloane Square station, in one of the most refined areas of London. The gallery is quite small but offers great pieces of art and unusual exhibitions. Emergent artists are frequently exhibiting their work there. I would recommend it when around the area!

I absolutely loved it. The whole exhibition from the lower ground floor to the second floor was remarkable. I really enjoyed the arctic photojournalist images, and also the anti-plastic bags piece of work. The grandeur of them all was excellent, as each piece was about triple the size of me. It feels very new, and the works of art are all 2019, so for a free gallery it is worth visiting to see the newest modern art!

One of the best galleries in London for lovers of contemporary art. The exhibitions are constantly evolving and changing meaning you are always in for a unique experience every-time you visit.  It is also big enough to keep you stimulated but small enough to not overwhelm you. I recommend this gallery to every one who visits London

I’m a London local, and this is my fave gallery by far. I’m not a huge art person, but I do like contemporary and I also like no more than 1 hour. So this place has the perfect mix of both. PLUS it’s free AND has an amazing gift shop.

Excellent art installation. Loved the 'we live in an Ocean of air, that was a weird but a wonderful experience. 
And the kaleidoscope was brilliant, even thou I enjoyed being part of the art, I enjoyed it more watching others, you get more of the feel of it.
... nice spot for people and dog watching, boats for hire, benches to sit in, toilet facilities reasonably clean, nice place if you are into swans and ducks.
In the summer a beautiful place to relax and go boating. Well worth the walk through the park to chill by the river and see the ducks go by.
Perfect London Park! Wonderful for picnics in summer & cycling in winter. One can still escape in the long grasses & not be seen. Love a swim in the serpentine.

Beautiful water in the heart of the City.
Terrific boating. Whether walking around 
the lake or just relaxing by the edge, this 
is one fantastic place. Popular restaurant 
commands one end. While a beautiful
Italian Garden, the other. Easy access.

Beautiful place, clean, safe and fresh air in the middle of the city, lots to see and do here
For kids it's a must do place.

Whole Foods always has good customer service the employees are always willing to answer any questions you have. Yesterday I was at the one at Carlisle I could actually make a day of it. They have so much to choose from and their deli are definitely to die for. The only one thing is I wish the prices were a little lower. The bakery is also very good. 👍👍👍🤔and the thought full sign is hoping they will drop their prices a bit.

Stopped here while traveling to visit family. Bought from the salad bar and the best organic cherry tomatoes for my son. Very nice store and was busy. Surprised by the mention of Amazon prime memberships at the register when paying them

The quality of food here is plummeting. I have found dirt in my ground beef twice now: two weeks in a row. Recently we found plastic in the clam chowder. Its not really what I would expect from Whole foods. I would like to continue shopping here but I am a little worried.

I only come here for the unhealthy food or when I really want some good meat or cheese. I don't give a hoot about the healthy organic all natural buzzword food. Personally, it's overrated, overpriced, and not worth it. But that bakery? I will eat all 1000 calories of that tiny little cake. No regrets. 
Good selection of cheese, great place for fresh meat and local coffee. 

Also, there seems to be bar soap everywhere. Really.. it seemed every 2-3 aisles there was a display for some sort of soap. So much so that I'm beginning to think that this Whole Foods location is trying to tell us we smell bad. Well jokes on you Whole Foods! I showered at least twice since I last visited 3 months ago! 

Generally very friendly staff though! Even if they think we smell bad..
Can I get a smile from anyone in this place? Healthy living what about been good to one another.  $ changes people.  #compassion #bekind #smile

Not sure why there are so many bad reviews! We popped in last night after the Science Museum. Yes, its more like Chinese food but it was freshly cooked and very yummy! Big portions and very reasonably priced for the location. Decor is dated but that is part of its charm.
Food was acceptable. Was pleased to see owner stand up to some weird guy creeping on two young ladies. Nice to know she cares for the people she services.
I love this place. Small and cosy with nice meals! the staff is helpful, smily and very friendly.

If you're looking for somewhere fancy then you've a lot of other local options but if you're looking for big portions of nice food (the teriyaki salmon bento in particular) for a good price then you can't go far wrong here.

Used to be a quite nice cheap Chinese comfort food very pleasant and tasty, often whole staff ordering from it, I came back 7 years later to find out they had the same deco and the manu was the same... I love one dish.. That's it! Shame for them...
Incredible Pizza combos and excellent staff. Good place for a beer too. I go every Tues.

Friendly service staff. Love their #2 pizza for the crispy thin crust, sausage, pepperoni. They could put a little more extra toppings when requested. Otherwise the beer selection is very good. Kid friendly atmosphere. Outdoor seating.
Very good pizza. I have gotten take out from here a couple of times and it's always been ready on time. Service was excellent.
Very family friendly! Took my 2 year old here and he loved it! Didn't feel like he was bothering anyone or making to much commotion for the space. Yummy pizza!

Great food and reasonably priced. Three of us ordered from GrubHub and had it delivered to the hotel. We got it warm and within an hour. The 3 pasta dishes were very good. Mine was the best. I got chicken Alfredo with prosciutto and Parmesan. The only complaint was the carry out boxes were cardboard and folded. Cardboard and liquid don’t go together so when the delivery arrived, all the sauce was in the bottom of the plastic bag and none was on the noodles. I think it may have been slightly tipped during the delivery. Either way they need different containers for carry out. Other than that, delicious!
A lot of pastries to select from - but the ones I got (tiramisu roll and apple pie) weren’t that great. The texture was dry and it tasted more sweet than flavourful.
Great French deli. Fresh sandwiches, good cheeses - try brillat savarin. Good coffee. Interesting selection , friendly.
The sandwiches are the best in South Kensington, don't let the mundane exterior fool you
Great selection of items!
Probably best sandwiches in London. Very nice French people.
Went for drinks. Fine. Good value champers. Attentive staff. Very busy. Busier than shop - surprised! Spend an hour here relaxing after shopping in a bar that Harrods cant offer.

One of my favourite department stores of the uk! Lots of choices and very helpful staff. However, the staff on the side of Iconic London did not offer to help at all, they definitely need some more training in areas such as customer service. But other then that, it’s worth a visit :)
Went here for the 1st time for a flower making class held by Bloom and Wild. Loved the whole experience !

Free flowing prosecco afternoon tea. I've done a lot of these at numerous venues around London and I wouldn't rush back to do this one. The first waitress who sat us down pretty much forgot about us for over 20 minutes. The afternoon was only saved by the waiter who took over from her, who gave the level of service and attention I would have expected.
We went for the Mary Poppins returns event. Well presented and efficient. No delay at all. Helpful staff
Amazing food, friendly staff and decent prices.
A small, cosy restaurant with a fancy, posh atmosphere and friendly staff. The food tastes delicious and it's not too spicy.
My husband introduced me to this restaurant.  Basic decor however great food if you know what to order.  Try the tandori chicken. So so good
Been going here since 1993.  Best tandori chicken in town.... staff always great.  It’s a must go for those who live and love Indian food.
The worst Indian food in london,absolutely tasteless ,beyond me how they manage to make it so tasteless
Lovely pub thats been in the area for years! Good atmosphere but a strange smell if you arrive before the crowd! The food is great though so well worth a visit in the evening for dinner!

Lovely service and staff. The decor is cheerful and the community spirit around this pub is obviously lovely. Their ale pumps seem a little broken - the bartender had to pump multiple times to fill my glass which left me with a cloudy, underfilled pint. However he was very apologetic! We enjoyed the free board games.

It's been my local for years, although it has recently changed management for the better! 🔥
The prices are great for Chelsea, the food is phenomenal and the service is unlike any other. 
They have an open fire in the winter which is unique in central London. Definitely worth a visit!
Awesome little pub. The food is delicious and goes very well with a good selection of beverages. Well worth a pub lunch or dinner visit!

Enjoyed lunch upstairs in function room earlier today. We were on a bit of a deadline as had a local (baptism) ceremony to go to by 2.30pm. Bit of a slow start which meant not enough time to enjoy canapes, followed by hot lunch on small cold plates which were exchanged for large cold plates. Service was ok but all ended in a rush despite restaurant being briefed in advance about timelines. Food good but soon got cold on cold plates!
It is really spacious and airy. You can find different kind of events during the whole week. The only common point of these events are that they are all high quality events that you can enjoy a lot.
Love the venue and the events they organise, not too  enamoured with their drinks prices. We paid about 50 liras for a bottle of Bomonti and a non-alcoholic ginger ale!
Nice place ! Not very willing stuff / very rude the guys who kept our coats !!! Especially towards tourists

Went for the golden oldies new year's party..it was lovely. Highly recommended..just wish they played more popular dance songs... especially around the count down ...some of the songs are popular..but not very exciting to dance to. Still..a good night! Happy 2018! 😃
Perfect place to enjoy a night with friends... You can choose having a dinner in any of its restaurants, a quick snack with local beer and a good alternative concert in Babylon...all in One

The best dining experience I have ever had. Went for the dinner tasting menu. The food was incredible, great produce fabulously executed. I  was also very pleased that my favourite wine was on their extensive wine list. The staff were fantastic. Impeccable service, i really can not fault anything.

The food was... fine. It was pretty to look at but nowhere near value for money. The atmosphere and decor were straight out of the 1980s- a weird silent restaurant with unnecessarily posh service (I think we had no fewer than 15 different people, all with different functions at our table through our meal, they were all great by the way). In the grand scale of upscale dining, you're definitely paying for the name here. I'm very glad the bill was footed by my company or I would have been pretty disappointed.

Best meal I’ve ever had!!!! If you don’t want to spend a crazy amount to eat here go for lunch. We went during lunch and still had the most incredible service! The food was the best part of course and the chef will send out surprises between your dishes which make the experience even better!! Highly recommend!!!

I can't even find the right words to describe my experience here. You know how often when you set an expectation for something it usually never lives up to it? well, Restaurant Gordon Ramsay did exactly the opposite. It was Incredible. Incredible in every way possible, from the moment you walk in you are treated like royalty. Even more, you are treated like a true guest as if it were someones house. The waiter/waitress' have an art of their own with the way they communicate with their guests which is impressive to watch on its own. And then there's the food which is nothing less than perfect. The flavours of each element work incredibly well together and look amazing as expected. I enjoyed the 'standard' lunch menu which consisted of a choice between two (2) dishes across three (3) courses. I am by no means a food critic or even all that knowledgable when it comes to food but I would highly recommend booking a table here if you ever get the chance, you really will not regret anything. I really hope I will have the chance to dine here again.

This meal was all you hope for. The service was impeccable and friendly. The food was sone of the best I have seen and eaten. The  restaurant is small so be sure to book when the day you want becomes available exactly 3 months before. My tip is go for lunch and have the set price 3 course special menu which is probably the best value eating experience in the world. When we were there the head Chef Matt was from Melbourne Australia and they gave us a tour of the Kitchen as well!

Very poorly managed establishment. Too many faults in service to list. The worst bit, no decent apology or even understanding of how bad they are. People work hard these days to earn their leisure time; they deserve so much more than this. Waiters are supposed to wait on customers, enhance the experience not the opposite! The kitchen do a half decent job but are undermined by front of house management.

Nice food but very milky coffee and lax service. Butter, salt and pepper didn’t arrive until after we’d finished eating, despite asking again and again. Coffee served in paper cups because apparently they’d run out of crockery. These were removed from the bill which was a nice gesture but overall it wasn’t a great experience. The staff were clearly struggling to meet the demands of a half full restaurant. A shame as I’d have liked to make it a regular brunch spot but I won’t be returning.

Unfortunately this is a restaurant which is badly let down by its waiting staff (or, perhaps, a restaurant whose waiting staff are badly let down by its management). The food is fine - nothing particularly special (and rather expensive - see below) - but the service is so bad as to make eating here a bit of an ordeal: there were constant delays for the simplest of requests (including for condiments, which we never received, despite asking the same waiter on four separate occasions, when we already had our food - and a 25 minute delay to be served a bottle of wine). Normally I think it is easy enough to overlook the odd misstep in service, but this was so persistent as to spoil the entire meal. 

I am aware that the above makes me sound like a 'difficult customer'. However (perhaps unsurprisingly) I don't think I am: I eat in restaurants often enough and genuinely believe that the service we received was well below the standard that one might reasonably expect from this sort of restaurant. We paid £150 for three (and it would have been more save that - for the first time ever - I asked for the service charge to be taken off the bill). This was for a shared starter, three mains, a couple of cocktails, and a bottle of wine from the cheaper end of the list. For that money we could have had the set lunch and a bottle of wine at the nearby Elystan Street - where the cooking is absolutely top-notch, the service fantastic and which, I suspect, would have left us feeling a good deal happier. 

So, my advice, in a nutshell, is *avoid* (notwithstanding the other five star reviews).  

Rhys
Great Burger. They have great food supplier so they make very tasty plates. Service used to be more attentive. Great for Brunch. Book especially during weekend.

Well worth a visit. Charming bistro nextdoor atmosphere, lively but not too loud. Starters were spectacular - ricotta and pasta were tasty, fresh and made with care, the best I have had in a long while. Mains were disappointing - relatively few vegetarian options. Unfortunately my main was not at all what I expected and I sent it back. They apologised, took the feedback and didn't charge me. Waiters at times could have been more attentive but were always friendly. Gets quite busy so don't forget to book in advance.

Very poorly managed establishment. Too many faults in service to list. The worst bit, no decent apology or even understanding of how bad they are. People work hard these days to earn their leisure time; they deserve so much more than this. Waiters are supposed to wait on customers, enhance the experience not the opposite! The kitchen do a half decent job but are undermined by front of house management.

Rhys
Great Burger. They have great food supplier so they make very tasty plates. Service used to be more attentive. Great for Brunch. Book especially during weekend.

Well worth a visit. Charming bistro nextdoor atmosphere, lively but not too loud. Starters were spectacular - ricotta and pasta were tasty, fresh and made with care, the best I have had in a long while. Mains were disappointing - relatively few vegetarian options. Unfortunately my main was not at all what I expected and I sent it back. They apologised, took the feedback and didn't charge me. Waiters at times could have been more attentive but were always friendly. Gets quite busy so don't forget to book in advance.

Great place to bring your dog for a medium length walk. Never had to park here but when friends have they've never had a problem. Can't wait for the new Brown and Greens cafe to open up in the summer!

Crystal Palace is a great place to visit for a refreshing botanical walk. Always verdant and fresh atmosphere with the remnants of the historic Crystal Palace make the space more unique. It is a great place to bring your family for an outdoor holiday. It will be a good place to relax with your children to provide them a very vast playground. People visit the park to walk their dogs.
Unfortunately the park is not really maintained to its real glory.

A huge park with a few gems in it: a cute animal farm, dinosaur sculptures around a lake and a big sandpit with dinosaur bones and sculpt buried in sand. My boys always play palaeontologists there :) 

Also, they are about to open a newly built cafe close to playground. Can’t wait!
It is a wonderful experience for little ones to see the dinosaur park! They loved it and they were so excited! We will definitely come back. They playground is also very very nice!

One of my favorite park,next to crystal palace train station. Dinosaur statue in park one of the good attractions for kids. A big lake and boating also available. Leisure center in middle of the park for gym and swimming or other sports. Enough car parking.
Loved this park. Beautiful and full of trails and sub-trails to explore. And a few random ruins and street arts just to be different!
Very attractive wood to walk around close to central London. Pleasant in winter when there are fewer dog walkers.
Free range forest. Just beautiful and inspiring
Amazing pocket of woods that abuts more wooded areas. Nice day out

Nice wooded area to take the dog for an explore. I would suggest going early or later in the day at weekends as it seems to be busy with family's and screaming kids at the weekends in good weather. If you fancy a tranquil stroll in the woods, this is not it.

My second visit to this small museum to take a friend. It's a very small museum for the price but it's well worth it if you're interested in Brunel or engineering etc. You get to visit and learn about the first ever tunnel under a river. There is a small display, a video on his life and I formation on some of his other projects. We were luck enough to be there as a walking tour of the area concluded in the shaft and we were allowed to tag along for the explanation of Brunel's endeavour from a charming local guide inside the shaft. The lady that worked the museum was excellent: friendly, knowledgeable and full of passion which is great to see. It's a little off the beaten track but an important structure that has helped develop London and tunneling technology worldwide!

If you travel on the London underground then this will give you an understanding of what was required to tunnel under the Thames. Friendly and helpful staff. Worth going to Wapping station to see the tunnels.

Viewing a much restored engine-room and drum shaft, a small garden and some historical 'titbits' represent thin gruel and slim pickings for the admission price.
'The Brunel Synopsis' would be a more appropriate. 
Also stage special events here. 
(I have not attended) 
Atmospheric with friendly staff and adequate cafe. Pleasant but certainly not memorable except for that riven tree near the entrance.

I've never been here, but I've done research as a subway buff.  The subway tunnel under the Thames right near here was the first underwater tunnel that Brunel built.  Amazing to think they did it in the 1800s and the tunnel still exists!  Fascinating!

Visited for the Midnight Apothecary events. Really tasty cocktails. Great experience and the rooftop is adorable. The guided tour was very interesting and the guide was amazing. Only issue is that the place is quite small and hence gets quite crowded, and food quickly run out (and don't accept card) hence minus one point. I really recommend

Nice little gallery with some Dutch masters. I can confirm what others said about the staff: they are considering themselves a bit too important, rushing through and you better make way. Their security guard should maybe be uniformed - the attire should go with the venue. The ticket price for the permanent exhibition is £8 without the donation. £15 is a bit too much for the special exhibition. It is understood they are a private charity, and maybe they need to charge this much, but then the staff at least needs some proper training. Rather cut staff numbers (seven seems a high number to be present at the same time for a small gallery).

Dulwich Picture Gallery has a great collection and puts on some wonderful temporary exhibitions. However, I remember the days when the staff and volunteers were friendly and welcoming, which is no longer the case

Dulwich Picture Gallery has a great collection and puts on some wonderful temporary exhibitions. However, I remember the days when the staff and volunteers were friendly and welcoming, which is no longer the case. The invigilators in the temporary exhibition galleries have very little consideration for visitors (and I've experienced insolence from them) and heaven help you if you step over the lines on the floor in the main galleries, wanting to take a close look at the brushstrokes in paintings that are glazed and, therefore, unlikely to be harmed by you getting close to them. Oh no, step over the line for a close look and you are pounced upon and told quite firmly to keep behind the line. Thank goodness there are other galleries where it isn't a strict requirement to keep so far from the paintings that you can't examine the artist's mark making.

Significant collection of British and European old masters. Possibly too many for the space, there are some wonderful exhibits. Rembrandt, Gainsborough, Lely, Canaletto, Poussin, Rubens, Murillo, the list goes on. Also a brilliant Sohlberg exhibition at the moment (Q2 2019). Good facilities, very pleasing shop and café. Opposite the park and 10 mins walk from the railway station.
It’s lovely but very small , £9 ticket a little too much ,  way to much .

Didn’t even have a chance to taste food. We were already upset because of the staff approach. I have never been to this restaurant so I had no clue that it is divided into the pub and restaurant part. All the people around us were eating so we just sit down. None of the staff knows the thing called greeting obviously. It wasn’t busy at all and all the staff decided to ignore us. After 10 minutes we asked if there is a service or anything and they finally talked and explained that we are in the bar section. How on earth did we suppose to know that? From restaurant awarded from Time Out absolutely not acceptable. Never again, sorry guy the food may be nice but the the the approach of your staff is unacceptable.
Great food and friendly service. Wood fired pizza oven and steaks cooked to order. What more could you ask?
Good food, great staff. Just excellent.
Great place. Haven't been for a while, even better food and atmosphere now.
Without any doubt they serve the best food in our area!Food which is filled with passion for cooking.

Good value and tasty curry house with huge menu. Offering both take-away and eating in, this small restaurant (maybe 20 covers) offers good Indian and Bangladeshi food while allowing bring your own bottle. Service has always been quick and polite. There is a £0.70 charge for paying by card. Generally recommended for a no-nonsense curry.

Excellent food for good price!!
I live in New Cross gate and this is definitely my favourite restaurant for take away.
The staff is also very nice!!
Love this place. Order take out very regularly. Quality is good and delivery is fast. Best Indian in the area.

The food is amazing. I have not and will not ever eat Indian food anywhere since i first ate there 5 years ago. The service is fantastic and the portions are large for the great  prices. (Huge prawns.! Love them) Go you wont be sorry...
A wonderfully BYOB Indian restaurant and takeaway. The staff are very friendly, the food is great, and the small, intimate setting is an experience! Prices are the best around, too!

Chilled pub, great to watch a sports game or just have a relaxed bite to eat while chatting. They have a nice bar area and smoking area. And you are bound to have a good time there. The staff there are really fun and have such wonderful personalities.

Good day Royal Oak what a plate of good food as always even with  load shedding 
Love and Blessings 
SANDRA Seebregts (Mr Loubser)
A long-standing and pretty convincing approximation of a traditional English pub. Food wasn't bad. Local crowd, many of them ex-pats. Friendly owners.
Cheapish and cheerful for a quick pub lunch. Good food
Very good food. Cosy pub
First ever spin class! Instructor was brilliant and really engaging. Really enjoyed the experience and will definitely be returning.
Great spot even to just work and grab a matcha / coffee!
Went to Sunday Service today and Hilary rocked!!! Lived in Manhattan for three years and fell in love with Soul Cycle.  I may have just found my fix for that in London Town! Amazing

First ever spin class.  Overall the class was really good.  Instructor was excellent.  However lots of negative points.  Class was overcrowded and people were left without enough space to perform the weights exercises and stretches without touching adjacent people.  Spin class area was also extremely hot with under par ventilation.
Which left everyone feeling excessively warm.  We were the met with freezing cold showers as there was no hot water.  

To summarise excellent instructor holding a session in a mediocre environment.
Great sweaty fun class, theme rides are absolutely the best.

Amazing baguettes made to order using a wide variety of fillings for a very low price. Their produce is clearly well sourced and authentic. Perfect for lunch. They also offer pastries, drinks and cupboard fillers. Staff are always friendly and welcoming.
Love this little place full of French delicious goods! The made to order baguettes are amazing and cheap!
Best Baguettes in Fulham. Made fresh in front of your eyes.
Best little true French bakery I've ever been to!!!!!!
Brilliant service with an amazing array of french cuisine.

This Sallys always looks a mess with boxes and stock all over the floor so it's hard to walk around. The women that work here are miserable and when you ask if they have something in stock they look annoyed by your presence...
Great customer service

Sally is ok but staff not so great.

When you arrive the shop floor is cluttered with boxes to unpack, or there is nobody around the front to greet you.

The shop floor is small along with the isle.

When needing assistance with products, to ask the staff to help you seem to be a problem or a big task to get the help.

I could understand if it was isolated experience but this a constant trait in this store.

Customer service is a must and needs to implement in these store.

If they were work in the industry, i.e in the spa or reception they would of been pulled up on their customers skills lack of it.

It's such a shame it's a locally store and yet it's all over the place with it's a layout and staff.

Sometimes the stock you want is not here nor online, sold out, which forces you to shop at other beauty supply store.

Overall sally is ok.

In this store,its a no for me.

I may vist another branch for another try.
The staff are always super friendly & helpful, offering is good for a small store.

The girls in here always help me! The bad reviews on here must be from people who have no trade card as that may be why the products are overpriced as this shop is normally for trade only. The staff in here have great knowledge of the industry and products and are always happy to help when I go in.

Not particularly cheap but outstandingly good Indian food. Tasty, authentic and original dishes served with aplomb. Excellent service and pleasant quirky surroundings. Much bigger than it looks from the street and genuinely atmospheric in the back. Plus (!) five draft Belgian beers. Does it get any better than this?
I had my birthday celebration here and it was  incredible.  The food was really delicious and plentiful.  Staff were attentive and friendly. I  Highly recommend .
Food was nice however portions were small. Staff were disinterested and we felt like we were an inconvenience for being there.

Overall we had a lovely meal. The curries we had were both delicious, although portions were a bit small and I expected a little more heat.  mango chutney and naans were average and I remember these being really good in the past. Service was friendly and attentive.
Excellent food and friendly service. They also had a great wine list. It’s got a really nice, modern feel, and such a wonderful variety of authentic dishes. Will be back!

Great food with very cost ambience. Staff is very welcoming and are always there to help you. Parking near the restaurant can be little difficult at times since it is on the busy king street but again it depends on what time you are going there. I would highly recommend their curries. Food is of great quality and is very cheap.

First ever visit last Saturday night.  Very friendly staff and very efficient. Superb food and must admit the  butter chicken was 10 out of 10.  My 13 son scoffed every morsel.. ..so we shall return for more very soon
Great tasty food. Lovely atmosphere. Really appreciate the no alcohol policy. Friendly and helpful staff. Love this place.

What a fantastic find! We were staying nearby and went here for dinner with our family and so glad we did! The staff were really friendly and the food was delicious. It is a BYOB so be prepared if you want alcohol!
V. VIP Hotel and very impressive staff . Highly appreciate to shoaib ... Very well done guys
One of the best experiences with Spanish tapas. Inexpensive. Friendly service. Try Sunday lunch menu!
Nice restaurant in a cute neighborhood. We enjoyed the Paella! Quite pricy if you choose to eat Tapas.

Good food but tiny portions. The service is horrible! The waitress was foul, miserable and made us feel like we had interrupted her day. She also messed up our order and tried to make us pay for food we hadn't ordered. I would highly recommend not eating at this place, too much choice in the area, plenty of places that won't make you feel so unwelcome.

The waitress had way too much attitude and was super rude. Took our order down wrong and became cranky over her own mistake. Had to wait AGES for our meal to come. Think we'd know what we had ordered if we are allergic to certain things!! The food was average when it did finally make it to our table. Much much better Spanish places in Brixton. Would help not to be rude to your customers and if you are rude feed them such extraordinary food that they wouldn't be able to complain.

Great menu, really outstanding food and wine (especially for the value), the service is pretty casual and friendly and the decor is nice but it almost feels like you are in someones living room. Really brilliant for a relaxed meal.

I’ve been to this restaurant countless times & I’ve never come away from it less than totally satisfied that I’ve had a great meal. Staff are very polite, food tastes wonderful - all in all a lovely evening out.
Very good!  Had a mix of several authentic Indian dishes, vegetarian, lamb, beef and chicken. The staff were very helpful and service was great.
KERALAN PARATHA is the sh*t! Amazing veggie options & very polite staff. I shall definitely be back. Probably tomorrow....

It’s the best Indian food I’ve had in London 
Service was great too

Clean with good service. Portions small & they are not in any danger of being found guilty for under-charging. My parents enjoyed the food a lot (step-mum from Bangalore) personally my food could have been a lot better, shame it didn't resemble any food I've had during any of my 10 or so visits to South India. Not planning a return visit although my parents might.

I have to say I went to Café Rouge for a work Christmas meal, thought the choice was a little odd as I've only ever had coffee from here before, and I was very surprised with how good the food was. I would definitely recommend and go back here, the staff that served us were friendly, and drink orders were sorted very quickly. The only negative was when it came to paying the system seemed to be slow, but I suppose that's fine with splitting a bill 30 ways 😬

Lovely restaurant in a unique settings, synonymous to a French café. Great range of food including vegan, child friendly and gluten free. Staff are amazing and will go out of their way to help. All meals in group were delicious.

Great service from the team at Cheshire oaks. A special thank you to Heather and the team for making our triplets 1st birthday xtra special. Afternoon Tea was superb and Ice cream was a nice surprise for the babies 👶👶👶
Always one of my favourite eateries and there's plenty to choose from depending on your appetite. Yesterday I just had the camembert starter with fries, delightful and just enough.

What a lovely buzzing place! Went for lunch it was really busy but the service was great. We were served by Heather, who was attentive and looked after us perfectly. The food was delicious also so couldn't ask for anything more. BRILLIANT!

I always have a great dining experience here. The food is tasty and given Southfields is a pretty rich area the food and drink is very reasonable. I think in the day the place doesn't look inviting at all due to quite a dark interior and smallish windows, but it is nice when you are inside, especially in the evenings. The staff are always nice too.
The food is nice, we were not happy with the service. Waiting for 1 hour for the mains to arrive. Overpriced for what it is.
Never had a bad meal here. Good food and good portion sizes. Will be back!
Lovely place. Nice atmosfere.  Good food
Incredible food at very reasonable rates. Very friendly service.

The restaurant is in a lovely location - it's nice and clean with a beautiful view. 
Apart from that there is nothing else nice I can say about the restaurant. 
When ordering our food the staff member was not bothered and we felt like she was rushing us (note - the restaurant was empty at this time). 
My partner asked questions about various different dishes, the staff member was no help at all.
I was contemplating asking someone else to serve us but I didn't want them to do anything to the food. 
I ordered myself a seafood dish with noodles / I was shocked to receive a big plate of noodles with only 4 pieces of prawn and two scallops.
The food had minimal flavour and left me upset and confused that a franchise like this would produce such bad quality food and service.

I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone. I know a few people have given it 5 stars and I am bamboozled by this decision.
Excellent Thai cuisine and attentive, though not obtrusive staff. Views of the river to die for. Not inexpensive but worth the extra cost.

We all had starters, main course meals, rice, noodles and dessert. We only drank water but even still the bill was will priced. The food tasted good and I can see that in dinner the views would be great on to the river.
Loved the views food was nice ,not much atmosphere but staff where friendly
High quality and fantasic ambiance....love this restaurant and highly recommended....3rd visit a d more to come

5 stars always,

Ealing's Town Hall is a distinctive late- Victorian gothic building on Ealing Broadway, which is still being used for its original purposes.
Nice building! Old and pretty!
Nice place
We got married here. Nice venue, great staff the registrars Jasmin & John were fantastic!
I had been to Ealing Townhall to attend one of the Indian Festivals "The Durga Puja"🙏 London Sharad Ustsav committee members organises this festival every year in London.

Very beautiful and a place to relax where you can find a sweet peace. Neat and clean area. Amazing natural beauty. It a big shops where you can buy so many things include plants, flowers, garden furniture, show pieces, chocolates, beautiful vases etc. There is a big car park area as well. Famous Syon Park House, fishing lake and Hilton Hotel are there as well. A perfect place to spend time family and friends.

Set is very beautiful and extensive grounds. A top quality garden centre selling g all manner of plants, trees, vegetables and trees. Staff sometimes a little hard to find and vegetables ( my interest) has many gaps. What they do have is good quality. A separate cafe which is good and fish centre is excellent with knowledgeable staff

Beautiful house & gardens... I'm happy to pay to go into the gardens as they are so well kept and beautiful. The stunning conservatory with amazing architecture & flowers including a Waterlily pond. You can access some of the grounds for free. Also has a garden centre, great cafe with outside seating and inside. My niece's love looking at all the fish in the aquatic shop. They sell great gifts too! Always beautiful at Christmas! Free parking & the Enchanted Woodland is worth a visit!

What a beautiful place! Epic garden centre packed to meet every agricultural need. Staff are chilled and friendly.  There is a great buffet style restaurant with good, reasonably priced food.  Ample free parking!  It's surrounded by a huge park, most of which is private land, but you can still have a long stroll. Close the river side if you fancy a more adventurous walk.
I come here everyday for jogging. It's a beautiful place, green. . With fresh air.
Surprisingly interesting museum. Covers the history of the house integrated into the local area. Business, community and local activities. A free council initiative that really works. Great.
Want to know a lot more interesting stuff about Ealing and Acton and West London in general? This is the place; very nicely done local museum in a lovely park. Don't miss the kitchens!

Completely renovated by Lottery Heritage Fund.
Great museum, full of very interesting and enjoyable displays.
Well worth a visit.

A great museum of Ealing history and is free of charge.  Museum is built in a mansion of a rich family.  It is sensational to see the grand decoration and thoughtful design of the house.  Personally I enjoy the fashion gallery on 2nd floor.  There are videos and message boards for children to share their thoughts after watching the exhibition of the floor.  There is a playground for children to play and a nice cafe to catch up with friends for a breakfast.
free entry. not many furniture as you can find in National trust houses/castles, but definitely a nice place to visit.

What an absolute delight. The staff were friendly, the exhibit was fascinating, the tour was great. Also enjoyed a visit to their cafe and shop. The Tour Guide called two boys in the group a 'young lady' - perhaps he should watch out not to generalize gender due to looks. Overall it was very happy with the visit and will come again.

Would very much recommend as had a very informative and relaxing hour - arrived 1 hour before close - and was able to listen to the last section of the tour. Fascinating information and brought the instruments to life. I need to return and see the rest of the tour.

This place is not just some exhibition. It’s alive! Go with the guide and all the amazing instruments will come alive! In concert hall they also perform crazy instruments. It’s definitely somewhere to for a fun weekend afternoon!
An interesting and unusual collection of mechanical instruments. Well worth a visit. Do get the tour , as the guides are knowledgeable and entertaining.

A wonderful museum full of sounds & sights to delight. Travel back through music history with one of the very knowledgeable & friendly tour guides. Hear & see the Mighty Wurlitzer! The cafe has delicious cakes ;0) & they have a great gift shop. Also special events during the year.

It's beautiful walking along here especially in the summer. Lots of very interesting boats and the locks are great to watch. Swans are often roaming in here also which is always nice to sit and watch. It feels like it's a hidden gem. There are some good AirBnBs around in the flats in this area which are good to stay at if you want to explore this place for a while.
It is a pleasure  to live here. A friendly community in beautiful surroundings and a gorgeous, spacious flat.
The end of the grand union canal. Nice places to eat nearby and great walk or runs along the canal
Nice place
Good Place

This has got to be one of the best theatre show I have ever been to. The place is really classical and very clean. My fiance took me out to this theater to see Aladdin musical for my birthday. The staff are super friendly and very helpful. The seats were really comfortable and the positioning was great, could see the stage very clear. I would recommend this theatre to all my friends and family to experience the magical feeling of this place.

Very nice old theatre decor. We were in the grand circle and the view was fine despite being almost at the very top. Our bar wasn't too busy - but we were seeing Aladdin, so perhaps it's because there were lots of children. The show was fantastic. The queue for the toilets was huge, but the intermission was long enough to accommodate it. Drinks were about what you would expect at a London theatre- about £7 for a small glass of wine. Mostly friendly, helpful staff, but the odd one who was a bit of a jobsworth. I wouldn't hesitate to return here to see something else.

Aladdin - 22.03.19. The show was spectacular! Great songs (old and new) along with some good twists to the story to adapt for  the stage production keeps things fresh and fun (even for massive fans of the original film!)
The genie obviously stole the show! 
Highly recommended for a fun night, catch it before it goes. 🧞‍♂️🐫

Wow! The seats were extremely comfortable and had a lot of leg room - the staff were really friendly - and the bar was genuinely reasonably priced for a theatre in London. We went to watch Alladin - absolutely brilliant. Worth the visit to watch - the stage effects were insane. Well worth a visit.

Great food, attentive staff and very sensible prices.
Update 2018-09-30: now closed down.
Love this place! Sushi is very good, service is always excellent and have been to this restaurant many times. Never had a bad experience here.

I got so excited when I found out about this place - going there the food was average, weird rules for all you can eat, staff not very friendly. Then I found out this place actually had a ZERO FOOD HYGIENE RATING...... I believe they might have improved that since to a 3, but still doesn’t make you feel very reassured...... Honestly just go to Hare & Tortoise if you’re in the area - it’s not all you can eat but I promise you it’s good cheap sushi with proper food hygiene (no, they didn’t pay me to say this nor I have any links to the place, just lived in the area for about 5 years and this has been my experience)

Pretty awful service by an extremely grumpy waitress. Probably deliberate so that she would not need to serve anyone but still get a salary. Feel sorry for the proprietors since the low quality of staff would easily run the place into the ground. Usually such bad service would need to be accompanied by good prices and exceptional food for a restaurant to survive. The former is certainly not the case and the latter seems hugely unlikely since the menu seemed to be of the rip-off-ignorant-white-people variety.  We left after trying to order, so there's a small chance that I'm mistaken on the quality of food: it might be mediocre!

Had a good time here, the food is reasonably priced and tasty and the place feels fairly 'authentic'. For example there are sunken tables where you sit at floor level- but with your legs dangling below. There are also normal tables if you don't fancy that.

What appeared to be the owner/manager was pretty rude but it was in a sort of entertaining way so they don't lose any points for that.

It's much cheaper than other Japanese restaurants I've been to (such as the big chains) and that's a big bonus.

My whole family had breakfast here this morning,  we were all served with professionalism and friendly staff,  the breakfasts were all great, coffees were v smooth.
Thank you to all the staff. Tony D
please do not order the crab tart ;) it's bad... Steak as good as always!
Never a disappointment. Staff are extremely friendly, plus they cater for all.

Would say 70% a better reflection than 3 or 4 stars (60% or 80%). On Saturday evening it was busy, lively and noisy, nevertheless the staff coped well. Prices for food are reasonable  . . .  for London and, mostly, reasonable value for money. It is also possible to find a few good values on the generally pricey wine list. There is a set menu (Tuesday  to Thursday, I think) which looks to be particularly good value for money.
Most of the party of 9 had steak which was highly praised by all who eat it. The fish cake w/ poached egg was reported as delicious  . . .  BUT far too small for a main course ;  the chicken and leek pie with garlic mash was poor  . . .  the chicken and leek content was thin on leeks (replaced by unnecessary carrots) AND overcooked and therefore too dry and so salty that most flavours were disguised and the mash was a cop out  . . .  rather ordinary, NOT creamy mash, lacking pepper and with 3 cloves of (roasted ?) garlic on top. The chef needs to re-think that dish! Some additional description on menu required  . . .  the crab mayonnaise contained flavour disguising amount of chilli and was served on toast  . . .  neither of which was advertised on the menu!
Good! Could be better!

Lovely place with wonderful waiting staff...all friendly and attentive. Would highly recommend the brunch menu. The eggs Benedict and truffle parmesan chips are divine! Disappointed with the dessert. Over priced lemon tart...small slice, tasted slightly stale. Overall worth a visit if you are in the area.

Had a fantastic night on Friday and ended up here again on Saturday.  The food was fantastic and the coctails superb.  The staff go beyond their duties to make you feel welcomed.  I'll definitely come back.

Amazing food and amazing service. We were served by Asif who was polite and funny and made the meal such a pleasant experience. The manager Abdul then offered us a free dessert afterwards to top off a perfect evening. Will definitely be coming back and would implore anyone looking for a brilliant night to come here. 100%. Brilliant!
Had a fantastic evening at La Trompette. Went for the taster menu and it didn't disappoint. All courses were really good, but the scallop really stood out. Excellent.
Interesting lunch menu with a great wine selection. Only visited at lunch but will definitely be returning for the dinner menu.

The fanciest restaurant in Chiswick. They have some delicious dishes and terrific desserts. However, the portions could be more generous. I will probably come back one day to try the £110 tasting menu.

Very popular place must visit 
5 Star experience in Buckingham Palace. We booked the Buckingham Palace tour months ago so we could see it over the Holiday break. They only offer this tour for a few weeks in the summer and winter when the Royal family is out of town. All I can say was it was worth every penny. The tour feels very exclusive. You enter through the side of the palace, check your coat, and meet up with your tour guides. 3 guides take ~20 people through the palace explaining the rooms, the history, and the artifacts / art within. It was breathtaking and probably the best thing we did while in London. The tour was ~2 hours and at the end they offered us all Champagne and 20% off in the gift store. Its not a cheap tour at ~90 pounds but I felt we got our money worth and saw something few people get to see. Also in the end they walk you out in groups of 6 out the front door of the palace in front of everyone outside the palace gates. A nice touch to end a magnificent experience.

It's a bit crowded even in winter but nonetheless a great experience seeing the change of guard! The snow makes it feel epic. I recommend arriving at least 20min before it begins to secure a good spot.

Visiting London and not visiting Buckingham Palace would be really unfair. This is a 300+ years old Heritage Palace where the Queen of England currently stays and this is the headquarter of Her Majesty. This is  also in the city of Westminster and hence if you visit the city of Westminster, you can see Buckingham Palace, Big Ben and Parliament of UK all three tourist attractions. We were lucky enough to see the change of guard duty from outside, however, we did not have the registration to see the Buckingham palace from inside ( you need to do the registration earlier for this limited/restricted visit inside the palace).

A must stop on a tour of London! Ive been here a few times showing friends & family but this time we happened  upon the Changing of the Guards, it's one of those experiences that I believe is worth seeing. It's only a 20 min stroll along a very pretty park to Big Ben & London Eye. Using the London Underground is great to get around, but honestly, so much of London is within walking distance, one place just easily leads to another.

5 Star experience in Buckingham Palace.  We booked the Buckingham Palace tour months ago so we could see it over the Holiday break.  They only offer this tour for a few weeks in the summer and winter when the Royal family is out of town.  All I can say was it was worth every penny.

The tour feels very exclusive.  You enter through the side of the palace, check your coat, and meet up with your tour guides.  3 guides take ~20 people through the palace explaining the rooms, the history, and the artifacts / art within.  It was breathtaking and probably the best thing we did while in London.  The tour was ~2 hours and at the end they offered us all Champagne and 20% off in the gift store.

Its not a cheap tour at ~90 pounds but I felt we got our money worth and saw something few people get to see.  Also in the end they walk you out in groups of 6 out the front door of the palace in front of everyone outside the palace gates.  A nice touch to end a magnificent experience. :)

A lovely experience at one of London’s most famous landmarks. It is currently under going maintenance though. It is a classic London sight, easily accessible by multiple means of public transport, or by foot when walking around. It’s a great, classic monument. Very glad they are looking after it so well and to it being around for a long time to come. I Love this place so much, its a MUST go location.

Great, famous Big Ben. When will you be cleared for visitors?  With the scaffolding of work around the view becomes more interesting at night, when the monument is illuminated and the work appears less.  Either way, it makes up the look of the city, a view that is very beautiful from the top of the London Eye.

The House of Parliament and Elizabeth Tower, commonly called Big Ben, are among London's most iconic landmarks and must-see London attractions. Technically, Big Ben is the name given to the massive bell inside the clock tower, which weighs more than 13 tons (13,760 kg).  The clock tower looks spectacular at night when the four clock faces are illuminated.

Big Ben is among one of those landmark that comes immediately in mind when you think of London. But unfortunately when I went there it completely covered and can't see anything as it renovation work is going on. This is located at superb location at Bank of river Thames and have easy access by the Tube and bus route as well. This is One of must visit places if you are going London for first time. :)

The Big Ben is glorious, one of the most famous landmarks globally. Its truly a beauty when the sun is setting. The architectural detail is phenomenal. London is a must visit primarily for this single attraction.

Won't take you long to see all the tower has to offer, but an interesting historical place nonetheless. You can get two for one entry if you pick up a days out by train leaflet and bring it with you. James behind the till was super knowledgeable and friendly and certainly a reason why he stayed longer. They also have a cafe serving hot drinks, so not a bad place to pop in and grab something away from the tourist madness outside!

One of London's hidden gems!
13th - 14th century moated Tower opposite Westminster Palace and next-door to Westminster Abbey it can be easily missed if you don't know its there. Two or three floors of medieval history with winding stone staircase, Saxon sword, some replica ancient manuscripts and archaeological finds from the moat. And a nice miniature model of Westminster in the 14th century. Takes about 30minutes to walk round. Abingdon Street is a Gardens is in front of it. 
Staff are approachable, friendly, enthusiastic and informative.
Well worth a visit.

I loved this place. It is very small, but that is what reveals how things were when the tower was built. The pencil sketch in the guide book is so revealing about how dominant the church was and why the monasteries were dissolved. A very interesting historical visit.

I loved this stop. It was great. So much history. When looking for attractions around London this wasn't listed every like the other places right next to it. The man at the register was great. He has so much knowledge for history. He was part of the reason this was such a wonderful stop for me.
The best place u should visit.

Very popular place must visit

5 Star experience in Buckingham Palace.  We booked the Buckingham Palace tour months ago so we could see it over the Holiday break.  They only offer this tour for a few weeks in the summer and winter when the Royal family is out of town.  All I can say was it was worth every penny.

The tour feels very exclusive.  You enter through the side of the palace, check your coat, and meet up with your tour guides.  3 guides take ~20 people through the palace explaining the rooms, the history, and the artifacts / art within.  It was breathtaking and probably the best thing we did while in London.  The tour was ~2 hours and at the end they offered us all Champagne and 20% off in the gift store.

Its not a cheap tour at ~90 pounds but I felt we got our money worth and saw something few people get to see.  Also in the end they walk you out in groups of 6 out the front door of the palace in front of everyone outside the palace gates.  A nice touch to end a magnificent experience. :)

One of the best parts of the Abbey is that you arent allowed to take photos inside. This allowed me to enjoy the entire experience without having others taking photos everywhere. The Abbey itself is huge and takes a few hours to get through. We also paid for entrance to the Queen's Diamond Jubilee Galleries and thought it was worth it. It was quieter in the Galleries which we appreciated. I think it might have been better to schedule it later in the day as the Abbey itself filled up more as we spent time in the Galleries so by the time we got to explore the Abbey, it was a lot more crowded. The Abbey itself is gorgeous and has amazing exhibits. There is a free audio tour that teaches you a lot of background knowledge and additional information. I also went for a Sunday service and the people manning the doors were super friendly. We showed up a little later than the service started and were still permitted entrance. The Abbey is a place of worship and the difference between a Sunday and a tourist day is huge. As a Christian, I enjoyed attending this service and thought it was beautiful.

Loved it. We paid extra for a tour with a Verger which took 1.5 hours and was £5 on top of the entry fee, it was well worth it. Steeped in history. You can easily spend 3+ hours in there.  All staff I came in contact with were helpful and knowledgeable.

A 'must see' for tourists to London. It is quite pricey, currently £21 (April 2019), but on balance it is worth it. A visit to the Queen's Diamond Jubilee Galleries is extra. 

The queues to purchase tickets were short (today) but, once inside, it was crowded. 

Audio headsets are available for self-guided tours that last about an hour and are very informative. The staff are very helpful and seem to know the answer to most questions.

The most beautiful abbey in the whole world! Truly amazing building that is beyond words. It is not only a place of worship, but a place where the Royal Family holds special events like weddings and funerals, whilst distinguished dignitaries are interned here as well. 

Photography is not allowed in this building though, so it’s best for you to admire this wonderful piece of architecture and history using your own eyes and imagine how this place was built in the old days. Truly amazing!

Well recommended!

What to say... another jewel to visit in London. So much history in one place. We took 2 hours to visit the Abbey and we enjoyed every minutes. Luckily, we arrived during a service. A great memory for all.

Great location, lovely people and good breakfasts but be warned that some of the rooms have no windows. I didn't realize that would be the case. I knew they would be small but no natural light was too much. Room 519 but I assume from the design many more. Very well priced though.

Clean, modern and fresh. Rooms were very small. For two people with 2 large luggage bags it made it quite hard to maneuver. Also, two people staying in a room and only one towel was provided? 
Other than that, friendly staff and good breakfast options.

Excellent hotel and great concept. It is a budget price for central London. It's just round the corner from Westminster Abbey. Small, well appointed rooms. Everything is well thought out and good  quality and the staff are excellent. Definitely going again!
Nice modern room, however was very small compared to normal premier Inn rooms. Also no window. Be warned hardly any twin rooms so if this is important go elsewhere. Breakfast was lovely though.

Rooms are small but brilliantly laid out. Possibly not a recommendation for a romantic escape but for a business visit this was spot on. Lighting controls in the bed head are clever and simple to use and the smart storage around the room ensures no space is wasted. The smart TV was easier to use than many and connectivity was excellent. No tea and coffee making facilities in the rooms but they are free on the bar area. Breakfast was simple but again hit the spot, highly recommended and will use again.

The South African Royal Artillery Memorial, also known as The Royal Artillery Boer War Memorial is located on The Mall and stands in tribute to the 1083 soldiers of the Royal Artillery who died in the Second Boer War of 1899 to 1902.

The memorial features a memorial wall with bronze bronze plates listing the names of the dead. Upon the wall stands a pedestal topped with a winged figure of Peace subduing a horse representing War. 

A beautiful memorial full of respect for the soldiers who died in the war.
The South African Royal Artillery Memorial was built in memory of members of the Royal Artillery killed in the Boer War.
Excellent city accent!
Thanks to Google found out who this memorial was for

Took part in the border war from 1984 to 1987 based at Oshakati being a member of specialist counter insurgency unit KOEVOET, a branch of the South African Police. During the 1990s I was the first participant into; and last out of Angola as part of a mercenary group: Executive Outcomes.

Incredible. Have been three times and would go again and again. Don't have to be a war history buff to appreciate it. It is a true testament to this country's heroes that every Aussie needs to see, appreciate, understand and shed a tear over. It is a monument of pride and love. The best thing to see in Canberra! Was very moved. Warning: plan ahead for a DAY outing as there is so much to see! Wonderful memory!

More than a memorial or a view. The museum is fantastic, thoroughly informative, full of everything you would ever want.

Absolutely massive, put aside a few hours to explore at a steady pace. It's worth every minute and equally pass on appreciation to all who have given their lives or continue to do so within the forces. Highly recommended, amazing artifacts, vehicles, planes, soap etc everything! Perfectly done time capsule, just try not to miss a room. 

Definitely recommend and it's FREE!

I've never visited a place like this before! I was totally moved by the details presented at the memorial. 

It takes on an average a whole day to go through each section. Please keep more than a day for the visit. 

Please bring kids, if you have any! 

Loved it and will visit again for sure 🙂

Absolutely amazing experience. It is definitely a must see and do if you’re in Canberra or nearby. The travel into the city is so easy and it’s such a worth it attraction. You could spend so long in there, so make sure you leave yourself an hour at the absolute minimum. Such a great place.

A must visit for all tourists, schools and families. I had the privilege of visiting here as part of a visiting school group and was astounded as to the level of detail portrayed through their exhibitions. This place is a national treasure. The feeling you get while inside has to be experienced. Plenty of parking nearly. It's a definite destination for anyone planning a visit to the ACT.

The Machine Gun Corps Memorial is a memorial that stands in tribute to the casualties of the British casualties of the Machine Gun Corps in the First World War. It's located on the same roundabout as the Royal Artillery Memorial, Australian War memorial, the New Zealand War Memorial and the monuments to Wellington.

The memorial consists of a bronze statue of the biblical David. David stands with one hand on his hip and the other resting on Goliath's oversized sword. On either side of David, on lower flaking plinths are two bronze sculptures of Vickers machine guns wrapped in laurels, the symbol of victory and honour. The rear of the memorial tells us that sadly of the 159,000 soldiers who served in the corps, nearly half became casualties.

A sad, but worthy memorial.

If you have the time to sit for even five minutes to enjoy the view and feel the atmosphere here, you will have won a lot of London's charm, its history, the wonderful delight. from the tour, indescribable .... I recommend hot! 5 stars

Also known as The Boy David by Francis Derwent Wood,the statue is a memorial dedicated to the casualties of the Machine Gun Corps in the First World War.It records that the Machine Gun Corps was formed in October 1915 and disbanded in 1922; in that time, some 11,500 officers and 159,000 other ranks served in the Corps, of whom 1,120 officers and 1,671 other ranks were killed, and 2,881 officers and 45,377 other ranks wounded, missing or prisoners-of-war. The high casualty rate of the Corps, nearly 30%, arose from the exposed position from which it typically fought, leading to its nickname, "The Suicide Club". 
The Machine Gun Corps Old Comrades' Association holds an annual observance in May and a memorial service on Remembrance Sunday in November each year.

The Machine Gun Corp Memorial, also referred to as the Boy David Memorial, is one of several commemorative monuments found at the southeast corner of Hyde Park. 

This is an interesting monument dedicated to the machine gunners who lost their lives during WWI. The memorial was designed by Francis Derwent in 1925 and features a young David, hence the name. On both sides of the statue figure, you will see Vickers machine guns encased in bronze. 

The memorial makes a nice addition to the collection that can be found at this area of the city and can be quickly seen for those who intend to spend time in this area of the city. 

Other monuments here include the the Wellington Arch, Duke of Wellington Statue, Royal Artillery Memorial, New Zealand Memorial, Australia Memorial and across the street in Green Park, you can see the Bomber Command Memorial.

Interesting monument commemorating the huge number of casualties suffered by the Machine Gun Corps in WW1. Known as the 'Suicide Club'. They won a large number of honours. They covered the Infantry as they moved forward and remained behind to cover any withdrawal, hugely brave men.  Formed 1915 ended 1922.

A very old Catholic church located at Victoria London. It's got  beautiful mosaic paintings on the interior walls. The seats didn't appear too old though but the altar was beautiful. A mass had just ended and numerous candles had been lit. It was peaceful and quiet.

Touristy yet homely. A beautiful and well maintained edifice gifted to our generation by history. Worth visiting. Worth attending Mass. Go online and find the Mass Times. I suggest you attend and of the sung Masses. The singing is just breath taking .

Encompassing! Easily takes the common observer back to a much different time. The knowledge of bits of Latin will absolutely help as that's what most of the carvings, on the historical stones that have been brought and established here, are. The quietness that  is kept by the respectful travellers who visit but also the faithful who pay their tribute of respect, is an important attribute. There are usually so many people inside and such a busy, relentless, noisy reality right outside the door that makes the quietness kind of divine.
The Sung Mass is awesome. I love the opportunity to attend Mass every day and throughout the day. The multiple side Chapels are great. Confessions are available always. Spiritually uplifting.

Beautiful service! I have been a Catholic my whole life so being able to enjoy a service in a different country is a real blessing, the priest was lovely and had a beautiful sermon, the cathedral itself was incredible such detail in the mosaic work. Well worth the visit.

Amazing preservation of a truly historic place.  One of the rooms was virtually untouched from the last day of the warning.  Churchill's presence is felt throughout.  You are provided with an audio guide and move from tableau to tableau.  There is also a museum dedicated to the man himself.  If you are at all remotely interested in WWII history, this is essential viewing.

There's a lot going on at this place, in a good way. I would recommend only going if you have a good few hours to dedicate, unless you're only mildly interested (which is cool, too). But yeah, it's a really detailed museum. Lots of reading and some interactive stuff. There aren't a ton of places to sit down, so be prepared to be on your feet a bit.

What a great place!
It had been on my list to visit for many years.

The museum and exhibit is very well kept.
There are many interactive features available 

The audio tour is very detailed 

Historically preserved

Very well laid out 

I highly recommend everyone to visit this!
(Book online!)

What a fantastic place. Great place to visit. The audio tour is  very detailed and the place is very well laid out. It's historically well preserved, and has loads of information. Recommend to book on line. And leave plenty of time to take it all in.
One of Londons top attractions.
Amazing learning experience.  The entire exhibit is very well done.  Plan on 2-3 hours.  The audio tour is included with your ticket and is great.  We had our kids 12 and 14.  We all enjoyed it.

I like it here, some great food to be had in restaurant's and a number of coffeehouses which are good for either take-away lunches and/or meeting friends over coffee. Several shops including an M&S make this area buzz with people and well linked by the Victoria underground and train station. There are also some fantastic buildings to be admired all around Cardinal Place. Recommended for many reasons to visit.

Excellent architecture; superb views; excellent boutiques and cafes; central to buses and trains going into the city.

New extension to the underground station link Victoria.

Wide, spacious and bright. Near the theatre opposite Victoria main line. Especially in the warmer months, a walk around the shops nearby and then a coffee at a choice of cafes before heading for Victoria Square could be an option before seeing a play at the theatre.

A very nicely maintained Place. 

#cleanercity #natureinthecity
Great place to get food and shows the footy in the evenings. Now has covered seating areas so protected from the rain and warm in winter.

Quick and convenient for grabbing lunch etc while on a break from the office. Transport connections are great especially as the underground has an entrance and exit there. 
Good selection of shops and restaurants

Big standard covered shopping precinct. Could do with a few more take away focused food outlets rather than the hordes of sit down restaurants it has. 

Pleasant enough, if often very busy. There is a food market on a Thursday which is reasonably decent.

Great location, lovely people and good breakfasts but be warned that some of the rooms have no windows. I didn't realize that would be the case. I knew they would be small but no natural light was too much. Room 519 but I assume from the design many more. Very well priced though.

Clean, modern and fresh. Rooms were very small. For two people with 2 large luggage bags it made it quite hard to maneuver. Also, two people staying in a room and only one towel was provided? 
Other than that, friendly staff and good breakfast options.

Excellent hotel and great concept. It is a budget price for central London. It's just round the corner from Westminster Abbey. Small, well appointed rooms. Everything is well thought out and good  quality and the staff are excellent. Definitely going again!
Nice modern room, however was very small compared to normal premier Inn rooms. Also no window. Be warned hardly any twin rooms so if this is important go elsewhere. Breakfast was lovely though.

Rooms are small but brilliantly laid out. Possibly not a recommendation for a romantic escape but for a business visit this was spot on. Lighting controls in the bed head are clever and simple to use and the smart storage around the room ensures no space is wasted. The smart TV was easier to use than many and connectivity was excellent. No tea and coffee making facilities in the rooms but they are free on the bar area. Breakfast was simple but again hit the spot, highly recommended and will use again.

There are usually so many people inside and such a busy, relentless, noisy reality right outside the door that makes the quietness kind of divine.
