Beautiful service! I have been a Catholic my whole life so being able to enjoy a service in a different country is a real blessing, the priest was lovely and had a beautiful sermon, the cathedral itself was incredible such detail in the mosaic work. Well worth the visit.
Decent fish and chips a few minutes walk from Victoria Station. Very friendly staff and good service. They have a large restaurant or takeaway.

This is a Busy fish and chip shop located close to Victoria Station that is a classic take away at the front with a large cafe alongside. What makes it special is the fresh fish they use that comes from Billingsgate Market so not only are there the British classics like cod but also oysters, scallops, and other seafood.

The food IS super fresh. The portion size for the large order of fish and chips are really large. The batter is crunchy; the fish is fresh and tender. The sauce is wonderful. Delicious! Services are really good and fast. Really worth your money for the best fish and chips!

We had a late lunch yesterday and both opted for plaice and chips. Quite the best we've ever had! One small criticism - the tartare sauce wasn't tart enough,  it needs something to make it stronger. First class!
Who doesn't love lobster thermidor?! Fantastic food and very attentive helpful staff.  Top marks!

My favourite Korean restaurant in London, food is consistently good (have been here a number of times!) and staff are friendly. Would recommend booking a table where possible as walk-ins at peak time usually have a waiting time as it gets pretty busy!
One of the better Korean restaurants I have ever had in London. The Korean fried chicken were very tasty and so was the seafood pancake. Good customer service and cosy. I'll definitely go again.

This is a lovely small restaurant that serves some excellent food at reasonable prices.  The waiting staff were helpful and explained what some of the dishes were when asked.  It was very busy, and people were also waiting to be seated.  I would recommend booking a table if at all possible.
What an absolute find. One of the most delicious meals and excellent value for money (especially given the very generous portion sizes). Will absolutely be back.
Really great Korean food. Pretty crowded as it's not a big place, but the staff handle everything quite well. Enjoyed my experience and will probably visit again.

9/10 one of the best Indian restaurants I have ever ever eaten at. The staff are extremely helpful. If someone told me this is a Michelin star restaurant I would not correct them. The restaurant is inside a former library and this is so well incorporated that it makes the ambience of this restaurant feel more comfortable. Prior reservations recommended.

My friend Red Rage Roger and I visited the restaurant as we are working our way around London visiting some of the allegedly  best restaurants around. 
Paulina our waitress was extremely friendly and helpful, the other staff were pleasant.
The food was very tasty I must say. A £27 a head set lunch menu meal turned into a £65 a head meal when we added house wine and desert but we still felt it was good. 
Red Rage was have a particularly bad day but by the end of the meal he had cheered up. 
So to conclude the food was very good, interesting room and ambiance, the staff were ok but not of Michelin quality so a little work is required there.

I've visited three times for lunch, and the food and service has always been exceptional. Inventive, modern meals that leave you wanting more. Plus it's a beautiful venue inside. An all round excellent experience.

Very good food and a fairly extensive wine list. The restaurant has kept features of the original library, including books, which makes for a nice atmosphere. Can be a bit noisy when busy, which seems to be a lot of the time. Booking a table is recommended. A bit overpriced, I suppose that is due to the location.
First time to London and came here on a busy Saturday night. Manager sat us at bar for a cocktail then seated us. Food and service was dynamic - will definitely be back!

Wow! What an amazing place. If you want things that taste fantastic brought to you in small portions without having to order. If you are happy to trust the wonderful chef with your culinary needs. Go now and be blown away. 😲

The food was great and the service was truly excellent. When we arrived, the place was extremely busy and when it appeared that we wouldn't be able to get our table at the time of our reservation, the whole staff went above and beyond to make sure we would have a good time despite the wait. It was a awesome customer experience and I will definitely go back.

Absolutely delightful dining experience. I couldn't fault a single dish. My dining partner and I opted to try everything on offer and we were treated to eighteen mouthwatering courses with a good balance of pork, fish, seafood and vegetables. The duck as a main course was lovely! And the wine yum yum yum!

Disappointing and overpriced. Their food is sightly better in taste and looking than any random Chinese takeaway with ten times the price. The restaurant itself is roughly decorated with very tiny washrooms. If you are keen on having Chinese near Victoria,  choose A.Wong instead.

Just to clarify the owner's response, the service I had was all good, and nothing went wrong. I believe I was treated well during the dinner and paid extra tips for the nice staff. But my review here is genuine about the food, which is unfortunately indeed no better than any Chinese restaurant I tried, and more expensive than the vast majority of them. I did spend time on every dish to have a fair opinion. This is not a complaint, just a simple review about food.
We had the 'leave-it-to-us' menu and it was such an amazing dining experience! All dishes were perfectly cooked and full of flavour.

We had the most amazing dinner ever. The service was impeccable, very professional and friendly. The staff made us feel so warm welcome. Superstar cuisine and fabulous interior. I will definitely go back there again! Truly recommend to everyone. 
Thank you, Wiltons!

The best restaurant in London! The service was impressive. The staff made me feel like home. And what can I say about the food...  The dover sole just blew my mind! The most delicious fish I have ever tried. Highly recommend! Thank you, Wiltons!

A Quintessential British interior with excellent food and service. A must-try for fish lovers and for those who are looking for an excellent selection of wine. Extremely expensive, but worthwhile on a special occasion.

Love it here; great place to have some of the freshest seafood available. Oysters on the 1/2 shell are spectacular, and the Dover Sole prepared any way that you'd like are my favorites. It is the only restaurant in London that I've had the sole prepared as a fried goujons and let me tell you it inspires!!
Wilton’s is so good they could charge double.  Amazing food and service.  All dishes are done exquisitely and are worth every penny

I love the common. A haven of countryside in the midst of London. Great trees to climb, places for picnics, a multitude of routes both in the woods and on paths. Den building is great with kids, as well as discovering secret ponds amongst the trees. Very picturesque. Cheering bird life too. The windmill and tea room complement the more wild nature of the common. Note that paths do get muddy so appropriate footwear recommended.
And dont forget there is a free 5k park run from the windmill every Saturday morning at 9am. Flat but lovely running through the trees.

A park that has many memories of 3 generations for me. The lake is a flash of some of those memories. Regardless, even if I never had no familiarity with the park, it is a great place to relax with family and children and an example of London's typical beautiful parks
Feels like in the middle of no where. But suddenly you found a great windmill in the centre of the park. The pond is great too.
My favourite common. Plenty of space and a diverse amount of flora. Stretching from woodlands on one side to grassland on the other with birch forests between. Love it
A beautiful park with lots of lovely areas to explore. Great for dogs and picnics. Great open areas and magical wooded areas.  Has a horse riding track and lots of places to sit and rest.
Loved the gluten free orange and mandarin cake. Perfect with a coffee after a mucky dog walk 😁.
Very pleasant experience. And the park is amazing.

nice place to visit good for walking running cycling and family gathering... windmill has nice history and good to show little ones how the old mill was working thay can also play with some bits inside
Worth a stop in if you're walking by - a iniqur attraction and bit of histoey. It''s definitely the only windmill museum I've ever been to! And it's free.
It's a nice mill located in a nice woodland good for nature walks, also the coffee shop serves nice reasonable food and coffee.

Even on a cold day great place to visit. We went when there was an open fire so we're able to stay warm with a few bottles of beer. Higly recommend all year round. If you do have time visiting park and the hotel you can spend a few hours there.

Really nice park. Full of flowers and birds. Quite a plain walk suitable for most of the people. However when it rains it becomes quite muddy and slippery so be sure to wear proper shoes. This is close to a bigger park that is also free to visit.
Little haven near the big city. Quiet and peaceful. Hasn't changed in 50 years. The aviary needs a good clean though, please, I could hardly see the birds.
Beautiful park with a woods section and different gardens.  You can walk your dog here and it's a really lovely spot, very tranquil away from the main lawn and hotel/house.
What a beautiful place.  The grounds are stunning and the afternoon tea was scrumptious.

Top pizza in Wimbledon. Excellently priced authentic Italian pizza. Portions are great too. Don't order the large by yourself! House wine is also very palatable and well priced. Very busy though, always try to book, but worst case turn up on the door, tell them you will be quick and they can be quite accommodating.

The pizza is ok and definitely enormous- we shared one between 2 very hungry girls and we couldn't finish! It's not the best Italian pizza I had tho, they didn't use fresh mozzarella.
But the place is lovely, all the staff seems to be Italian. There are some wooden decoration inside and fairy lights outside, I bet the atmosphere in the night might be pretty magical.
The place seems to be very popular and busy. It has 2 floors so enough room for everyone!

Really love this place, such a good atmosphere, amazing food and the staff are always so friendly. It was so busy last time we went and the food still came in really good time and the staff were still smiling. Been multiple times and will always be back :)
Always love this place. Fantastic wood fired pizzas, brilliant staff. It may be no frills/unchanged since the 60s but that's all part of the charm - a true institution in Wimbledon.
Very friendly and good portion sizes. Nice Italian food.  They have lots of tables so it has quite a buzz when it's busy. I phoned up to book a table as the online form didn't seem to work.

The reason for one star less is shifting from nicely suiting copper glasses for water and regular water to plastic bottles :-(. Very disappointing to see more restaurants taking up more usage of single use plastic while there are more and more awareness drives to reduce the same.
That said, the restaurant for its purpose, I would rate it 5*s 
Tasty food, large portions, quick and friendly staff. Even the waiting time and crowd (which is the situation most dining hours) is managed well.

Visited this place as I heard lot of things about  the same... It matched expectations completely. Tasty and authentic south Indian  food with mouth watering varieties of chutneys..not to forget,  service  and ambience  were also great...
Great food with great flavors. The idly texture is just a next level. Steamed dosa just explode in the mouth. Definitely the sweets, tangy, spicy n yummy chutneys are the heroes on the table.

Over hyped establishment for breakfast. Tastes the same as a breakfast vendor down your street. If you want to spend an extra 100 bucks for no damn reason other than sitting on a sofa while being served, then go for it. Average at best. You can't be charging ₹180 for a mango milkshake and serve a shake with artifical syrup in it and expect a decent outcome. Can't recommend.
Nice place for a family dinner. Good ambience also. Tried the North Indian thali. The food kept coming and coming as it was unlimited. Great service too. Pricing is $$.

Don't listen to all these negative reviews saying the portion sizes are too small. The portion sizes are perfect and you pay for the fantastic quality. The service was great and I will certainly be returning.
Sure the restaurant was slightly empty, but this was on a Monday night.
Lovely manager, very well mannered staff, and I highly recommend the sweet and sour pork, it was absolutely amazing.
Very nice chinease food. HIGHLY RECOMMENDED CHICKEN SATAY

One of my favourite restaurants. Love the atmosphere, staff and most importantly the food. The portions appear small but there's usually more that what meets the eyes. Food is also fairly pricey compared to other chines restaurants.

Needs a refresh

Having visited again recently for the first time in a long while, I was saddened to see the place a shadow of it's former self.

The food was ok, and unfortunately seems to make use of preservatives heavily as the next day we all had dry throats and puffy eyes. The decor too is looking very tired and there was even a dead fish in the tank that had clearly been there many days or even weeks.

Overall, quite disappointing on balance. Not sure we'd try again unless someone told us it had changed considerably.
Had a lovely dinner for my son's birthday

I haven’t in my life eaten a tough chicken till I eat at this restaurant. The complimentary WiFi voucher that is for 45min doesn’t work but gives you an indication of how long you will wait for your food. I can not recommend this restaurant, not from point of view of food nor atmosphere
One of the best restaurants in hawassa. The place is clean, cozy, and convenient. The pizza was good also.
Great place for modern Italian restaurant service in hawassa and Arbaminch
Tasty food, both Italian and Ethiopian
A very nice restaurant with a fair price on the menu. Nevertheless, the service you get from the waitresses in not to the right standards.

Fantastic food and fast delivery. I’ve eaten in and got takeaway from here many times and I’m never disappointed. Will return again. Top food, some of the best Turkish / kebab food I’ve ever had. Recommend.

So I tried to use deliveroo and it had a hiccup and stuck at "confirming order" for about 30 minutes. I cancelled the order and tried to look for something else (I was hangry at that point). Straight away I got a call from Ambience explaining the situation - placed the order over the phone and had it delivered in less than 20 minutes! Five stars for the customer service, and five stars for the food too - both quality and quantity were great.

We came in for late lunch with our taste card. We were initially told that we have to order startes and mains to be able to use the tastecard which is completely  not true as we should be able to order just mains. We then ordered starters and mains, our mains were supposed to be served with chill sauce and salad. We had to ask for the sauce and salad came when we were already half done with our mains. When we asked for the bill even though we showed the tastecard, the bill came without a discount. The waiter was nice through and starters were delicious. Mains were cold and pretty tasteless. Tables were sticky and side plates were dirty.
Nice place to eat. Friendly staff and the food tasted amazing 💯👌🏾 but I think the portions are a bit small for the price
Probably the best takeout we've ever ordered. The food is restaurant quality despite being delivery. They provided multiple complimentary dishes and desserts all of which were magnificent. 10/10
Had plenty of Thai food over the years but I have to say mai thai is absolutely amazing. So authentic, so much flavour and cooked to perfection. Definitely be back. Wayne from South Wales 👍
It was delicious, we had the set meal for two, just about managed to eat it all. The waitress was friendly and helpful and the service was really good.

I'm really sad to say our visit to Mai Thia was very disappointing. We had a set meal. Our starters we lovely but we had a 'soup' and main dishes were basically tasteless except for the beef dish which had an overpowering aniseed flavour. Lemongrass had been chopped into the dishes therefore every mouthful you had, you were picking the hard lemongrass out. I did mention to the waitress this wasn't to my liking but she said that's what Thia food is like! The dessert was banana fritters, and like the starter thus was nice. I love Thia food and have had the pleasure of eating in a few Thia restusrants but Mai Thia really has a different take on This food!! If this was your first experience of Thia food, I don't think you would want to eat Thia again.
Wonderful food and service, plus free parking outside.
Lovely authentic Thai restaurant. Friendly staff, generous portions, great food. Nice laid-back vibe -- a lovely neighbourhood restaurant.

Food really good. Service was amazing as always...played some music for my birthday and gave a card trick and some free shots! I ordered a lasange which was great but also really enjoy their gnocchi or lamb cutlets and potatoes. Rated amazing!

Fantastic evening. Good was great and service was great too. Waiters very chatty, one was singing and playing the saxophone! Our evening was complete with my husband getting a candle in his banoffee pie and then shown a couple of tricks. Both very clever.

First time visiting this restaurant for a family birthday. Lovely evening, great atmosphere and food was nice. Only negatives were that the tables are far too close to each other, literally back to back with other diners but I guess it's money over comfort. Also, a £20 service charge was added to our bill which is fine as we were a group booking but there was no mention of this beforehand or on the website like the majority of other restaurants do. Would be courteous to do so.

Feels like they're going for an aesthetic of an Italian without backing it up.

Music was overly loud and in your face.

Wait was too long.

When it did come the some of the pasta was stuck together. This was removed from the bill which was appreciated but shall not be returning.

The food was not as advertised in the menu. Not a single member of staff cared enough to ask how our meal was. It was pretty obvious that we had not eaten even half of what was on our plate. They staff are slow and obnoxious we waited forever to get drinks. This place used to be fantastic, it must have new management. I will not be returning.

Nice ambience with both bench and table seating. Service was efficient and quick.
Good size portions and the first mouthful took me back to the taste of local food in Thailand. A definite recommendation in itself. My tasty vegetarian rice dish was served in a wooden box that kept it hot throughout the meal. 
Unfortunately there were few pure vegetarian choices (some of the choices are helpfully flagged up on the menu with a symbol denoting the presence of fish/shrimp in the cooking), only one or two if you don't want spicy food.
Despite the above, I would go back again to eat. I went on a whim, sat down, ordered food, food came, it was good, very satisfying, paid and left. Exactly what I wanted.
Not a place for an intimate date over a lingering meal but good place to grab a meal.
Food is always nice but had a long wait to be served drinks and again to order our main. It was a Saturday evening and quiet busy so if you want an in and out meal visit on the week days.
Good food, reasonable prices, nice atmosphere. I ordered spicy special friend rice with slurp juice! 😋

I typically get takeaways from them as I live in the vacinity, though I have dined inside the establishment.

Think of it as fast casual establishment with table service.

There is a variety of similar cuisines, Japanese, Chinese and Thai. Covering all the popular dishes of each.

The food quality is of a good standard.

Really big portions and tasty food. Went at a very quiet time so the service was very quick. A good selection available, the mixed platter starter was very nice and good value. Only downside is £3 for prawn crackers - however not bad prices for the portion size of flavourful food. Will return!

If you want to try a good traditional English breakfast, here's the place!!

The sausages and bacon are cooked to perfection; the egg yolk creamy and the hash brown done nicely. Baked beans are the same everywhere but this tea room makes breakfast how you'd expect.

The seating area outside is in itself inviting. Whilst having breakfast in a rural setting is poetry in itself!!  Interior-wise, the seating area is like a well-maintained tea room, spacious, lively with the hum of conversation and rural with a view onto the commons.

A nice vibe with morning runners meeting up or families getting together for that much needed morning coffee and cake.  

It's difficult to choose between the breakfast and a good selection of cakes.

The entrance is wheelchair chair accessible  with space for a wheelchair in the seating area both inside and out.

Good for family and groups.  I can't see a gluten free or diary free signage on the counter but there could be alternatives provided on request. 

Excellent customer service and ambience.

Many Congrats!!

Excellent customer service and ambience.

Many Congrats!!
I feel like I live at this place! Really good value for money and good food. I love working my dog around the forest then heading to the cafe for coffee and lunch... Good times!
Great little spot to pop in for refreshments after having a good walk through Wimbledon Common. Decent cake selection along with hot and cold food too. Pretty cosy inside when it's cold outside!
Quirky little café with hand painted map of Wimbledon on the walls.  Great place for a light lunch. Handy for the Wimbledon Windmill and walks on the common

Has multiple courts (20+) and of course the central court is as beautiful as a pearl. 

The central court can seat more than 15,000 spectators. ((Wish I could watch a match there one day.)) The public ballot, for the tickets, is open from September to December every year.

The club has 370 full members and around 150 honorary members. Becoming a member is very cheap ((just £99 per year)) and fairly easy ((you just need a reference from 3 existing full members, wait for one of the existing members to relinquish their membership due to death or otherwise, the wait generally lasts about 20 years)). 

All the courts are very well maintained with all the sophisticated instruments.

You should visit even if you are not a tennis buff. So very well maintained. Good guides to take you around. The entry fee includes the guided tour. You will watch every Wimbledon open after seeing this place.

I loved the experience.  Such an intriguing history when it comes to the world of tennis
 The entire tour was great and our guide, what an awesome person he was. Definitely has all the history at his fingertips. The paraphernalia shop was also great.....selling branded history in different forms....you will definitely get a gift of your choice if you are a tennis lover.....was quite difficult for me to choose a gift because everything there was attractive.....ended up getting a fridge magnet, a mug and keyrings......Do not forget to do a museum tour as well.
Definitely worth a visit. Ticket includes museum and an excellent guided tour. See my Wimbledon review for more details and pics

Absolutely fantastic experience! Very well organised tour which was highly informative and interactive. To see and be part of something historic is amazing. The cafe inside is quite good and I loved their chicken and mushroom pie :) definitely worth a visit any time

A must stop for the best French Onion Soup I've ever had!  The pork buttons & beef wellingtons appetizers were also right up at the top! The Classic Ceasar was the best we had in town complete with a pickled green bean! Our waiter was amazing, informative & helpful not only about the restaurant but the town as well. This is the oldest restaurant in Banff & well worth a visit!

Just had our fourth meal here during our 2 week stay.  Excellent place. So relaxing and the staff are brilliant. I only suggest that you increase the pool tables by another 1 or 2. Plenty of room. When we visit in the summer we will come back through. Thanks for our meals .
From what I remember a really fun bar! The cod was delicious

Where to start this little dive has to be my favorite place delicious food great staff good music! 
Overall a great time!
Especially on $4 beer night ;)
Got to see my favourite bands here! Not the best if you are short and it’s a full house, but people are always nice, drinks and staff are great!
